loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Carmela requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, chocolate drinks, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

Carmela has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, chocolate drinks, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is 43 years old, hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing the service of making clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Yasmin ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Yasmin has requested for a loan amount 50000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Sosan

texts.en:
Sosan is a 35-year old married woman living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruit. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

Sosan hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en: Maseiga is 48 years old with 6 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Maseiga requested for a loan to buy chemicals, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2007 and she will use her profit to expand her business..

loans.use: to buy chemicals, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel,

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a single young woman. She lives with her parents in the north part of Tajikistan. Manzura has been busy with sewing more than 5 years. She sews varieties of national women's dresses. Manzura also has additional income from animal husbandry. Manzura works hard and earns for living. Her parents are glad to have such daughter as Manzura.

Now, Manzura plans to buy a new sewing machine and in this way to make better the quality of service. Manzura is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 32-year-old married mother of one child. Almost a year ago, she started managing her husband's toy shop, as he traveled abroad seeking a better income. Ahlam and her husband are working hard to cover their family's increasing living expenses.

Today, Ahlam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with new collection of toys and gifts to satisfy her customers' special demands. This loan is very important for it will help diversify her products and attract new customers.
Ahlam hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of requested toys and gifts.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa, a 46-year old woman who earns a living operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic house hold commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and variety of canned goods.

She is married and has five children. Of which two are still attending school. She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol. She also raises hogs and engages in growing rice.

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store, fertilizers and pig feed. In that way, it may improve the content of her store and improve the yield of the farm.

Josefa is grateful for your support and in return, she would like to manage it properly to become productive.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Marevilla

texts.en:
Marevilla is 39 years old and has three children. Marevilla is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Marevilla is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marevilla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marevilla has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marevilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.en:
Faridun is 18 years old freshman in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA. He thinks that in the age of technology it is very important to receive a qualitative education. With the help of qualitative education he will be able to be an owner of his life and destiny. It disappoints him that not all people are available to get a good education and these people are a large layer of his society.

Faridun is from Tajikistan, where the financial problems touch each second family.
His parents are employed, but the average salary is about 150 USD per month. The salary of his parents go to the daily expenses and their education, his two younger siblings are school-children. They study in 1st and 11th grades.

Faridun realizes that his parents can’t afford his university tuition fee and he may lose his chance to study at AUCA. He doesn’t want to be one of those, who commit crimes, become prostitute or practice another illegal activity to earn money just because of the lack of higher education or support. Now he is applying for a Kiva loan, asking Kiva lenders to assist him in fundraising, what will allow him to open new doors before him and let him experience the new educational world in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees in the Software Engineering Program.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 32-year-old lady living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She will be a responsible mother until her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving auto rickshaws for many years; their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. Her husband has to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem.

Therefore, Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy the auto rickshaw body.

Farzana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Gwedolyn

texts.en:
Gwedolyn is 53 years old and married. Gwedolyn works very hard to provide for them.

Gwedolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gwedolyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, salt, eggs, detergent soap, juice, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Gwedolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 41 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Maghamba

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Maghamba est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè. Ayant six enfants à charge, Maghamba est une femme qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en préparant de la bouillie faite à base du maïs et accompagner des gâteaux faites à base de la farine de blé. Maghamba demande ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs et de farine du blé. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Maghamba va pouvoir répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir ainsi une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Maghamba, 50 years old, is a married woman who lives in Agoè. Raising six children, Maghamba is a woman who struggles to see her children flourish. She prepares porridge made from maize and sells cakes made of wheat flour to go with it.

Maghamba is asking for this loan to order bowlfuls of maize and wheat flour. With the profit she will make, Maghamba is going to satisfy the needs of her customers and have a good deal of financial autonomy to help her children with the education.

loans.use: to buy 35 bowlfuls of maize and 22 bowlfuls of wheat flour.

loans.name: Wahbi

texts.en:
Wahbi is a young man who lives in Khanyounis, Gaza Strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea was to transport goods and inventory between traders in the rickshaw.

A few years ago, Wahbi bought a new rickshaw and became famous with loyal customers. Now Wahbi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Wahbi can work more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.

Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to make some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita grows corn crops within her local community. She is 61 years of age, married and have six children. Five of her children are married and one is still studying. Her husband is a farmer.

Teresita and her husband have been running their corn plantation for 30 years and this year it was affected by typhoon “Lando”. That’s the reason why she is asking for loan amounting PHP 30,000 to buy corn seed and fertilizer for another plantation. She's hoping that her financial assistance will be granted to be able for her to start her corn farming business again.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer and other items for use in farming.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is 19 years old freshman in the Psychology Program at AUCA. Her dream is to open her own psychological center and help people to solve their social problems. She is an active and communicative person that gets a pleasure from talking to people and finding solutions to their problems.

Venera is from the South part of Kyrgyzstan and came to study at the one-year Preparatory Program of AUCA in 2014. That time she got a full scholarship and was able to study and live at the charge of donor. After successfully graduation this 1-year program, she was able to enter AUCA as freshman, but this time her family has to pay for her higher education.

She has a big family: her grandparents, parents, herself and two younger brothers. The grandparents are retired and her parents are public institution officers. Two younger brothers go to school. Venera says that even her both parents are employed; their salaries don’t allow them to pay for her higher education, at one of the highly ranked American university.

It is hard for them to cover Venera’s tuition fee, so applying for a financial aid. Venera and her family are happy to know about AUCA’ partnership with Kiva and glad to get interest free loan for their daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in Psychology

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old with 1 child ages 14 years old and a hard working entrepreneur.
Josephine operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) to help with their everyday expenses. She sell assorted items like candies, snack foods, noodles and other basic items in her community.

Josephine wanted to expand and add other items like soft drinks, sugar and cooking oils that sell easily in her community but the lack of capital prevents her from doing so.

Josephine is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 17,000 to buy 5 cases of soft drinks, sack of sugar, container of cooking oil, canned goods and other items to sale to her store.

Josephine is hoping to improve her store more to increase her income as she works hard everyday to provide for her child education and for her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of soft drinks, sack of sugar, container of cooking oil, canned goods and other items to sale to her store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 40-years old married woman and mother of two children, living in the area of Lahore Pakistan; she is very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and been using wooden planks, bamboos which has been depreciated time to time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Mariam requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboos to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband would earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboos etc  for her husband's to  providing sheltering services.

loans.name: Boubara

texts.fr: Boubara est une femme âgée de 44 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Boubara est une marchande de produits alimentaires  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Boubara désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de pates complet  en vue de mieux revendre puis tirer plus de profit afin de bien contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Boubara is a woman of 44 who lives in Agoè. Married and the mother of two children, Boubara sells foodstuffs. She stocks up twice a month in the market and sells her goods in front of her house.

Boubara is requesting this loan to cover her purchase of whole-wheat pasta so as to make more sales and contribute to managing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 24 bags of whole-wheat pasta.

loans.name: Inggit

texts.en:
Inggit is a 51-year-old widow and has been selling cakes for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Inggit will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is been married for over 8 years and has one son. She and her husband have their own house. Adelia makes cheese which she learned about when she was a child, so she has a lot of experience. Besides she is helped by her husband

Adelia needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will be very helpful for her business. Adelia would like to have a bigger farm. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow so she can make cheese

loans.name: Abadahigwa Group

texts.en:
Gatarina is a married 50-year-old woman with three children who are between ten and 17 years old. She is the leader of ABADAHIGWA Group and is pictured sitting with a child holding an envelope in her hands. Gatarina works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life.

For the past 4 years Gatarina has sold items in a small shop. Every morning Gatarina opens her shop at 8 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Sometimes she is required to venture outside of her shop to sell her items door to door.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business buy purchasing additional inventory for her resale business. With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family and will use the remaining profit to expand her current business by purchasing various good such as: beans, rice, sugar, soap for sale.

loans.use: to purchase various good such as beans, rice, sugar, soap for sale.

loans.name: Bibikhon

texts.en:
Bibikhon is a married parent of 3 children. She was born in 1976 year. Bibikhon since childhood has been a very hardworking person and always has helped to her parents. Bibikhon is the main income provider of her family, because her husband is a migrant in Russia. She has been sewing for more than 10 years. She has a great experience in this field. Bibikhon sews a variety of women's clothes and her clients are glad.

She is asking for a loan because her daughter is ill. Bibikhon really needs to your financial support. Bibikhon and her daughter await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 27-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father of one child and the sole breadwinner for his family.
He has thirteen years of experience in barbering business, but still he can't afford to save the requested amount of money to buy his own working place and make his desired decoration, in addition to displaying several beauty needs in his own place.

His acquired loan will be invested in paying four months in advance for his shop's rent fees.
He hopes that one day he can buy his own barbering shop and improve his family's living.

loans.use: to pay four months in advance for his shop's rent  fees.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio has been a fisherman for more than 10 years now. He sells fresh fish and crabs to neighbors and local dwellers in his place. He is a 38-year-old man married man and has six children. His eldest child is 10 and the youngest is 1.

He would like to boost his livelihood and continue support the needs of his family. He decide to join Kiva to cater for his financial needs. Gregorio is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials like fishing nest, floaters and crab traps. These are tools that would make a big impact on his day to day livelihood activity.

In the future, he is looking forward to continue seek ways on how to become more efficient in handling his source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials  like fishing nets, floaters and crab traps .

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 56 years old, married and had children. They lived at Amulung. She is selling vegetables to the people in her village. Aside from selling vegetables, she also sell bags as additional source of income. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy vegetables (cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes) and also bags to sell.

In the future, Jesusa hopes to continue selling different items for income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes) and also bags to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 53 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Nieves has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from embroidery.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 44 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Luzminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Luzminda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 43 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Jocelyn has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Dairo Francisco

texts.es:
Dario, un hombre de 46 años de edad que a lo largo de su vida ha sobrevivido en una zona de bastante problemática, una zona que gira en torno a la pobreza, la desigualdad, la inseguridad, pero que con personas como Dario le están cambiando la cara, convirtiendo en una zona de oportunidades, de emprendimiento de gente de bien que trabajan honestamente por sacar adelante a sus familiar.
Desde el año 2011 Dario inició con un negocio de cría de ganado porcino, su perseverancia y constancia principalmente en momentos difíciles lo han llevado a continuar con su empleo y generar el sustento de su familia.
La paciencia que ha tenido este hombre está dando sus frutos, pues está a puertas del crecimiento, solo resta un pequeño monto de capital, razón por la cual quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la construcción de una porqueriza, cerdos, alimento.
texts.en:
In his lifetime Dario, age 46, has survived in a very problematic area. It is an area that revolves around poverty, inequality, and insecurity. However, people like Dario are changing the face of the area and converting it into an area of opportunities with the enterprise of good people who work honestly in order to get their families ahead.

In 2011 Dario started a business of raising pigs. His perserverance and determination, primarily in difficult times, have led him to continue wih his job and to generate sustenance for his family. The patience that this man has had is now paying off. He is on the threshold of growth. Only a small amount of money is left. This is the reason that he wants to request a loan to buy materials to build a pig pen, pigs, and feed.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a pig pen, pigs, and feed.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 35-year-old married father of two, who has been working in construction business specialized in plumbing services since 1996.
Tarek is a hard working man, who puts so much effort to support his family in a well managed way and provide them with the necessary living needs.He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his daughter's school tuition fees.

At the same time, he will update his business tools and machines through buying a new compressor. He hopes to continue working hard and developing his business to provide his family with better standards of living.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been a fish vendor for a long period of time. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is a 48-year-old married woman and has four children. All of her children are still attending school. On the other hand, her husband's way of earning is by means of fishing. He sells fresh fish and crabs. His catch could be a source of income and consumption, as well.

Together with her family, she lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Imelda wants to purchase more stock of fish, and fishing materials like fishing net and crab net. That serves as the tool in the road going to improvement and progress. Slowly, she could roll out her capital and also help augment the catch of her husband.

She is hoping that her livelihood will become stable as time goes by.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish and fishing materials like fishing net and crab net.

loans.name: Kunsuluv

texts.en:
Kunsuluv is a kind woman. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in life. Kunsuluv is widowed as her husband died some years ago. She has 5 children and she is the only supporter of her children. Kunsuluv more than 20 years has been busy with animal husbandry and she has a great experience in this field. Kunsuluv’s sons help her with managing the business.

She is going to buy additional cows for increasing working capital. Kunsuluv plans to develop the business and maximize profit. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 40 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. His business is farming. He has been in the business for six years. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn has been selling grocery goods in their village and is retailing coconut products like copra and charcoal to earn more income.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her retail store and is now taking a new loan to purchase more charcoal and copra to sell in volume.

With her generated income, Junalyn was able to support the financial needs of her family.

Junalyn plans to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and copra to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell. Julie has been in this business for three years.

Julie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lordes is single and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Lordes requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods such as shoes, t-shirts, blouses, dress, etc. to sell.

Lordes has been in this business for 25 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

In the future, Lordes would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods such as shoes, t-shirts, blouses, dress, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bodoubelo

texts.fr: Bodoubelo est une femme divorcée qui vit avec un seul enfant à charge. Résidant à Agoè, Bodoubelo  est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Bodoubelo demande ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de mieux revendre puis gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son enfant et subvenir aux diverses charges quotidiennes qu’elle éprouves.
texts.en:
Bodoubelo is a divorced woman who lives with her only child in Agoè. She is a used clothing seller who stocks up three times a month at the market and sells her goods under a shed roof on the side of the road.

In order to have a bigger inventory and maximize her profit while satisfying the many needs of her customers, Bodoubelo is requesting this loan to place an order for some bales of used clothing. She hopes to sell more and make profit so that she will be able to raise her child and deal with the many daily expenses they incur.

loans.use: to buy four bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Begimay

texts.en:
Begimay is 18 years old freshman in the Business Administration Program at AUCA. She dreamt to study at AUCA from the 9th grade. To enter it she has gone for free English courses and did extra-curricular activities to develop her leadership skills.

Since 2010 she attends hip-hop. She is the winner of the modern dance competition organized by Buddha Stretch, who is the founder of the Hip-Hop dance style at all. She created a group with her classmates at school and used to demonstrate her talent at concerts. Also Begimay was a participant of many charity programs. She still remembers the days, when they went to the orphanages and gave slippers and other clothes to the children, who were so happy and satisfied with the presents. Making happy them brought a lot of positive emotions and motivation to her and her peers that she started making a hand-made stuff. She understood that simple things can be done by her hand and what can be used by others for their pleasure.

Begimay was one of the best students at math at school, and maybe because of that she has chosen the BA Program. She is applying for a Kiva loan in order to help to her parents with the university tuition payment. She says that it is very expensive for them to pay by themselves and she is glad to have a chance to be a Kiva loan recipient.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in Business Administration at the AUCA.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 32 years old, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore Pakistan.

Her husband is a fruit supplier in the vegetable’s market in a nearby town, and has done do for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to retailers. He has been feeding his children and old parents from income from his business.

Nowadays the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have another sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can do maximize sales.

Therefore, Asiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables.

Asiya thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.en: Irineo is a happy married man, living with his wife and little son for over 4 years.  The couple have their own house. Irineo is a mason and his wife is a farmer. Irineo wants to help his wife so he needs a loan to buy a milking cow for the farm.  Irineo would like to produce cheese in the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow for the farm of his wife

loans.name: Ebtehal

texts.en:
Ebtehal is 29 years old, a married woman, and has three sons and three daughters. She has a secondary education. She works as a salesperson at a bookstore near her house, and her husband works in a governmental institution.

Ebtehal's family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was destroyed. They have started to rebuild the house, but they face a shortage with their budget, so Ebtehal applied for a loan to continue the work. She plans to purchase cement and windows frames for the money received. She hopes to be able to provide her children the best living conditions, and she is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

Ebtehal apologizes that for cultural reasons she can’t publish her photo online. The person who appears in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to purchase cement and windows frames for the money received, so as to provide her children the best living conditions.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children. She sells clothing and does farming.

She has been in business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is Esther's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of clothing for sale.

She will use the profits to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Early this year, 49-year-old Wilma successfully started her own business to help her family financially.

She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store where she sells a variety of goods in the town of Catigbian, Bohol.

Wilma is a married and a mother of five children; four adult and one-school-age child. She and her husband work together to make life better for their family.

Thus, her goal in life is to succeed and improve their livelihood. To do this, she needs a loan to buy commodities such as powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and drinking liquor.

loans.use: to buy buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Jelbie

texts.en:
Jelbie, 29, is a single mom who resides in Punta Miry, Balingao, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Jelbie has owned and operates a farm for many years, planting and harvesting vegetables and bananas as well as coconut. Their sale helps her make a living.

Each month she earns PHP 15,000. She requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and additional items to boost her banana plantation.

Jelbie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future she wants to make improvements to her house and help her child get a better education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and additional items for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 24 años de edad, una persona que está dando ejemplo en su pueblo, ejemplo de verraquera, de emprendimiento, de que luchar pos sus sueños tiene sus frutos.
Inició con trabajos menores, ahorro capital y compro una máquina de confección, inicio haciendo trabajamos menores y ahora trabaja de lleno en su profesión,
Este joven emprendedor hoy se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para la compra de un maquinaria para mejorar los tiempos de producción y cantidad de producción elaborada diaria, como lo son la máquina fileteadora y una máquina sesgadora, podrá generar empleo, algo que lo tiene muy motivo no descansara hasta tener una gran empresa rodeado de muchos empleados, comprar una vivienda y vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24 year-old young man. He is setting an example of determination, entrepreneurship, and that fighting for ones dreams has its rewards.

He began doing odd jobs, saved money, and purchased a sewing machine. He then started doing small sewing jobs, and now works in a completely professional capacity. This young entrepreneur is now asking for economic support to purchase a thread serger sewing machine and a cover stitch sewing machine in order to improve his production times and daily production quantities.

He will be able to provide employment, which is something that really motivates him. He will not rest until he has a great business with many employees and is able to buy a home and live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase a thread serger sewing machine and a cover stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Baha' Al-Deen

texts.en:
Baha' Al-Deen, 27 years old, is a Palestinian man from the Betonia neighborhood in Ramallah city. He is single with no kids. He chose to take a loan from ACAD so he can buy a new equipment and machines for his new medical laboratory. Baha' Al-Deen's main challenges in this stage of the business are the difficulties in buying the needed equipment and the expensiveness of this equipment.

Baha' Al-Deen plans to promote for his project to become known in his neighborhood. Finally, Baha' Al-Deen wants to thank ACAD and Kiva for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machines for his new medical laboratory

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans résidante à Agoè. Avec un enfant à charge, Kossiwa est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames  qu’elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Kossiwa désire ce prêt pour commander des calebasses de tubercules d’ignames. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Kossiwa compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de son enfant puis à son épanouissement.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a  52 year old who lives in Agoè. Kossiwa has one dependent child and is a yam tuber saleswoman. She buys her stock four times every month at the market and sells her goods by the roadside. Kossiwa requests this loan to order gourds of yam tubers. With the profit margin that she will make from good sales, Kossiwa plans to improve her service as a saleswoman and to provide for her and her child's daily needs, to improve their health and happiness.

loans.use: to buy  02 yam gourds.

loans.name: Mogoon Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Maria, a member of Mogoon women group. She is 53 years old and has 6 children. She practices maize, beans and dairy farming.

Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and enterprise development she has been able to expand her business skills. She is taking a loan from Kiva to purchase dairy feeds that will help in improving milk productivity. This will lead to more income hence be able to support her family.

She is very grateful to Kiva and hand in hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds that will help in improving milk productivity.

loans.name: Ubumwe Nyamagabe Group

texts.en:
Marie Josee is 55 years old and is married with one child. For the past nine years, she has owned and operated a business selling aubergines, carrots and onions. Due to the success of her business and her experience paying back loans with VFC, Marie Josee has been nominated as the leader of UBUMWE NYAMAGABE group and currently she has one employee to help her in her business.

In the picture of the group, she is the individual holding a book. A typical day for Marie Josee begins at 6 am, when she opens her store front. She remains there until she sells her daily inventory. If business is not good on a particular day, she will close her storefront at 5 pm. Her business and marketing plan are well organized as she has received business training from VFC over the past several years.

Marie Josee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase vegetables for sale. With the profits from this loan, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family, pay school fees for her children, get enough food for her family and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as: aubergines, carrots and onions etc for sale.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
To earn a living, 36-year-old Jenefer is engaged in buying and selling frozen goods. She successfully started this business earlier this year to help her husband financially. She and her husband, a carpenter, work hard together to raised their 13-year-old daughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy frozen goods, such as hot dogs, ham and sweetened meat.

In the future, Jenefer dreams of succeeding in her business to give her child a good life.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, ham and sweetened meat.

loans.name: Glynn

texts.en:
Glynn engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish, clams and crabs to locals in her place. Aside from fishing, she also grows seaweed as supplemental income for the entire family.

She is a 28-year-old, married woman and has five children. Her eldest child is 9, while the youngest is 1.

Glynn is asking for a loan to purchase fishing net and seaweed seedlings, and have additional capital for food vending (for a start-up). It would enable her to improve her livelihood and be able to continue support the needs of her family. It could help improve her catch and start other sources of income to become sustainable.

She is hopeful to continue handling her sources of income to become productive and to continue supporting the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and seaweed seedlings, and have additional capital for food vending (for a start-up).

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a 52-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has a 28-year-old daughter. She is well-known in their place for making dresses, gowns, curtains and costumes. Definitely, she has been running a tailoring business for more than 15 years.

For this business, she is asking for a loan amount to buy a sewing machine and cloth to help her improve her livelihood. Venancia's goal in life is to sustain her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Nichodemus

texts.en:
Nichodemus is 47 years old. He is married and blessed with eight children. His business is farming. and has's been in the business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Nichodemus will use the loan to buy spraying chemicals for his crops.

He will use the profits to expanded his business and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy spraying chemicals for his crops.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, 59, is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Marcelina has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane really enjoyed her first Kiva loan, which she paid back very quickly and hurries to have her second partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon.

Gayane lives in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region with her husband, daughter, son and retired mother-in-law. Gayane’s husband is unemployed and with him she is fully engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm, she takes care of cows, calves, lambs, sheep and chickens and she also continues her potato cultivation and all her farm products (milk, meat, cheese, curd and eggs, also potatoes and greens) she sells at the city’s wholesale market and half part of it she also uses for her family.

Gayane is hopeful that her second Kiva loan of 500.000 Armenian drams will again help her to make the purchase of fodder for her farm cattle, to be prepared for the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her farm cattle, as she must store enough fodder by getting prepared for the winter months.

loans.name: Shafaqat

texts.en:
Shafaqat is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home, as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shafaqat is popularly known in her area for her skill in sewing.

However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time. She hopes to have an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Azra Bibi

texts.en:
Azra bibi is the age of 49, mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband has a 30 year long experience of selling dried fruits in the market. Her husband also offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business.

He wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize sales of fruits. Therefore his wife, Azra bibi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess dry fruits. Azra Bibi thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy  dry fruits for her husband

loans.name: Ariyah

texts.en:
Ariyah is a 30-year-old married woman with two sons. Ariyah and her husband are pig breeders for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ariyah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with good sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 42 years old with three children ages 23, 20 and 11. Her husband works as a machine operator while she operates her store.

She used to work in a factory but because of her illness she had to stop and decided to put up a sari-sari store (grocery store) in front of her house. Leonila at first sold only candies but because of the demand of her customers and her drive to help her family, she add items like noodles, eggs and biscuits.

Leonila wanted to increase her income, but the lack of capital for her store prevents her from expanding.

Leonila is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 8,000 to buy two boxes of canned goods, shampoo, soaps, candies and snack food to sell at her store.

The loan will enable her to increase her income and help provide for her family expenses specially for her children's education.

Leonila's dream is to see her children finish their schooling; that's why she works hard even with her illness.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma earns a living by engaging in a tuba (coconut) wine vending business. She sells tuba to the neighbors in her place. She resides in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol.

She is a 29-year-old, married woman and has four children ages 2-11 years old, respectively. Her husband's source of income is by means of fishing. He sells fresh fish.

She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current source of income. Guillerma has requested a loan to buy more stock of tuba and materials for seaweed farming like soft ties, straw and pay for laborers . This could help boost her income and continue improving the efforts to become productive.

In the future, she is hopeful that she will be financially stable and also support the schooling of all her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tuba (coconut wine) and materials for seaweed farming like soft ties, straw and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, 40, is married with two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Leticia has operated her business for almost seven years. She is a very hardworking mom. All she and her husband want is to provide all the needs required for daily living and for her two children to finish their studies. This is why she is engaged in this kind of business.

Letecia is borrowing 7,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer to produce a good harvest that will result in an increase to her income. Her plan for the future is to save money for her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es: Con el firme propósito de crecer en producción y numero de palos de lulo el señor Wilson quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar de semillas y abonos para iniciar una nueva plantación de palos de lulo, su propósito es generar mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida y poder comprar artilugios y caprichos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
With the firm intention of growing his production and number of "lulo" bushes [a subtropical fruit-producing plant from South America], Wilson is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to start a new lulo bush plantation.

His goal is to generate better profits in order to improve his family's quality of life and to be able to purchase some gadgets and treats for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to start a new plantation of "lulo" bushes.

loans.name: Anabelia

texts.en:
Anabelia is 30 years old married mother of six children. Four currently attend school.

Anabelia works in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anabelia has been farming vegetables for four years and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Anabelia would like to save enough money o send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old with seven children.

Editha operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) with two of her children to help support her medication for her illness. Though her right leg is amputated, she is still working hard because her medication is expensive, and the support of her children is not enough to provide the medicines.

Editha is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy five cases of soft drinks, two boxes of noodles, coffee, sugar and other items to sell in her store.

Editha is hoping to improve her store and increase her income to help more with the continuous medication she needs for her illness.

loans.use: to buy five cases of soft drinks, two boxes of noodles, coffee, sugar and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kisakye Kiwanga Group

texts.en:
Ronald operates a mobile money business to sustain his young family.

He is a new client with Ugafode micro finance. He applied for a loan of 500000 and will use the loan to boost his business so he can serve more customers and increase his sales and profits.

Ronald is hard working and innovative. (The extra two members, extreme left of photo, are part of the group who are resting from this loan cycle.)

Ronald is so grateful that the group accepted him and to Ugafode and Kiva lenders for the support rendered to his community.

loans.use: to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Adjo  Jeanne

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec ses six enfants à charge. Adjo se bat énormément en produisant et revendant de l’huile de palme  en bidons. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la production et le revend en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des bidons d’huile de palme rouge, Adjo sollicite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et mieux revendre en vue de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire puis participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo is 39. She is married, and she lives in Agoè with her six dependent children. Adjo works energetically, producing and reselling palm oil in cans. Adjo buys the stock that she needs for the production twice a month at the market and sells her goods on an itinerant basis in the neighbouring districts. Adjo requests this loan to order cans of red palm oil to finance her supplies to make better sales and therefore to make a better profit margin.  In this way she can participate in paying the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 03 cans of red palm oil.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 33 year-old married woman. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much.

He manufactures and selling wooden furniture, such as beds, tables, etc. He started this business over fifteen years ago.

Shazia's husband had previously obtained loans for his business; he added up two previous loans to his selection for making furniture.

Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day, and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making more furniture to cope with increasing demand.

Therefore, Shazia came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for marking furniture. She hopes that this loan will help her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make more furniture.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 57-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been raising and selling hogs for a long time. Apart from hog-raising, she engages in farming. She toils the land and grows rice.

Gloria has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy fertilizers and pig feed. Her previous loan was successfully paid back in full. She is requesting a new loan to expand her business.

With this loan, she can improve the quality of hogs she is about to raise. In a few months, her farm will have a bountiful harvest and improve her financial gain.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 34, hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She support her family by means of selling fresh fish to the locals in her place. Her husband is a fisherman. Irene has sold fish for more than 10 years.

Together Irene and her husband have three school-aged children.

To improve her husband's catch, Irene decided to access loans to boost their livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net.

In the future, she is hopes to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Berny

texts.en:
Berny has been a business woman for about 10 years.

She’s an on-call massage therapist, She does not have her own wellness center or spa and this is what she aspires to have someday.

She also tops-up any mobile networks to generate another source of income. These businesses helped her sustain her needs. That’s why she’s determined to succeed in her industry. For this to take place, Berny applied for a loan of Php 10, 000 to buy products needed for her massage business.

Berny’s grateful that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) granted her previous loan request of Php 10, 000, and she considered it as God’s blessing to her. The loan that was granted enabled her to buy necessary materials for her massage business.

Berny has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group, that consist of 15 to 30 members, where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This made her become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy products needed for her massage business.

loans.name: Ma. Thelma

texts.en:
Maria Thelma, 49, is married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a native basket-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Maria Thelma has requested a loan of 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional raw materials for her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Ma. Luz requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 10 years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda Tita

texts.en:
Rosalinda Tita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda Tita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Rosalinda Tita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 30 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one child.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Consequently, he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore Uzma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Uzma is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Soumaya

texts.en:
Soumaya is a 42 year-old single lady who opened her beauty salon three years ago. She works to cover the needs and expenses of her family, that consists of two members.

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has professional skills.

Soumaya is trying desperately to develop her business, so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools which will aid her work and satisfy her customers' demands.

Soumaya hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty tools to facilitate her work.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en:
Noriniso was born in 1974. She is married and has five children. Her children are non-adults.

Noriniso has her own business deal. She has been busy with animal husbandry and farming. Noriniso has worked in this field for more than 12 years. She likes her job and works with pleasure. Noriniso’s husband helps her with managing the business.

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni, as she must buy medicines. Her husband has been ill during some years. She awaits your mercy and hopes that her lovely husband will be healthy soon.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her husband.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is the age of 49 and is living with her spouse and one child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son just set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers various types of mobile phones and accessories, and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in only a few days.

Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of available funds. He wants to increase his inventory of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just started this business and does not have more cash on hand to purchase the desired inventory. This is the reason Perveen contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son.

With the help of the loan, he can easily purchase mobiles accessories and extra recharge from various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family.

Perveen is very thankful to lenders who take an active part in loan-raising.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and extra recharge for her son's newly set up mobile shop.

loans.name: Akuele

texts.fr: Akuélé est une veuve femme âgée de 42 ans qui vit avec trois enfants à charge. Akuélé est une revendeuse de condiments et des légumes habitant à Agoè. Akuélé achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Akuélé sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des bols de petits poissons fumés et des paniers de tomates fraîches en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider l’organisation de l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akuélé is a 42-year-old woman and a widow who lives with three children in her care. She is a retailer of condiments and vegetables and lives in Agoè. She purchases her merchandise at the market twice a month and resells in a shed in front of her home. Akuélé is requesting that this loan be granted, so as to order bowls of small smoked fish and baskets of fresh tomatoes. Her aim is to do well in her sales and have a profit for providing schooling for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bowls of small smoked fish and 4 baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alicia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in to buy ingredients for her business. Alicia has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Alicia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 51-year-old married mother of one, who decided, three years ago, to start her own special traditional Saj bread business from her house to support her husband in increasing their family's income and covering their living expenses. She is well-known among her region for her special saj bread. Nada is a sacrificing mother who is working hard to improve her family's living conditions, but still her income not enough to cover any additional expenses.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's medical treatment.
Nada hopes that one day she can develop her business widely to reach a level that she has to open a separate bakery far from her house.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's medical treatments

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia and her family live a simple life in the town of Catigbian in Bohol, Philippines. They have owned a rice farm for ten years; this serves as their main source of income. In addition to this, Virginia raises pigs.

This is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She needs an amount of additional capital to buy piglets and feed. She will also buy fertilizer as well, to enhance the growth of their farm and be able to have a bountiful harvest.

Virginia is a 59-year-old woman who dreams to improve their livelihood. She also wants to save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman who engages in various businesses to earn a living. She owns a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of goods. In addition to this, she also buys and sells dried fish to the community.

Vicenta is a 40-year-old woman and a mother of six children, two adult and four school-aged-children. She dreams of a successful living in the future, where there will be an improvement in their livelihood, and to give good education to her children.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as drinks, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, and laundry soap. Lastly, she will also buy dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, and laundry soap.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita runs a buy and sell business. She aims to expand it and attract new patrons living inside and outside of her village, and she wants to expand to other locations, too.

However, there are challenges that can’t be avoided. Profits which are supposed to be used as revolving fund for the business was being used on her day-to-day expenses.

She applied for a loan of Php 10,000 to add capital for her to buy on demand products such as: accessories, umbrellas, ready-to-wear clothes and other personal items. The quality and reliability of the products should be considered as well.

Carmelita also wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and its lenders for their financial assistance. Her previous loan of Php 8, 000 made a vast impact on her business. She was able to buy items and made costumers with a variety of designs.

Carmelita believes that if you want success to come you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony. She can also share her own experience of God’s love, pay off micro finance loans and hear God’s word conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years of age and single.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through GDMPC in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sally dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, age 34, is a married woman with one school going child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una hermosa joven de  19 años de edad, vive en el municipio del Carmen de Vivoral, tiene un sueño que es comprar una vivienda propia, siempre ha gustado mucho del trabajo independiente, quiere forjar su camino y con su propio esfuerzo adquirir sus bienes.
Es por este motivo que hoy Carolina quiere pedirles un favor de mucho corazón, un apoyo económico para iniciar un negocio de salón de belleza.
El dinero será invertido en la compra de un tocador, espejo, lava-cabezas, silla de peluquería, vitrina, implementos, insumos y adecuaciones locativas.
Carolina se compromete a hacer crecer su negocio, trabaja con dedicación y esfuerzo por cumplir sus sueños y progresar.
texts.en:
Carolina is a beautiful 19 year-old young woman. She lives in the municipality of Carmen de Vivoral. Her dream is to buy her own home. She has always really liked to work independently. She wants to forge her path with her own effort and buy her own things.

For this reason, Carolina wants to ask for a heartfelt favor of economic support in order to start a beauty salon. The money will be invested in a dresser, a mirror, a hair washing station, a barber chair, a display case, tools, supplies and adaptations for the venue.

Carolina is committed to making her business grow, and working with dedication and effort in order to achieve her dreams and make progress.

loans.use: to purchase a dresser, a mirror, a hair washing station, a barber chair, a display case, tools, supplies and adaptations for the venue.

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Ayawovi est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec ses trois enfants à charge. Mariée, Ayawovi est une revendeuse d’huile rouge et de ses résidus qu’elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des bidons d’huile de palme rouge, Ayawovi sollicite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de participer au mieux les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Ayawovi, aged 34, is a woman who lives in Agoè with her three children she supports. She is married and a retailer of red oil and its byproducts. She supplies herself twice a month at the market and resells by circulating through nearby neighborhoods. To order containers of red palm oil, Ayawovi is requesting this loan to finance her supplies and to realize a good profit margin, so as to help cover family expenses better.

loans.use: to purchase 4 containers of red palm oil

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
It is hard for Sonia to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Sonia is 31 years old, married woman and mother of 2 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Sonia has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Agbohoungbe

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 58 ans, Agbohoungbe est une femme qui avec quatre enfants à charge. Habitant à Agoè, Agbohoungbe prépare de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Agbohoungbe s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la préparation. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Agbohoungbe demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien vendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants dès le début de cette rentrée.
texts.en:
Agbohoungbe, 58 years old, is a married woman with four children to support. Living in Agoè, she makes a kind of cornmeal polenta called “Akpan”. She resells in front of her home with the aim of having a good profit monetarily. She gets her supplies of necessities at the market four time a month for her production of Akpan.

To put in an order for sacks of corn, Agbohoungbe is asking for this loan to make her purchase, so as to do well in her sales and earn more income for coping with the children’s needs and for helping her husband cover their schooling costs in the new school year.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 38 years old and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 2 children.

Currently, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fida is a 25-years-old single young lady from Toubas, Jenin city. Her father work as a worker in the city where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Fida is a student in the local university where she studies Educational Science . She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her country. Fida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for the this semester. By taking this loan, Fida will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.
Fida appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university fees for a degree in Educational Science for this semester.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, una mujer que con su actividad demuestra gran carácter, es un ejemplo para el barrio, pues tiene un salón de belleza y cuenta con 3 empleados fijos.
Ella es madre cabeza de familia, fue esa necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su pequeño lo que la hizo crear empresa y hoy agradece mucho las oportunidades de crecer que le ha brindado la vida, espera seguir por ese buen camino ascendente y nunca retroceder.
Su objetivo a largo plazo es comprar una vivienda, una meta que se trazó desde que inicio el negocio y espera llegar a cumplirla.
Esta joven emprendedora quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo tales como máquina de motilar y adecuaciones locativas para hacer su negocio más confortable y apetecido para los clientes, tales como un televisor, aire acondiciones, arreglo del local y surtido de productos para aplicar en el cabello de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a young, 20 year old entrepreneur. She is a woman who demonstrates great character through her work. She is an example for her neighborhood, as she has a beauty salon with 3 permanent employees. She is a mother, and the head of her household. It was the need to generate income to provide for her small child that led her to create her business. Today she is very grateful for the opportunities to create that life has provided her. She hopes to continue on that good, ascending road, and never turn back.

Her long term goal is to buy a home, a goal that traces back to when she began her business, which she hopes to accomplish. This young entrepreneur wants to obtain a loan to buy tools for her work, such as hair clippers, and to do some on site maintenance to make her business more comfortable and attractive to her customers, like adding a television and air conditioning, fixing up the locale, and supplying it with products to apply to her customers' hair.

loans.use: to buy a television, air conditioning, and an assortment of products to apply to the hair of her customers, and to fix up the locale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Marilou requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад хороший ,добрый парень в возрасте 26 года ,не женат. Он живет вместе со своими родителями, двумя братишками и одной сестрёнкой. Они вместе живут очень дружно, во всем поддерживая друг друга. Ахмад работает строителем в городе, а его отец трактирщиком, вместе они зарабатывают на жизнь. Но несмотря на  трудности с деньгами они живут очень счастливо, ведь их маленькая, капризная, единственная сестрёнка выходит замуж. Ахмад всей силой старается сделать счастливой свою сестрёнку. Теперь они хотят сыграть свадьбу, но, к сожалению,  у него нет накопленных денег, так же его зарплата слишком маленькая. Так как сейчас  он главный содержатель семьи, посоветовавшись с отцом он решил взять кредит. Заранее благодарны   Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Ahmad is a good, kind chap. He is 26 years old and unmarried. He lives together with his parents, two younger brothers, and a younger sister. They live harmoniously, supporting one another wholeheartedly. Ahmad works as a builder in the city, and his father runs an eating house. Together, they work to support the family. In spite of their financial difficulties, they are living very happily. 

In fact, the young, playful and only darling girl of their family is going to get married. Ahmad is trying his utmost to make things great for his sister. Now they want to hold the wedding, but unfortunately they do not have enough savings, as his salary is too little. Since he is the main provider for the family, having consulted with his father, he has decided to take a loan. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support!

loans.use: to pay for wedding expenses.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures but not having ability to meet them compelled Suraya to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 40 years old, a married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo).

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 60000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge résidant à Agoè. Elise est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Elise sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de pantalons et de camisoles en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
