texts.en: Elise is a married woman with two children to support and living in Agoè. She is a retailer of secondhand clothing and stocks up once a month at the market. She resells in nearby neighborhoods. To have a significant inventory and to maximize her profit, Elise is asking for this loan to order units of pants and camisoles with the aim of responding to the numerous expectations of her customers, thus earning a profit for helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 90 units of pants and 77 units of camisoles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN DE 25 AÑOS QUE TRABAJA COMO RECEPCIONISTA, SUFRE DE INFECCIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS Y PAREDES DEL HUESO AL REDEDOR DE ALGUNAS PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE LE ESTA PROVOCANDO DESPRENDIMIENTO EN SUS DIENTES, NECESITA URGENTEMENTE UN TRATAMIENTO DENTAL, EL CUAL POR LOS POCOS INGRESOS QUE RECIBE NO PUEDE COSTEAR.
texts.en:
She is 25 years old, and she works as a receptionist. She suffers from an infection of the gums and the bone walls around some of her teeth. This is causing them to detach.

She urgently needs dental treatment. She is not able to afford it with the small income that she gets.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Kazim,

texts.en:
Kazim is 49 years old married man and is an IDP from Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is a very hard-working diligent man. People always value him as trustworthy. This has been through Kazim's 15 years of experience of being a farmer.

His business is poultry. He sell the natural meat in the local market. Kazim is aware that people like chicken meat. And most of the traditional dishes which include meat are made of chicken. These traditional dishes are like bozbash, chicken kebabs and chicken soup etc. Usually he takes his meat to local butcher shops. With the growing demand for chicken, Kazim is also trying to expand his business. His plan is to buy more chickens.

For this he needs 1200 AZN loan. With the necessary funds he will be able to run the farm more efficiently and meet the rising demand. Kazim is hoping that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La socia Julia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tamales, bizcochuelos y maicillos, ella los produce y los vende. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, manteca y azúcar. Estos productos son típicos del Cusco y en estos meses se venden mucho por fiestas. La clienta es muy responsable y agrádese el préstamo a los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The member, Julia, continues to dedicate herself to her business, making and selling tamales, baked desserts (bizcochuelos) and corn cakes (maicillos). She is requesting the loan to buy corn, lard and sugar. These items are traditional foods from Cusco and in these months of the year, they are sold a lot for holidays.

The member is very responsible and appreciates the loan from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy corn, lard and sugar.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old, and had two children. She is managing a store for income and had been in her business for about eight years.

She wanted to generate more income from her business. She will attain this if she will increases her merchandise.

Marilou is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase her sales and profits.

She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that in the future, he will own a home. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking 32-year-old married woman who earns a living via her retailing business. She sells MSE products like shoes, bags, shirts, pouches, and other apparel, which she has used to manage the economy of her house.

She has her own property, where she lives with her 14-year-old son and husband, and she is happy to have her family.

Maricel wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to buy more ready-to-wear clothing, accessories and footwear. She used the previous loan to stock goods and wants to continue doing so.

She is hoping that she will be managing her source of income well to continue supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing, accessories and footwear.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Amelita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 32 years.

Amelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

Amelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mère de quatre enfants, Akouavi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akouavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de biscuits et de bonbons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akouavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à couvrir certaines dépenses quotidiennes de la famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouavi is 40-year-old married woman who lives in Agoè. The mother of four, she is a retailer of grocery items. She gets her supplies four times a month at the market, and she resells in front of her home. Akouavi is requesting this loan to order boxes of cookies and candies. With the resulting profits, she plans on improving her range of offerings and helping her husband to cover certain day-to-day family expenses, so that her family may thrive and the children may have a good education.

loans.use: to puchase 3 boxes of cookies and 4 boxes of candies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un señor de 55 años de edad, se encuentra preocupado por una nieta que tiene a su cargo desde que sus padres fallecieron en un accidente. La niña de 6 años tiene problemas en su vista ya que sufre de visión doble, por lo que tiene que utilizar lentes desde desde pequeñita. Necesita una operación que corregiría su problema y así evitar que su nieta sufra de burlas en la escuela. Lamentablemente sus recursos son insuficientes para poder solventar el tratamiento quirúrgico de la pequeña.
texts.en:
He is 55 years old, and he is worried about his granddaughter. She has been under his care since her parents died in an accident. His granddaughter is six years old, and she has vision problems because she has double vision. Therefore, she has had to wear glasses every since she was very little.

She needs an operation, which would correct her problem. This way his granddaughter would avoid the teasing that she gets at school. Unfortunately, he does not have enough resources to be able to affort surgical treatment for his little one.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en: Amalya lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She is married and she has two daughters and a son. One of her daughters is married and she lives with her family. Her son now lives and works in Russian Federation. Amalya’s husband makes cargo transfers on his own truck. Amalya works at the sewing fabric now and here she is a tailor with many years of skills in this sphere. She mentions she likes her work very much since her very young age and now she already knows all the secrets and tricks in that work. Amalya is very active and cheerful person but lately she feels weak and unhealthy. She is so hopeful there is nothing very serious with her but she must pass proper medical exam. This loan of 600.000 Armenian drams she needs in order to solve her health problems.

loans.use: to solve her health problems.

loans.name: Moatazz

texts.en:
Moatazz is passionate about cars. He is 33 and lives with his wife and their three children in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon.
Moatazz has been working in car repairs since he graduated from school. Ten years ago, as his popularity started increasing among clients, he decided to open his own shop inside the camp. In fact, with competitive prices and a high quality service for all types of cars, Moatazz's business quickly grew and became successful.

For the first time, he is asking for 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy a new power generator for his shop. With the frequent power cuts happening inside the camp, the generator will allow him to finish his work faster which will increase his productivity and help him sustain a good level of profitability.

loans.use: to buy a power generator for his repair shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from personal product retail.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a single mother of 2 children and is living with her parents. Angela is the owner of a workshop where she is a seamstress and makes sweaters and hats. Angela is the only one at her home who works, so she needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Angela would like to have a bigger workshop in the future, because she has her workshop at her parents house, so that is not comfortable for her

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sisters4 Group

texts.en:
Lorie is the featured borrower of Sisters4 group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they came to work as housekeepers in Lebanon to make a better living.

Lorie is the second lady from the far right side of the picture. She is a 50 years old married mother of four children. Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be sent to her children back in the Philippines, to pay for their university requested tuition fees.
Agnes at the far right side of the picture, her loan section will be sent to pay for her mother's medication expenses. Maricar the second lady at the far left side of the picture, will pay for her daughter's school tuition fees at the Philippines, and Teresita the first lady at the far left side her acquired loan will be sent to improve and develop her clothes selling business which she established in the Philippines.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university requested tuition fees.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia teresa se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora, siguiendo sus sueño de ampliar su negocio y mejorar su servicio ella solicita el préstamo para comprar tinta para fotocopiadora y papeles bond A4.
La socia Teresa está contenta con su negocio y con el préstamo. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en el tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
The member Teresa continues to make a living through her photocopying business. Following her dream of expanding her business and improving her services, she is asking for a loan to buy ink for the photocopier and A4 bond paper. 

Teresa is happy with her business and with the loan. She promises to pay the installments in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy ink for the photocopier and A4 bond paper.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 20 years old and is married. She is blessed with two children who are now attending school.

Rhea and her husband are in the retail business. They sell fish crackers and breads in different villages. They have been in this business for two years.

Rhea needs additional capital to increase the foods they sell to their customers. For this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more bread and fish crackers to sell.

Rhea hopes to extend their products to other villages that they have not previously reached.

loans.use: to buy more bread fish crackers to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman and has six children. Her oldest child is 17 and her youngest one.

She raises hogs to earn for a living. Aside from that, Janeth sells fruits like banana, mango and coconut.

Janeth is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and for additional capital for buy and sell business. That would improve her earnings and continue to make her more productive.

In a few months, she could now able to raise quality hogs.

In the future, Janeth looks forward to continue working for her livelihood and to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional capital to sustain her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Epigenia

texts.en:
Epigenia wishes a loan of P21,000 to buy fabric, threads, materials, and tools for her tailoring business.

Epigenia share that she learn her skills in sewing from her late mother. She develop her skills thru her experience which she uses now to make a living. Epigenia started to sew in her twenties. Now, she is 62 years old and still strong.

Epigenia accepts dressmaking work, specially school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, materials, and tools for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, rice, sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, bread and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hard-working entrepreneur with four children.

She has a charcoal retailing in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Amalia industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as food vending and tricycle passenger businesses.

She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Francisca works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Francisca is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old, married with four children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from banana vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cecilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

Cresencia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her machine and to pay electric bills for her videoke machine rental business.

Cresencia has sustained her business activities through 12 previous loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and payment for electric bills.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is 50 and lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and for the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates, many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantities. But he does not have enough cash on hand to buy milk in large quantities.

Therefore, Bashira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk in bulk for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with four children and she work so hard to support her husband in the upbringing of their family. Diana has been selling cassava in a very busy area where the business has attain it high demand of items due to the increase in population of people in that locality.
She seek the help of Kiva with the aid of Id-Ghana to acquire a loan in order to buy more cassava to meet the demand of her buyers.

She is a representation of the Nyame Bekyere Group at Teshie in the greater region of Ghana.
Diana hope her requirement will be met. She will be very faithful in the repayment of loan.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to meet the demand of her buyers.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 36 ans, Abla est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec deux enfants à charge. Abla prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Abla s’approvisionne du nécessaire une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs, Abla demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à ses propres.
texts.en: Abla, aged 36, is an unmarried woman living in Agoè with her two children she supports. She makes and sells a kind of polenta called “Akpan” in front of her home with the aim of having monetary profit. She gets her supplies of necessities once a month at the market. To order bowls of cornmeal, Abla is asking for this loan to realize her purchase, so as to earn more income for coping with her children’s needs and her own.

loans.use: to purchase 67 bowls of cornmeal

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mariée et sans enfant, Adjoua est une femme âgée de 48 ans résidant à Tokoin. Adjoua est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises six fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Adjoua sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue de réorganiser son activité puis gagner plus de bénéfice afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Adjoua, a married woman without children, is 48 years old and lives in Tokoin. She is a grocer and purchases her merchandise six times a month at the market. She resells in a shop in her home. Adjoua is requesting this loan to order sacks of rice and containers of oil with the aim of having a significant inventory and maximizing her profit. This would reorganize her business and earn more profit for meeting day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and 3 containers of oil

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is a single man and he lives with his father and helps him with the expenses at the house. Erwin is a mason and he also is a musician. Erwin helps his father at his farm, so he needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

Erwin's father is an experienced man in the dairy business but Erwin doesn't like to work in that, but he knows that his father is good in that business, so he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow for his father.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio is married. As his wife travels a lot, because of her work, so he has to take care of his family practically alone. Cecilio is a school teacher and he is father of 2 kids.

Cecilio needs a loan to improve the walls of his kitchen. Cecilio is the owner of the house and he would like to make improvements around it, so this would be the first step. He hopes you can help him. Cecilio is at his house in the picture

loans.use: to improve the walls of his kitchen

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Petrona is been married for over 15 years and she is the owner of the house where she lives with her family. Petrona sells milk and she has been in this business since she was a child, which she learned with her late mother.

Petrona needs a loan to buy a new milking cow. Petrona would like to sell more milk because there is a great demand for this product right now. Petrona is helped by her husband. The dairy business is their only income.

loans.use: to buy a new milking cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells fertilizer and motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be that the fertilizer business is seasonal because of planting seasons. He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of fertilizer. His business goal is to open a huge store with more stock of fertilizer and motorcycle spare parts within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build rental houses. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business and cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a housewife and a sales representative. She is 47 years old and married. Her family lives in Amulung.

After doing household chores, she sells different cosmetics and perfumes from the Avon catalogue. She had been in her business for about two years. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy cosmetics, perfumes, colognes and soap to sell. She hopes this will help increase her sales and profits as well.

Someday, she hopes to continue diversifying her business so she can save funds to use for school expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, colognes and soap to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Elsa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her stand for her business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her stand.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her business.

Felomina has been in this business for two years, and earns additional income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 58 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Merly has a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional bamboo to sell.

Merly has been in this business for four years. In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 53 years old and married with eleven children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like milk, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soft-drinks, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like milk, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 62 years old and married with six children.

Merly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Merly has been in this business for twelve years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Merly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, es una mujer de 70 años de edad que vive con su esposo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de plátanos, su esposo se dedica a la siembre y recolección en una limonera que es propia, doña Francisca tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a este negocio, con ella trabaja una nuera que se encarga de vender de manera ambulante mientras doña Francisca   se queda en el local vendiendo y haciendo tostadas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en materia prima como: plátanos, aceite, bolsas, etc., para seguir vendiendo pero también comprara una cocina industrial para hacer pupusas, ya que ella considera que le será de gran ayuda para ofrecer otro tipo de producto e incrementar sus ingresos, debido a que es una señora que ya tiene mucha experiencia con el pasar de los años se ha hecho de mucha clientela.
Uno de sus sueños y aspiraciones es poder fortalecer su negocio para tener estabilidad económica y así poder tener una vida más tranquila y digna junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 70-year-old woman who lives with her husband. Her business is making and selling plantain chips. Her husband works planting and harvesting his own lemon grove.

Francisca has had her business for approximately 30 years now. Her daughter-in-law works with her and is in charge of selling door-to-door, while Francisca stays at the shop, selling and making the chips.

She is requesting the loan to invest in raw materials, such as plantains, oil, bags, etc. to continue selling, but she will also buy an industrial kitchen to make pupusas. She thinks it will be very helpful to offer another type of product and to increase her income, because she is a woman with a lot of experience and over the years she has gained a lot of customers.

One of her dreams and aspirations is to be able to strengthen her business so she has economic stability and can have a calmer and more dignified life, together with her husband.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials, such as plantains, oil, bags, etc. to continue selling, but she will also buy an industrial kitchen to make pupusas.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Afi est une revendeuse de javel en poudre qui s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Afi désire ce prêt pour commander des bidons de javel en poudre. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et gagner plus de bénéfices afin d’aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman, aged 32, and residing in Tokoin. The mother of four, she is retailer of bleach powder. She gets her supplies six times a month at the market and resells out of her home and by passing through nearby neighborhoods. Afi would like this loan to order containers of bleach powder. With the resulting profit, she plans on improving her offerings and earning more profit, so as to help her family to thrive and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 containers of bleach powder

loans.name: Azran

texts.en:
Azran is 51 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from a city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Azran has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business and to get boost in her earnings with her loan .

loans.name: Aizharkyn

texts.en:
Aizharkyn is 18 years old freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. She wants to get a qualitative education in this university because there are American system of credits, high-qualified professor staff and variety of activities for students. Now entering it she is glad to study in new, comfortable and modern classrooms.
She chose ICP Department because she is interested in political and economic situation of Kyrgyzstan. She says that Kyrgyzstan is going through the process of becoming a democratic state, so it is in need of professional politicians. Aizharkyn took Central Asian Politics, International Organizations, Political Economy, Political Geography and Geopolitics, European Integration for her fall semester and now enjoying them.
Aizharkyn is sure that the knowledge gained at the AUCA will help her in the future. She is a purposeful, active and self-confident person. She is planning to be involved in university extra-curricular activities, preparing presentations, and organizing concerts, debates and discussions, so she could develop her communicative and leadership skills. 
Aizharkyn is applying for a Kiva loan because her parents are short of money. They pay for her two younger brothers’ education in the kindergarten and school, that it is hard for them to leave money for her university tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her higher education fees for a degree in Comparative International Comparative Politics

loans.name: Michatha (B) Organic Farming And Environmental Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Michatha (B) Organic farming and Environment SHG. She is forty six old years old, married and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
She does poultry keeping as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on record keeping and financial management that has enabled her manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more chicks so that she can increase her income from eggs and chicken sales. This will assist her cater for family needs such as food and paying school fees for her children. 
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chicks that will boost poultry farming.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a 49-years-old IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and children. He is an energetic and steady man. He values the principles highly which are being diligent, punctual, honest. These features has made him a reliable business partner in the local market and also a motivator to other sellers.

He is in an animal husbandry sector. He has several cows and sheep. He raises cows, fattens them and then take their meat to the market. Nabi is a happy man, because in his daily business activities his sons also support him. They like to help him by feeding the animals and when they are having holidays they take the animals for feeding in the field.

Nabi is aware of the growing demand for the meat. So he is also planning to expand. He wants to buy 3 calves. For this he needs 1200 AZN loan. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him. Nabi has a good client history and this will be his 7th loan.

loans.use: to buy 3 more calves to add to his expanding farm

loans.name: Shukrona

texts.en:
Shukrona is a wonderful Tajik national woman. She is a careful mother of 5 children, but is widowed and so she is the only person to bring up her children. Shukrona has own business. She sells women and children's clothes in a local market.

She periodically renews the assortment of her goods for each season. Shukrona manages with business alone. She is going to buy women and children clothes for the new season and with this aim she is asking for a loan 5000 Somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women and children clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is selling electronic mobile load credits and AVON products for income. She had been in her business for about two years. She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy autoload mobile credits to resell. She hopes to improve her sales and generate better profits to expand her business. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy autoload mobile credits to resell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
“I want a more stable business that can help others in need. Personally, I want to buy a car.”

This is Mildred’s answer when asked about her future plan. She operates this variety store in Buhangin, Davao City as an alternative source of income. Her family’s main source of income is quarrying and selling sand and gravel, where she pays 20 on-call workers. Her husband, Roland, leads these men from burrowing to delivery. They supply big and small construction sites.

Sometimes Mildred experiences difficulty in rolling her business capital due to delayed payments from clients. She needs to cover these collectibles with additional capital worth PHP 50,000. With this she can obtain a high volume of gravel and sand. She can also use some of the amount as seed money for an additional boat for sand quarrying.

Mildred dreams that her children will finish college and obtain stable jobs or help manage their family business. She prays for love, understanding, and good health for the whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partner, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain a high volume of sand and gravel from quarrying and to set aside funds for an additional boat for sand quarrying.

loans.name: Peñafrancia

texts.en:
Peñafrancia wants to thank all of the lenders who are continually participating in the Kiva program, since the amount they provided really became a medium for an increase in revenue for her business. Without the help of the lenders, CCT and Kiva, she doesn’t how she would restock products for her buy-and-sell business since she lacks supplementary capital.

Peñafrancia is aiming to expand her store someday and dreams of investing in her own motorized tricycle. But delayed payments are her biggest challenge in the business, and that’s why she wants to maintain a revolving fund.

She applied for a loan of 30,000 PHP as she wants to buy stocks of grocery items, such as toiletries, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments and snacks. She believes that this will be the start to have her prayers answered. She wants to thank in advance all of the lenders who will read her story.

Despite being busy managing the business, Peñafrancia attends CCT group fellowship, which consists of 10 to 15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the word of God, build social relationships with other partners and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items, such as toiletries, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments and snacks.

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselie is 42 years old and all three children are attending school.

Roselie has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Roselie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Roselie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Roselie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is married and a housewife. Her husband runs an electrical shop in a market near to their house in Lahore. Since technology is changing day by day there are many variety of electrical goods coming to the market each day. LEDs have taken over conventional bulb as LEDs are more energy saver. Also the electricity crisis in Pakistan has led to increase in demand for chargers and UPS, chargeable batteries to use whenever there is no light. At the same time people are buying electrical heaters for winters. Therefore Zahida's husband wants to buy more products to sell at his store.

As they lack funds Zahida has requested for a loan to help her husband buy these goods and increase his income.
She happy to be able to help her husband and will pay the loan from the on going income of the shop.

loans.use: help her husband buy electrical goods for his shop.

loans.name: Yeidwin

texts.es: Yeidwin es un joven habitante de un asentamiento ubicado en cercanías del corregimiento de Juan Mina en el departamento del Atlántico, cuyos moradores en su gran mayoría son oriundos de otras regiones, quienes tuvieron que dejar atrás sus tierras y sus vidas, a causa de grupos armados irregulares que los sacaron de sus viviendas y los dejaron en una situación de desplazamiento, otra situación que hizo llegar a muchas familias a este lugar, eran aquellos que en su condición de pobreza extrema no tenían donde vivir; se asentaron en estas tierras y tuvieron que elaborar sus propias viviendas en condiciones precarias. En esta comunidad reside Yeidwin con su gran espíritu de superación, él decidió involucrarse en la microempresa  familiar de Bollos de Mazorca en la que exclusivamente su madre se encargaba, sin embargo consideró que si unían sinergias podrían tener la oportunidad de ingresar a nuevos mercados y tener mayores ingresos.  Todos los días Yeidwin en compañía de su madre empiezan a trabajar en la producción de los Bollos a partir de las 4 a.m., un proceso que dura entre 5 u 6 horas, y que consiste en seleccionar las tusas de las mazorcas, desgranar las mazorcas para posteriormente moler el grano del maíz y cocer, a la masa obtenida, se le adiciona sal y azúcar, y se envuelven en las tusas de la mazorcas para cocinarlo y después de unos minutos quedan listos los deliciosos Bollos de Maíz. Yeidwin distribuye los Bollos a tiendas de barrios de Barranquilla y del corregimiento de Juan Minas, de lunes a sábado y en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en una estufa semindustria  y maíz suficiente para respaldar el incremento de su producción.  A futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura física de la vivienda de su madre y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yeidwin is a young inhabitant of a settlement located in vicinity of the Juan Mina village in the Atlantic department, whose residents are mostly are from other regions. They had to leave behind their land and their lives because of crooked armed groups that took them from their homes and left them in a situation of displacement.

Another reason many families came to this place is that they were in a situation of extreme poverty and had nowhere to live; they settled in this land and they had to build their own homes in precarious conditions.

Yeidwin, with his great spirit of excellence, lives in this community. He decided to get involved in the "Bollos Mazorca" [Corn Buns] family micro-enterprise, which his mother was exclusively in charge of. He felt that if they joined forces, they could have the opportunity to enter new markets and have higher revenues.

Every day, Yeidwin starts working with his mother on the production of buns starting at 4:00 am, a process that lasts 5 or 6 hours. They select corn cobs and shuck them to then grind the corn kernels and cook them. Salt and sugar is added to the resulting meal, and it is wrapped in the corn husks to cook. After a few minutes the delicious corn buns are ready.

Yeidwin distributes the buns to stores and neighborhoods of Barranquilla and to the village of Juan Mina Monday through Saturday. Today he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in a semi-industrial stove and a sufficient amount of corn to support increased production.

In the future he wants to improve the physical infrastructure of his mother's house and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a semi-industrial stove and a sufficient amount of corn to support increased production.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet, de 44 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fábricas donde trabajaba como operaria de máquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 5 horas con 1 empleado.
Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de una maquina plana industrial y algunos insumos de trabajo como tela, agujas, entre otros.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Yanet, 44 years old, has a great deal of experience in the field of dressmaking thanks to her many jobs with different factories where she worked as a dressmaking machine operator.

Today she is an independent woman and earns her own income through dressmaking for third parties and her own small line.

She is a very enterprising woman and her biggest motivation to work is her children who, on occasion, help her in her business.

She works at her business every day for 5 hours with 1 employee.

She has many projects that she desires to complete as soon as possible. To do this she needs the help of financial aid, which will allow her to invest capital in her business through the purchase of an industrial sewing machine and some work supplies like fabric, needles, and other items.

With this loan she will be able to maintain her current work and continue offering work to people in the industry.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and some work supplies like fabric, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter, a member of Kihingo FADC Commercial Farmers Self Help Group. He is 65 years old, married and a father of seven. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2012.

He does maize, beans and potatoes farming as his main business and also does dairy farming. He has benefited much from HiH EA training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled him to manage his business well. He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers that will help boost his output and thus increase his income. This will assist him to cater for the family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for his children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers that will help boost his output and thus increase his income.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée de 58 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Ablavi est une revendeuse des céréales. Ablavi s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et de riz, Ablavi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire en vue de bien vendre puis de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en leur payant leurs frais scolaire.
texts.en: Ablavi is a married woman, 58 years old, living in Tokoin. The mother of two, she is a retailer of grains. She gets her supplies six times a month at the market and resells in front of her home, so as to achieve her goals. To order sacks of corn and rice, Ablavi needs these funds to finance her supplies and to realize a good profit. Her aim is to do well in her sales and be able to meet her children’s needs by covering their schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and a sack of rice.

loans.name: German Fernando

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 33 años, soltero, tiene 5 años y su negocio es el comercio de repuestos de auto.
Él es buen padre, decidido y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa victoria’ conocida por encontrarse en la parte alta de una ladera, dónde las calles son empinadas y la lluvia baja como rio.
German es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que está iniciando la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de sus padres construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de repuestos para auto, actividad que realiza en una tienda ubicada en su domicilio, le hacen pedidos y realiza entregas a domicilio, “aprendí el negocio como ayudante en una tienda de repuestos, luego conseguí el capital para independizarme…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas estables, la desventaja son las entregas de repuestos a lugares lejanos. Su sueño es triplicar su capital de trabajo para mejorar su negocio, él desea comprar repuestos de auto. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que German solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos automotores para realizar envíos a lugares alejados.
texts.en:
German is a 33-year-old man who is single. He has had his auto parts business for 5 years.

He is a good father, determined and very friendly. He does business in the Villa Victoria area, which is known for being high on the side of a hill, where the streets are steep, and the rain comes down like a river.

German is brown-skinned, with short black hair and a stocky build. His mother tongue is Aymará and he speaks Spanish for business. He shares his life with his son, who is starting school. They live in a housed owned by his parents and built with brick that has running water, electricity, household gas and sewage system.

His business is the sale of repair parts for cars, which he does from a store located in his home. He gets orders and makes home deliveries. “I learned the business as an assistant in a parts store. Then I got the capital to become independent..." he comments. The advantage of his business is that his sales are stable; the disadvantage is the delivery of parts to remote places.

His dream is to triple his working capital to improve his business. He wants to buy car parts. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years he has been working in this business. Those are the reasons why German is requesting a loan to buy automobile parts to make deliveries to remote places.

loans.use: to buy automobile parts to make deliveries to remote places.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia Livia continúa con su negocio de venta de hortalizas y frutas. Ella sigue luchando por su sueño de ampliar su negocio, para progresar junto con su familia.
Livia solicita el crédito para comprar sandia, papa, mandarina y pepino. La socia está muy agradecida y contenta con el préstamo se compromete a pagar en el tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
Livia continues with her business selling fruits and vegetables. She continues to fight for her dream of expanding her business in order to progress along with her family.

Livia is asking for the loan in order to buy watermelon, potatoes, oranges, and cucumbers. She is very grateful for and happy with the loan and promises to pay within the agreed amount of time.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, potatoes, oranges, and cucumbers

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
This nice and shining lady’s name is Astghik and her name is one of the most beautiful names for girls, it means a little star. Astghik is 22 years old and she lives with her parents in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. She studies at the Gavar city’s State University where she is a student at second - year MA of the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature and she studies at the paid division.

Astghik’s parents are farmers who work very hard to provide their single daughter with the best living conditions. On her turn Astghik also tries to lighten her parents’ financial state by the help of her work, so she combines her education with work as a secretary at a private workshop.

She is so hopeful that after her graduation she will finally work of her profession which he likes very much. This loan of 300.000 Armenian drams this lady asks for paying her tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: pay her university tuition fee for her first semester in Armenian Language and Literature. Her parents are farmers.

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
Roslyn is 25 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Roslyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Roslyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Roslyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Roslyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Altin

texts.en:
Altin is a 41-year-old married Egyptian Albanian man and father of two, 19 and 12 years old. His family lives in the rural southeastern part of the country. In the three dynym of agricultural land that his family owns, they mainly plant beans and they sell them for an annual profit of $950. In addition to this, Altin has run a welding and hydraulics shop for the past twenty years, whereas his wife works as a seamstress for a monthly pay of $180 in a clothing factory in the city nearby.

"My son has expressed interests and talents in sports at a very young age and to further excel in it, we had to send him to a public sports academy in the capital city. Usually members of our own ethnic community do not continue to higher education and we are proud that our son was selected among some other talented youngsters, " said Altin in the interview.

loans.use: to pay for the university and dorm fees of his 19-year-old son.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Naseem to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Naseem is a 42 years old separated woman. In order to support her family she began the business of milk selling with the support of her brother (also shown in the photo).

She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina , 59 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Zarina needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.

She has requested a loan of PKR 45000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Hayotbek

texts.en: Hayotbek is a young and clever man. He was born in 1996. Hayotbek is single and lives with parents in the North part of Tajikistan. He is a student of the first course Khujand State University. Hayotbek studies well. He is a very hardworking student and tries always to get excellent marks. Hayotbek is asking for a loan because he must pay university tuition but his parents have no opportunity. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Norga Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Norga pertenece al banco "BATAN ORCCO" Y se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comidas, ella sigue luchado por su sueño que es mejorar su negocio y sus servicios para poder sacar adelante a su familia. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar carne, pollo y aceite. 
Norga esta agradecida y contenta por el préstamo otorgado por la institución y su compromiso es cumplir sus cuotas acordadas en el tiempo debido.
texts.en:
The member Norga belongs to the "BATAN ORCCO" communal bank. She continues to work in her business selling meals and she continues to strive for her dream which is to improve her business and her service to be able to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to buy meat, chicken and oil.

Norga is grateful and content with the loan awarded by the institution and promises to comply with her installments in the allotted time.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken and oil.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 26-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he left school at early age to help cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Four years ago he started working in the construction field, specializing in paving. He is a hard worker and an ambitious man.

Because of his limited salary which is not enough to cover any additional expenses, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to paint his own house and buy necessary furniture. This loan is very important to Jamal for it is the first step towards building his own family and life.

loans.use: to paint his own house and buy necessary furniture.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
A buy-and-sell business earns profit from buying products at low prices and selling the same at a higher price. The entrepreneur’s skills at finding a network of manufacturers and suppliers who offer low prices for their products is one major key to success of this business, as is the capacity to expand his/her market.

Perpetua buys-and-sells products such as mats, blankets, towels, undies, and others. She offers these items to her neighbors, relatives, and friends. She invites them to her house and sometimes she goes house-to-house. She braves the rain and heat of the sun so as to supply her and her husband’s daily needs and to extend financial support to her grandchildren. Even at her age of 65, she still wants to be productive.

At times her income is not enough, and thus she plans to buy more products to resell. She thinks that these items might be in demand this Christmas season because many people use them as practical Christmas gifts. She needs additional capital of PHP 12,000 to procure these products. Your generosity will be a great blessing to her.

She dreams of a progressive business so she can better help the needy. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more mats, blankets, towels, undies, and other items.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 45 years old, married, with 4 children. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for 8 years. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loan.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, match boxes, paraffin, bread, rice and cooking oil for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children and also provide for the needs of her family. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her retail shop, make more income and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, match boxes, paraffin, bread, rice and cooking oil for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 24 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gina has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 21 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Charity has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Charity requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Charity has been in this business for three years. In the future, Charity would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik with his large family lives in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. He has two sons and a daughter. Both his sons are constructors and his wife and daughter are unemployed. Gagik is a farmer and he has big farm; there are cows, calves, lambs, sheep, chickens and also bee colonies. Gagik is very famous bee keeper in his native village and thanks to his farm’s pure and healing honey he farm’s milk, meat, cheese and eggs are also sold very quickly and profitably.

Gagik mentions that finally his dream will become true since his elder son decided to get married. He has a nice bride with whom he is going to establish happy family and Gagik feels such happiness that very soon he will have grandchildren. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Gagik will use for organizing a beautiful and cheerful wedding party of his son, which will be according to some very interesting and wise Armenian traditions.

loans.use: organize a beautiful and cheerful wedding party for his son, which will be according to some very interesting and wise Armenian traditions.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Abra est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour exercer ses activités, Abra vit à Tokoin et vend des casseroles, marmites et assiettes en plastiques en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Abra s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des douzaines de bassines en aluminium et des glacières ; des ensembles de casseroles, Abra demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leur enfant à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en: 33 years old, Abra is a married woman with one child. Abra lives in Tokoin and sells casseroles, cooking pots, and plastic plates around the surrounding neighborhoods to gain revenue in her business. Abra resupplies twice per month at the market. For her order of aluminium bowls, coolers, and casseroles, Abra is requesting this loan to make her purchase and to find the profit necessary to help her husband take care of their child for its development and good education.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen aluminium bowls, 3 coolers, and 4 sets of casseroles.

loans.name: Sajjida

texts.en:
Sajjida is 35 years old, married woman, with 8 children, running a business of milk selling for many years, with the help of her husband, who is also pictured with her. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 37 years old, single lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store is fully stocked, she requested a loan of 50000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es:
Ana, es una mujer divorciada, actualmente vive con un nuevo compañero de vida y dos hijos del matrimonio anterior, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de, empezó su negocio hace dos años y lo hizo con fondos propios, trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar blusas, faldas, vestidos y pantalones, con la única finalidad de tener más mercadería que ofrecerle a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
El sueño de Ana es ser una vendedora potencial en la zona y sus alrededores.
texts.en:
Ana is a divorced woman.  Now she lives with a new life partner and her two children from the previous marriage.  She works selling clothing.  She started her business two years ago and she did it with her own funds.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy blouses, skirts, dress, and pants, with the sole purpose of having more merchandise to offer to her customers, and thus obtain better economic income to give a better quality of life to her household.

Ana's dream is be a potential vendor in the area and its surroundings.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, dresses, and pants with the sole purpose of having more merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Fidiheriniaina

texts.fr:
Fidiheriniaina est une femme dynamique de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et élève 3 enfants. Trois ans passés, elle a démissionné de son travail pour créer son propre activité. Actuellement, elle arrive à combiner 2 activités à la fois, l’une la vente de chaussures friperie et l’autre une location de cyclo-pousses. 
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 3 ans, les prêts précédents lui ont permis d’avoir plusieurs cyclo-pousses à louer. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 6 balles de chaussures friperies offriront une large gamme de chaussures pour ces clients. 
Fidiherinirina est sérieuse dans la gestion de son activité, car elle est consciente que c’est ce qui assurera un meilleur avenir pour ses enfants et la construction d’une éventuelle d’une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Fidiheriniaina is an energetic woman, 36 years old, who is married and raising three children. Three years ago, she quit her job to establish her own business. Currently, she manages to combine two business at the same time, one selling used shoes and the other renting bike rickshaws.

She has been an entrepreneur with Vahatra for three years. The previous loans have enabled her to have several bike rickshaws to rent out. With this loan, she intends to purchase 6 bales of used shoes in order to offer a large range of shoes to her customers.

Fidiheriniaina is serious about managing her business, since she is conscientious that it is what ensures a better future for her children and the possible construction of a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bales of used shoes to sell in front of her home

loans.name: Jennylind

texts.en:
Jennylind is 51 years old with four children, and is a hard-working entrepreneur.

Jennylind and her husband operate their own scrap/junk shop business. Their business is their only source of income to provide for their everyday expenses. Jennylind works from 6 am up to 7 pm, roaming her community to buy plastic scrap/junk from them, stock it in her yard, and sell it to a large recycling company.

Jennylind is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy plastic scraps, bottles and other scrap materials to sell. The additional loan capital will enable her to buy more scrap/junk and increase her income.

Jennylind hopes to expand her business to increase her income, as she works hard to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic scraps, bottles and other scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en:
Yesenia works at an industrial plant that produces cleaning products and has been working at the plant for a long time. She is the divorced mother of 2 kids. Nevertheless her salary is not enough to take care of her kids, so she started to sell cosmetics in her free time.

Yesenia needs a loan to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, to make more money. She hopes you can help her. Yesenia is living with her parents.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfume

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Day-by-day increasing expenditures but not having the ability to meet them compelled Zareena to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 50 years old, a married woman doing the business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 8 children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 37 years old and she lives with her husband and youngest (school-aged) daughter in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Anna also has a son who is in the army now doing his military service, and her elder daughter is already married and lives with her family.

Anna has been engaged in farming since she got married. Anna’s husband has no constant work, and he also spends the main part of his day on their farm. Anna keeps her farm animals (cows, calves, a bull, a pig and chickens) in the barn built by the two of them. The sales of their farm products (milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs and also potatoes) make up the only source of income for this family. Anna hopes so much that her farm enlargement idea will be profitable for her family. With this Kiva loan of 700,000 AMD Anna will buy a cow, a calf and also some fodder for all her farm animals.

loans.use: to  buy a cow, a calf, and also some fodder for all her farm animals; she hopes so much that her farm enlargement idea will be profitable for her family.

loans.name: Zuhran

texts.en:
Zuhran was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 56 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Nagrina

texts.en:
Nagrina is a 32-years-old, married woman. She has four children. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nagrina  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Zahida  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Zareena Mai

texts.en:
Zarmeena mai is the age of 33, living with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a mud vase maker and works at home For structuring the vases he requires raw material for his business. There is no better kind of mud vases made by hand. He has 20 years long experience. Her husband is a expert and design very beautifully. He is very quick with this kind of job and completes all the orders during day time. The demand for his beautifully hand-made vases is increasing day by day.

However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for the vases but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible.
Therefore, Zarmeena Mai requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy mud vase raw materials and it could become the cause in increase in income.

loans.use: to buy mud vase raw material for her husband	.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 18-year-old freshman in the Business Administration Program at AUCA. He is applying for a Kiva loan to help his mother with payment of his university tuition fee.

He has a mother and elder brother. Islam’s mother is a sewer and loves the fall, because it is the season of work and she can earn about 250 USD per month. Other seasons are slow and her salary goes down to 90 USD. His elder brother is 22 years old and works in a neighbor country, Kazakhstan. He has a college degree, but couldn’t attend a university because of the financial difficulties. For more than 2 years he is living and working there, sending money to his family to support them. Even so, being a single-parent, for Islam’s mother it is really difficult to pay Islam's university tuition fee by herself.

Islam’s family doesn’t have their own house, and they live in their grandparents’, which helps them to save money, but pay for the utility bills. Islam says that he could go to another local university, where the tuition fee is less, but he is not confident on their effectiveness as there is high corruption and he will not gain good knowledge. That’s why learning about financial aid and Kiva at the AUCA, he tried to enter it and apply for them. He wants to thank each lender and believes that each 25 USD from you will change his life for the better.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: This nice woman is 46 years old and her name is Irina. She lives with her two sons in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Her husband now is in the Russian Federation for abroad work there. Irina has higher pedagogical education and for several years she worked at the school as a teacher of chemistry. But now, with the help of her elder son she is engaged in farming and agriculture. In her farm, Irina has cows, calves, bulls, a pig, and sheep. Her son perfectly organizes her farm’s meat sale for which he once found customers and now they constantly buy it from their farm. She also sells milk, cheese, butter and curd. Irina is so proud of her son who manages farming very skillfully and does his best to lighten his mother’s farm works as much as he is able. Irina asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she is sure that it will bring a lot of profit to her family. She wants to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle as she is sure that it will bring a lot of profit to her family

loans.name: Artsruni

texts.en:
Artsruni last year applied for his first Kiva loan, which has been great and profitable for his family. He hopes for a second deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. He lives in the Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region with his wife and two daughters. His son is now in the army passing his military service. This man has higher education with a specialty of engineering. He has worked at different organizations and workshops, and at the school; sometimes working in his specialty but mostly in different specialties.

Now his only occupation is farming. He has cows, calves, bulls, pigs and piglets. He used to sell a lot of mutton but now he sells a lot of pork and also milk and cheese. His land’s potato is also in demand among the re-sellers, who come to their village and buy it right from their farms. Artsruni is happy with farming and he will be calm if he can provide enough fodder for his farm cattle for the cold months that have already started; with this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams he will buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is 43 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Artyom is divorced and his children live with him. He has a son and a daughter, and both of them are school-aged. With the care and raising of his children, Artyom could not manage alone if it were not for his parents, who help him greatly, with great love and pleasure.

Artyom is a farmer and he also repairs electrical saws and other tools very skillfully. On his farm he has cows and chickens. His fruit and vegetable garden (with apple, pear and persimmon trees, potatoes and beans) is very nice. He uses the harvest for his family and sells it as well.

Artyom has a good workshop where he does his repair work, but now he plans to rebuild it into a barn, since his cattle have no place to pass the long winter months. With this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, he will build a good, warm barn for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to build a good, warm barn for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша молодая девушка 25 лет, не замужем. Она с раннего возраста была приучена к труду. Окончив школу она устроилась на работу в сельскую школу. Для того чтобы работать в школе ей необходимо получить высшее образование. Она поступила в университет. И сейчас ей необходимо оплатить договор обучение, но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Бунафша обратился в МДО  Арванд  за финансовой поддержкой, она хочет получить кредит для оплаты учёбы.  Она благодарит  за поддержку и  помощь.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young woman. She is 25 years old and unmarried. She has been accustomed to hard work from a tender age. After graduating school, she took up a job in a village school. In order to work in a school, she had to get a higher education. She matriculated into university.
