Now, she has to pay for her studies, but she does not have enough funds. Bunafsha has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. She wants to take a loan to pay for her studies. She is thankful for the support and help.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Sartaaj

texts.en: It was hard for Sartaaj  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Sartaaj  is 43-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of seven children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Sartaaj has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Financial constraints, alongside wanting a better life and good quality education for her four children, are only a few valuable factors that encouraged our Zeenat to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Zeenat is 44 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Zeenat needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
It was hard for Haleema to manage her household expenses with her husband's small income. Haleema is 41 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of seven children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Haleema has gained great confidence in her business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Mu'tabar

texts.ru: Муътабар 33 летняя мать и жена. У нее один сын. Муътабар проживает на районе Хуросон. Ее муж милиционер. Сама Муътабар домохозяйка, но она дома не сидит без дел. У нее имеется не большой бизнес. Муътабар в течение 5 лет выращивает мелко рогатого скота. У нее имеется не большой коровник. Муътабар любит домашних животных, и по этой причине она решила продвигать деятельность матери. Муътабар планирует закупить еще пару голов скота для расширения животноводческой деятельности. Муътабар решила приобрести скота за счет кредита. Она нуждается в помощи. Вы можете помочь ей сейчас!
texts.en:
Mu'tabar is a 33-year-old mother and wife. She has one son. Mu'tabar lives in Khuroson district. Her husband is a policeman. Mu'tabar is a homemaker, but she does not sit idly at home. She has a small business. Mu'tabar has been rearing small cattle for five years. She has a small cowshed. 

Mu'tabar loves domestic animals, and for this reason she has decided to continue on with her mother's business. Mu'tabar plans to buy a couple more heads of livestock to expand her animal husbandry business. Mu'tabar has decided to purchase livestock with a loan. She needs help. You could help her now!

loans.use: to buy a couple heads of livestock.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 42 años de estado civil casado su esposa realiza  quehaceres domésticos del hogar tienen 3 hijos Andrés de 18, Marlon  de 14, Janela tiene 5 años  de edad estudian en escuelas gratuitas del sector,  hace más de 20 años se dedica a criar ganado  de carne lo vende en las ferias cercanas de la provincia. Carlos necesita el dinero para poder comprar tres toretes alimentarlos y luego venderlos obteniendo ganancias para costear los gastos de alimentación, educación, salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old.  He is married.  His wife does the chores around the house.  They have three children, Andrés is 18, Marlon is 14, and Janela is 5 years old.  They go to school in the free school of the sector.  For more than 20 years he has worked raising beef cattle that he sells in the nearby markets of the province.

Carlos is requesting a loan to be able to buy three bulls to fatten and later sell them at a profit to cover the costs of food, education, and health of his family.

loans.use: To buy three bulls, salt, and food

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Sardar opened a school, which she intended to grow each and every day, hoping that one day it would become the top school in her area. Sardar says that two of the key obstacles to meeting her goals is that her teachers do not have enough training and the school facilities do not meet the needs of her 194 students.

The number of students attending her school is constantly increasing and so Sardar is helping her teachers improve their technical skills so they can provide a high-quality education to the children. To help buy more furniture for her students and construct better rooms to suit the needed capacity, she has borrowed PKR 200,000.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for her students and to construct better rooms for increased capacity.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: For the last four years, Gulnaz has been running a school with her husband because they felt a need to provide more education services for the local children. Currently there are 300 students and Gulnaz has borrowed a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy more furniture and some computers to provide the students with more facilities. She is hoping to build a computer lab in the future.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and some computers to provide the students with more facilities.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 37 years old, married woman and a mother of 4 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She knows very well the techniques of sewing. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine, along with some spools of threads in different colors to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with some spools of threads in different colors to sew more dresses on time. .

loans.name: Shohzoda

texts.en:
Shohzoda was born in 1952 year. She is divorced and has 3 children who are adults. She lives together with her family in the South part of Tajikistan. She has own business in farming for more than 10 years. Shohzoda grows maize, sunflower, wheat and variety of vegetables. She has own land and she works hard every day from early morning. Her children and daughter-in-low help her with the growing business.

She is asking for a loan of 12000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for the new sowing season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for new sowing season.

loans.name: Luis Eloy

texts.es: Luis es un hombre trabajador de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación, que está constituida sobre todo por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica y también para alquilar un terreno para cultivar alfalfa orgánica. En el futuro Luis desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking, 51 year old man.  He lives together with his partner and their two children in the rural town of Lari which is located in Arequipa.  He works as an agricultural laborer, and he also works raising organic cattle, putting a lot of attention into their care and feeding, which is mostly made up of organic alfalfa that he grows himself.

He is requesting the microloan to be able to buy an organic cow and also to rent land to grow organic alfalfa.  In the future Luis wants to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy an organic cow and to rent farm land to plant organic alfalfa to feed his cattle.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is a growing entrepreneur from Lahore. She is married and blessed with a child. She works independently and runs a salon. She is well experienced and has many customers who visit her for hair cuts, make up, facials. massages etc. She is welcoming and expert. A few other girls also come to her to learn from her and she happily trains them.

She wants to be well equipped with cosmetic products and accessories for her parlor but due to shortage of finances she has opted for a microfinance loan from BRAC Pakistan. This will be used to buy all the needed items for the parlor and will paid by the regular income she generate through her business in timely installments.
She is happy and hopeful to become a successful make up artist in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, brushes and other accessories for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a single man. He doesn't have children and he lives with his parents. Abel works as a cook, but he offers his services and would like to work for himself because he doesn't like to work at restaurants for others.

Abel also sells beer. Abel is going to college and he needs a loan to start his own restaurant and he will buy tables and chairs. Abel is the only support of his family he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to start his own restaurant which will need tables and chairs.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en: Liliana needs a loan to pay her college tuition in Veterinary Science. Liliana is still single and she  doesn't have children, so she is living with her parents.  She helps them with the expenses more than before.  Liliana loves to work with animals, so she has more experience and she is more enthusiastic. Liliana travels a lot to look after animals, so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to pay her college tuition in Veterinary Science.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 34-year-ols married mother of two, who works in beauty services business for two years to support her beloved husband, who works two jobs to provide his family with the necessary standards of living.

Layla is a hard working ladies and just like her husband, she manages to have two businesses at the same place. She provides special facial beauty services, and at the same time she sells specially designed accessories suitable for several occasions.

To continue developing her businesses, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her accessories merchandise with a special newly released collection.
She hopes to stay capable of developing her business and supporting her family in a well managed way.

loans.use: to increase her accessories merchandise with a special newly released collection.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years old, married with 4 children. He does farming and livestock keeping and has been in the farming business for 7 years. This is his 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully.

He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in his farm and hopes this will enable him to harvest more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to grow more cash crops for sell, make more income and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in his farm and hopes this will enable him to harvest more farm produce for sale.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy was able to buy grocery items for her variety store business. She’s able to provide now on demand products to customers that made her attract more patrons. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to lenders and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance they’ve provided. She’s earning for about Php 15, 000 every month which is much higher compared before the loan approval. 

Amy still aims to add more products for her variety store business to increase revenue. She also prays that despite of being busy managing the business, her faith to God will still be there and to have deeper relation with Him. 

Amy believes that the loan that she’s applying now an amount of Php 50, 000 will make a great impact on the business. She’s hoping that CCT would once again approve her loan application. If so, she’ll use the amount to buy grocery products to add for her variety business.

Amy has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 57 years old and she lives in a village Nerkin Hand of Syunik region. Hasmik is married, her husband is an electrician and she has two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is married and she lives in Kapan city. Her smallest daughter is school-aged and her son works as a gardener.

Hasmik has a big and rich vegetable and fruit garden and she gathers from it harvest of beans, potato, tomato, cucumber, peppers and also nice and sweet harvest of fruits such as apple, pear, peach and cherry. All these she sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Hasmik likes her garden very much where she keeps everything in order, clean and bright.

She asks her first Kiva loan since her hay mowing machine has broken down and with this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams she will buy a new hay mowing machine and finally end the seasonal works in fruit and vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy a new hay mowing machine and finally end the seasonal works in her fruit and vegetable garden .

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region lives his wife, son and two daughters. He is a farmer and he makes his family living only through his farming works and the sale of his farm products. On his farm he has cows, sheep, chickens and a horse. It is very hard for Davit since the family is big and the farm is too small for providing good living conditions.

From his farm with help of his wife, Davit sells milk, cheese, meat and eggs. The greater part of income he has from potato cultivation and this harvest he sells at the city’s wholesale market. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Davit so hopeful to receive, as he wants to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and buy a calf, two sheep and also some fodder for his farm cattle. He great thanks to lenders beforehand for his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and buy a calf, two sheep and also some fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Sosik

texts.en:
Sosik is 54 years old, and he lives with his beloved wife in the village Tandzaver, in Syunik region. They have two daughters, who are married and live with their own families, and a son, who lives and works in the Russian Federation. Sosik and his wife are busy with farming and agriculture in their native village, and they do their best to develop it, with great hope that their son will be back and continue their work.

Sosik now works at the Kapan combine and takes care of his farm’s cows and bee families. He sells milk and very tasty honey to his regular customers. He also sells his land’s pumpkins and beans. His orchard, full of apple and pear trees, is the nicest part of his farm. He takes care of the farm very properly. This loan of 500,000 Armenian drams is very important for Sosik, since he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle and diesel fuel for his final land cultivation work.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle and diesel fuel for his final land cultivation work.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana  is 41 years old, divorced woman. She is been in business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is 19 years old, kind girl from Tajikistan. Tahmina is a student of the second course. She studies well and tries to be a good specialist in future. Tahmina always wanted to get higher education. She lives with her parents. Her parents are local farmers and their income is small. Tahmina is asking for a loan because her parents have not money to pay for her university tuition . Tahmina really needs to your financial support and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition. Her parents are farmers.

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava is vulnerable ethnic Egyptian Albania; she and other members of this community live in the outskirts of the Elbasan city, known for the presence of high pollution created by the metallurgic complex built during the communist era.

During those years, about 30,000 people were employed in this multi plant facility. With the collapse of the regime just like all other plants built during the past era, this was abandoned at first until several years later in the 1999 when foreign investors stepped in by making improvements in the technology of recycled metals, and also on protecting employees during working hours:However,people effected by the pollution were told that work has since been in progress. Thus, the lives of those ethnics who live nearby, have continued to make headlines in the media since the early 90s with claims on diseases, cancer, genetic mutations and intoxicated air.

Hava is photographed in front of her house. She is married and mother of three. $165 is the total monthly disability income of her husband and her and also some monthly social assistance of $30/both.
The loan that Hava is requesting will be used to improve sanitation in the family home.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in her home; the house does not have washroom and no sewage system either

loans.name: Agpto

texts.en:
Agapyo is a business man in Rwashameire town council. He operates a butchers shop, in addition to small scale farming,to be able to generates funds to support his family of eight schooling children.

He has applied for a loan of UGX2500,000=from Ugafode to fund his activities. He will buy young bulls for slaughter to grow his business. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 21 years old and single. He is a livestock farmer and also grows cash crops for selling. He has been in the farming business for 4 years and it has been profitable. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy animal feeds for his cows and spraying chemicals for his crops.

He hopes this will enable him to have more farm produce for selling. He will use the generated profits to improve his standard of living. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming and make more income and have a nice family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for his cows and spraying chemicals for his crops and hopes this will enable him have more farm produce for selling.

loans.name: Gerald Group

texts.en:
In a new suburb just outside Harare, there is a woman called Tambudzai,she saw the need for dried food since the area is not yet electrified and fresh meat business was not working for this neighbourhood. She is also a tailor, she started this business when she realised that she could not rely solely on the provision from her husband who relies on part time jobs.

She has two children who are still in school and so far she has not yet employed anyone since she is still growing her business, working capital being her main constraint.
Tambudzai has been in business for about 10 years and her market is based on supplying the local tuck shops but her hope is to supply tuck shops in surrounding neighbourhoods. She is that kind of a woman who stands her ground and is passionate about her business.

Her other challenge however is due to defaulting customers since she sometimes sells on credit.
She now needs a capital injection so that she buys fabric in bulk and not have to wait for clients to bring their own fabric, and also to buy the fresh foods that she dries in bulk as the electricity situation is not getting any better.
Tambudzai and her friends have collaborated into the Gerald group and they desire to raise funds to improve the current state of their businesses. For this to be possible, they need $1450.

loans.use: to buy fabric and not have to wait for clients to bring their own fabric and also to buy the fresh foods that she dries in bulk.

loans.name: Zulikhan

texts.en:
The fact that her family's expenses were increasing day by day, but she lacked the ability to meet them, compelled Zulikhan to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 37 years old and a married woman, working in a business of animal purchases and sales, with the help of her husband. She has done this work for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is working very hard, to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR [Pakistan Rupees]. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves, to cater for more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business, with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves, to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 21-year-old single man, who has been working as a car mechanic with seven years of experience. In 2010, he opened his own maintenance garage and is working hard to develop it as much as he can.
Husein developed his skills, and is trying his best to buy necessary requested machines to improve his provides services.
Thus for this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated scanner machine which will help him in improving his provided mechanical services.

loans.use: to buy a new updated scanner machine which will help him in improving his provided mechanical services.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 3,000 loan through GDMPC to purchase feed and vitamins for her solar pig fattening business.

Maricel has been fattening pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from GDMPC to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business and sustain her family's living needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. His business is motorcycle taxi. He has been in the business for five years. He earns a monthly income of twenty one thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a fleet of vehicles.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 38 years old and has a food stall which he has been running for nine years now.  He is married and blessed with two children. This is his 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid the previous loans. He will use this loan to buy more stock of milk, tea leaves,sugar, green grams (mung beans), maize and wheat flour for use in his business, in order to serve more customers and make more income. 

He will use the generated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and serve more customers, have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of milk, tea leaves, sugar, green grams (mung beans), maize and wheat flour for use in his business.

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda is 44 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He is a cash crop farmer and also does livestock keeping. He has been in the farming business for 7 years now. This is his 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid his previous loans.

He will use the loan to buy pesticide, seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming, make more income and buy a plot to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 22 years old, single, and doesn’t have children. He has a motorcycle transport business, and he also sells scrap metals. This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

He will use this loan to buy scrap metals to sell. He hopes this will enable him to make more income, with which to buy another motorcycle and improve his living standard. His future hopes and dreams are to buy more motorcycles and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals to sell, which he hopes will enable him to buy another motorcycle and improve his living standard.

loans.name: Belleza

texts.en:
Belleza can’t thank you enough dear lenders and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance you’ve provided. The previous loan amount of Php 10,000 made her buy necessities for her food business which also increased the business’ revenue. 

There are times that she can’t avoid using the business’ fund to pay for house expenses. That’s why a supplementary fund is what she needs. She decided to apply for another loan in CCT, an amount of Php 10, 000. That will be used as a revolving fund for her to buy fresh meat daily and to have stock of condiments and other ingredients. The remaining amount will used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. 

She dreams to invest for their own house and lot someday and starts to save money to be able to buy additional unit of tricycle. She’s hoping that you’ll once again consider her story since she’s determined to succeed as she wants her child to finish college.

Belleza believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, flour. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas, flour. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas, flour.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 25 years old, has a lived-in partner with two children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard lives with her single daughter, in the village Tavrus, of Syunik region. Sirvard is a widow, and because she has a disabled daughter, life with difficulties and everyday hard work is very common for this woman. For many years she worked as a tailor, but now she is engaged in farming and agriculture, which is the only source of income for her and her daughter. In her farm she has cows, rabbits, and chickens. She also has a garden where she cultivates potatoes, beans and carrots, and trees including apple, mulberry, and cherry. All her farm goods Sirvard sells from her farm, since she cannot leave her daughter alone to take the products to the wholesale market.

Sirvard needs this loan very much. She will use this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to repair the roof of her cattle barn and to purchase fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her cattle barn and to purchase fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Pedro Nel

texts.es:
Pedro es un campesino de 44 años de edad, nació en el seno de una familia humilde campesina, en la que aprendió todo lo relacionado con la agricultura y la producción de panela, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de caña de azúcar y administra un negocio de producción de panela (trapiche), allí vende su producción en el mercado regional, de esta manera, genera los recursos económicos suficientes para brindar el sustento a sus tres hijos y solventar las necesidades básicas de la casa, ya que toda la carga económica recae sobre él.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre pujante, perseverante y sagaz, siempre está buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, venenos, fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar la limpieza de la cosecha de caña de azúcar, esto le permitirá mejorar notablemente sus cultivos y podrá tener una cosecha más productiva, generando mejores ingresos.

Pedro solo desea seguir trabajando arduamente para lograr que su negocio sea más rentable y tener la capacidad para brindar a su familia una mejor educación, bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 44-year-old farmer. He was born to a humble farming family, in which he learned everything related to agriculture and the production of raw cane sugar. Thanks to that, today he has sugar cane crops and manages a business of raw cane sugar production (mill). He sells his products in the regional market. In this way, he generates sufficient economic resources to provide support to his three children and to cover the basic needs of his house, since all of the economic responsibility falls to him.

He is characterized as a thriving man, perseverant and sharp, who is always looking for new alternatives that will allow him to get ahead. That is why he requests the support of a loan, with which he will buy wholesale agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticide, fertilizer, fungicide, and pay to clean the sugar cane harvest. This will allow him to notably improve his crop and he will be able to have a more productive harvest, generating better income.

Pedro only wishes to continue working arduously to make his business more profitable and to have the capacity to provide his family a better education, wellbeing, and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticide, fertilizer, and fungicide, and to pay to clean the sugar cane harvest.

loans.name: Bedrije

texts.en:
Bedrije was born with some disease that requires consistent blood transfusion and other related treatments. Kindly note that receiving blood in Albania costs too much and it's not free;400 gram of blood costs $55 when the min monthly pay is double this amount, that's it.

She said " I was always very sick and required treatments and blood always. We had no money to pay for it. This put a pressure on my two sons, 20 and 21-year-old who were doing very well in schools and had plans on continuing their education, yet they decided to start working to take care of my medical requirements. I am literally torn apart thinking that my sons did not follow their dreams," said Bedrije.

She is being photographed with Akil, one of her sons.They live in a little town in northern Albania where both sons work for a total monthly pay of $275 and Bedrije receives a disability income of $108/month.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her blood disorder .

loans.name: Vololoarimanga Mamy Hery Zo

texts.fr:
Mamy Hery Zo est une femme débrouillarde de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est agriculteur. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés scolarisés dans une école privée dans leur village.
Elle voudrait étendre et développer son activité d'élevage de porc, d'où la raison de sa demande de 2ème prêt auprès de CEFOR. Le premier prêt était remboursé régulièrement et a eu pour objet de financer son  principale activité: épi-gargote. L'élevage commençait en 2006 et l'épi-gargote en 2002. A part ces deux activités, elle exploite aussi une culture de gingembres.
L'objectif est d'améliorer le revenu familiale afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et continuer à financer les études de ses enfants qui font parties de sa priorité.
texts.en:
Mamy Hery Zo, aged 33, is resourceful woman. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. The couple have four children, of whom three are in a private school in their village.

She would like to expand and develop her business raising pigs, thus the reason for her request for a second loan from CEFOR. The first loan was repaid regularly; its goal was to finance her main business: a diner/grocery store. Her livestock farming began in 2006, and the diner/grocery, in 2002. Aside from these businesses, she also farms ginger.

The goal is to improve the family’s income in order to improve the family’s living conditions and to continue to pay for the children’s studies. These are some of her priorities.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and some feed

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a single mother and she works at the city hall of La Paz. With a lot of effort, she purchased land thanks to the help of her mother. Gilda has been doing the paperwork for her land.

Gilda started the construction of her house and she needs a loan to pay the construction of perimeter walls. She hopes you can help her, because she will take her mother to live with her when it is completed.

loans.use: to pay the construction of perimeter walls for her house

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is a 52 years old business woman and a resident of Commonwealth City, Philippines.  She’s managing a buy and sell business basically selling personal products like towels, umbrella and bags. She’s been in the industry for 5 years now and thankful to God for having the business and earning for about Php 18,000 every month. 

Aminah wants to save money and be capable of buying her own stall someday so that she’ll no longer pay for monthly rental. She also needs to have supplementary capital to buy products for her buy and sell business. That’s why she applied for a Php 25,000 loan. The amount will be used to buy personal products to add for the business like umbrellas, towels and different designs of bags. She’s hopeful that her application will be granted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since she has been a dedicated member. 

Aminah is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy personal products to add for her buy and sell business like umbrellas, towels and different designs of bags.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar needs a loan to buy an oven for his cookie making business, as he is a good cook. Omar is also going to college. Omar is single and he lives with his parents. He helps them with their expenses.

Omar discovered he had talent to cook when he helped his mother when he was a kid. That is why he started his business. Omar is studying Computer Systems and he would like to finish his studies first. He hopes you will trust him

loans.use: to buy an oven for his cookie making business. He is also studying IT at college.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is 49 years old and she lives in Vahagni village of Lori region. She is married and her husband works at the municipality. They have two school-aged children. Nune has higher pedagogical education and already 15 years she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She is known in her village as a very good and respected teacher and she also has a group of pupils whom she gives paid private training courses of Armenian Language and Literature since they are going to have entrance exams.

Nune asks this Kiva loan of 200.000 Armenian drams since she greatly wants to buy several very important new professional and also methodological literature's which will greatly improve the quality of her private courses.

loans.use: to buy several very important new professional and also methodological literature's which will greatly improve the quality of her private courses

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina works hard to support her family. Ma. Lina is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lina requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers.

Ma. Lina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Ma. Lina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat is 26 years old and he lives with his parents and brother Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. Smbat has higher education and specialty of pedagogue, but now he work not of his profession and he is employed at the private workshop. His parents are also employed and they simultaneously are engaged in farming and agriculture.

Smbat is so young but he has some health problems and all time he must control it in order to avoid more hardships connected with it. Now he asks this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams in order to pass an expensive and very important course of treatment.

loans.use: to pass an expensive and very important course of treatment

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 64 years old and married with ten children.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Antonieta has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Antonieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 48 ans, Akouelé est une femme avec trois enfants à charge. Habitant à Baguida, Akouelé prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Kom » à la devanture de son domicile en vue  de bien vendre et d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Akouelé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander le sac de maïs et des kilo de poissons congelés, Akouelé demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face à ses besoins personnel et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Akouelé, aged 48, is a married woman and has three children to support. Living in Baguida, she makes and sells “pâte bandée” [a kind of polenta] called “kom” in front of her home with the aim of selling a lot and having a good profit. Akouelé supplies herself twice a month at the market. To order a sack of corn and kilograms of frozen fish, Akouelé is asking for this loan to realize her purchase, so as to earn more income for coping with personal needs and helping her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and 5 kg of fish

loans.name: Jose Raomir

texts.es:
José es uno de los cientos de orgullosos paneleros que habitan en el departamento de Antioquia. En su trapiche produce este rico manjar que es utilizado por muchas familias alrededor de Colombia y el mundo.

Hoy en día desea darle un impulso su actividad con la compra de un motor para su máquina de moler caña de azúcar para reemplazar el que actualmente tiene en mal estado.

Este préstamo será muy importante para él ya que este trabajo es el único medio de ingresos que tiene para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is one of the hundreds of proud raw sugar cane producers who reside in the department of Antioquia. In his mill he produces this rich delicacy that is used by many families around Colombia and the world.

Today he wishes to give a boost to his business with the purchase of a motor for his sugar cane grinding machine to replace the one he currently has which is in poor condition.

This loan will be very important to him, since this work is the only means of income that he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his sugar cane grinding machine to replace the one he currently has which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, who is 28 years old and the mother of a little daughter and son, lives in Tbilisi with her husband. The only breadwinner in the family is Natia's husband. He works as a distributor and gets 500 GEL monthly. The income is hardly enough for the four-member family to meet all their daily costs of living.

In order to contribute her bit to the family's welfare and somehow increase their living conditions, Natia decided to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a trading business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Then Natia requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved, in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. This startup loan program provides startup credit with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income.

With the received credit, Natia will purchase a stock of various clothing and start trading. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the startup program, she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing and start a trading business.

loans.name: Leon

texts.en: Leon is still living with one of his sons.  Leon has to work from Monday to Friday and the weekends he uses his car as a taxi.  Leon needs more money, that is why he has two jobs. Leon needs a loan to pay the maintenance of his car.   And he keeps on doing improvements at his house, so he hopes you can help him again.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his car, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 43-year-old, married mother of two. She has been working from her home, providing private education services and selling accessories, since 1990. She uses her income to support her husband and family in improving their living and providing them with the best education. Zahra is an ambitious woman; she is working hard to make sure she can manage her business development, and reply to her family's needs at the same time.

Today, Zahra is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to expand her business, so that one day she can open a retail shop.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: St. Mary's Girls Ediofe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sr. Grace. She is the Head teacher of St. Mary’s Girls Ediofe School, a girls’ school in the rural area of Ediofe in Arua with 750 students. St. Mary’s Girls Ediofe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mary’s Girls Ediofe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sr. Grace ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is lucky that her partner, Felix, is always ready to extend help in her variety store business. They live in Buhangin, Davao City, Negros Occidental together with their children. Despite some challenges that come their way, they pursue their dream to expand their business and support the schooling of their children until completion. The stiff competition, huge collectibles, and lack of capital don’t stop them from persevering. They want to become more efficient in handling their business so as to meet the demands of customers.

As a member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost seven years, Mercedes is very thankful that she was able to access several loans before; it served as supplementary capital for her business. This time, she wants to access a PHP 29,000 loan to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, and assorted groceries. These additional supplies will result in a boost in her income and savings.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, and assorted groceries

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es: Mario tiene 21 años de edad de estado civil soltero viven en el campo con sus padres de avanzada edad, su vivienda carece de algunos servicios básicos, desde los 11 años atrás empezó a trabajar  como jornalero hace dos años se dedica a sembrar papas este pequeño negocio es sustento para él y sus padres. Mario necesita el dinero para comprar abono que su cultivo requiere obtendría más producción de papa, generando  ganancias  logrando  satisfacer las necesidades básicas del sector
texts.en: Mario is 21 years old, single, and lives in the country with his elderly parents. His home lacks some basic services. Eleven years ago he started working as a day laborer. For the last two years he has worked planting potatoes. This small business is what supports him and his parents. Mario needs money to buy fertilizer that his crop requires. He would obtain greater potato production, generating earnings and satisfying the basic needs of the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 62 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Nació en una familia campesina muy humilde, su madre le enseñó las tareas del campo, especialmente la cría de pollos, pues toda la vida se dedicaron a producir pollos y huevos que los comercializaban entre sus vecinos y ella siguió con esta tradición, aprovechando la ventaja de que por criar pollos y gallinas criollas se venden con mayor facilidad, de esta manera ha generado los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

La cliente es una mujer pujante y perseverante, trabajadora y dedicada a su labro, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de  gallinas y  pollos, concentrado para los animales, de esta forma podrá aumentar su producción y ampliar su mercado, pues tendrá la capacidad para ofrecer en tiendas cercanas.

De esta forma, Luz quiere seguir luchando para lograr el sueño de tener su casa propia y poner luz eléctrica a la casa donde vive actualmente con su familia, de esta forma podrá acondicionar mejor los galpones y la cría sería más productiva, lo que se le permitirá dar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a las personas que ama.
texts.en:
Luz is a 62 year old woman and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her partner.
She was born into a very humble country family. Her mother taught her farming work, especially raising chickens. Her mother produced chickens and eggs all her life and she sold them to her neighbors, and Luz is following this tradition and taking advantage of the fact that native chickens and hens can be sold most easily. In this way, she has generated enough resources to increase her household's standard of living.
This client is a forceful and perservering woman. She is hardworking and dedicated to her work as it is her main source of income. She is currently requesting a loan with the goal of buying chickens and hens and concentrate for the animals so that she will be able to increase production and grow her market. If she does this, she'll be able to sell in local stores.
In this way, Luz will keep fighting to achieve her dream of having her own house and of bringing electricity to the place where she currently lives, as this would improve her coops and her productivity. This would enable her to give a better quality of life to the people she loves and to improve their wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy hens and chickens and concentrate for the animals, so that she will be ablt to increase production and grow her market.

loans.name: Julie Marie Goretti

texts.fr:
29 ans, Julie est mariée et son époux est cuisinier dans un grand motel de la capitale. Le couple a deux enfants et il sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée.
Elle est commerciale de formation (Bac + 2 en commerce) et elle travaillait déjà dans ce secteur mais ceci n'avait pas marché et elle décidait de changer et d'entrer dans le secteur agricole. Elle a 6 ans d'expérience dans l'élevage de porc, c'est sa mère qui a suivi une formation et lui a formé après. 
Son objectif est d'épargner davantage et construire sa propre maison car elle et sa famille habitent encore dans une maison de patrimoine familiale pas encore partagée actuellement.
texts.en:
Julie, aged 29, is married, and her husband is a cook in a big hotel in the capital. The couple have two children, both in a private school. She has business training (high school diploma + 2 in commerce), and she has been working in this sector, although it did not go well. She decided to make a switch and enter the agricultural sector. She has six years of experience raising pigs. Her mother is the one who had taken the training and then trained Julie later.

Her goal is to save more money and build a house of her own, since she and her family still live in an inherited house which is not yet shared at this time.

loans.use: to purchase 2 pigs

loans.name: Shafa

texts.en:
Shafa is 43 years old and married. Shafa’s family consists of two children and her husband. She is from Agdas.

Shafa is the owner of a bookstore and she started her work about 20 years ago. When Shafa was a child, she read so much and her biggest dream was opening a bookstore. Now, she has gained a lot of experience at work, but currently she is not happy with the situation of her shop.Shafa wants to restore her bookstore. Therefore, she applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. She will use this money to buy new furniture like bookshelves and new books for expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy new furniture like bookshelves

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 31-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial living conditions of Palestinians in Lebanon, Rami started eight years ago working in the construction field as a plumber to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Rami has a good reputation among his region for his professional skills. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy updated tools which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and quick service. Rami hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and provide his family with descent living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy updated tools which will facilitate his plumbing and construction business.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 41-year-old, married mother of two, and a Palestinian refugee. She lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp. Souheir has been selling women's clothes for eight years. In June 2012 she established her current business, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Souheir is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special, new autumn-and-winter collection. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, to increase her income, and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special, new autumn-and-winter collection.

loans.name: Brendo

texts.en:
Brendo is from Merida, a fifth class municipality in the province of Leyte. Fifth class means a low-income class which translates to limited source of livelihood for many people. He is a 27-year-old married man who raises hogs for a living. He has been in the hog raising business for two years, however he is struggling to provide for their daily needs while also keeping the hogs healthy.

He is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed so to fatten his animals. In the future Brendo plans to increase his hogs and make his business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 63 years old and is from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married and her husband is a farmer. To make use of her time wisely, she is engaged in a sari-sari store business in her neighborhood to earn income. This business was started 40 years ago.

Virginia sells basic household items like canned goods, chips, seasoning and toiletries. She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk merchandise such as cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits. She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she can continue to support herself and her husband.

In the future, Virginia would like to make her store bigger and sell items that she does not previously carry. Any additional income will be used for family daily consumption, savings and expansion of her store.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits

loans.name: Maltina

texts.en:
Maltina is 37 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children. Her businesses are a food cafe and a farm. She has been in business for two years. She earns a monthly income of seventeen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy milk, sugar, rice flour, and other ingredients for cooking in the cafe.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to service the loan, and to increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice flour, and other ingredients for cooking in the restaurant.

loans.name: Aida Miria

texts.es:
Aida Miria con 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada,vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú, en una zona urbana. Aida Miria cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Aida Miria se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 05 años, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio. solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como son polos,blusas,pantalones y camisas. De esta manera hará crecer su negocio, obteniendo más ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Aida Miria a tenido préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa, de S/.2,400.00 a 15 meses el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
60 year old Aida Miria is married and lives in her own house along with her husband. They live in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo, Peru, in an urban area. Aida Miria has many good personal and work references from the people of the area. The inhabitants of this place work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.
Aida Miria works selling women's and men's clothes. She has 5 years experience in this role and her business is located in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, blouses, pants, and shirts. She is doing this to grow her business and generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.
Aida Miria had a loan of S/.2,400 from Edpyme Alternative that she repaid punctually in 15 months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, blouses, pants, and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn, and herbicide to care for his new corn crop.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora, a dried fish vendor, resides in Buhangin, Davao City. She also owns a variety store that sells the usual commodities, such as canned goods, snacks, toiletries, condiments, and many others. She decided to run a variety store because dried fish vending is unstable, especially during the rainy season.

Now she wants to prepare for the rainy days. She is requesting additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy a quantity in volume of dried fish to resell. She will also use part of the loan to buy more supplies for her variety store. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Teodora is married to Romeo, a retiree, and they have grown-up children. They are now relieved of huge educational expenses. Teodora can give full focus to improving her business. She is an enthusiastic member of CCT, where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a quantity in volume of dried fish to resell; also, more supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.es:
Graciela, a sus 55 años de edad es casada y madre de 8 hijos. Es agricultora y posee una finca donde tiene varias hectáreas de cultivos con productos como el yuca y plátano, cuyas cosechas son comercializadas en el mercado de la región y así obtiene el dinero necesario para sacar adelante su gran familia. 

Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, activa y pujante, esto le ha dado fuerzas para salir siempre adelante, sobrepasando los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, entre otros; adicionalmente comprara cerdos y alimento con lo que podrá continuar trabajando y de esta forma lograr que las cosechas sean más productivas y pueda aumentar las ventas de los alimentos, lo que afectará positivamente sus finanzas. 

Graciela sueña con poder continuar con sus cultivos y con sus animales, haciéndolos crecer día a día, para que su negocio sea mas productivo.
texts.en:
Graciela, 55, is married and has 8 children. She is a farmer and owns a farm where she has several hectares of crops such as cassava and bananas. She sells her produce at the local market and this way she makes the money she needs to provide for her large family. 

She is a hardworking, active and vibrant woman. This has given her the strength to always keep going forward, overcoming the various obstacles that she faces. 

Graciela is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of fertilisers and poisons amongst other things; additionally to buy pigs and food so that she can continue to work. This way she will manage to grow more productive crops and increase her sales of food which will positively affect her finances. Graciela dreams of being able to continue to farm her crops and animals, increasing their growth day by day so that her business is more productive.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and poisons amongst other things; additionally to buy pigs and food to keep working.

loans.name: Pebe

texts.en: Pebe is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Pebe is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Pebe would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Pebe will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay its sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Pebe no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Pebe hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une veuve femme résidant à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Agée de 43 ans, Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et du riz mélangé du haricot qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Afi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, de riz, des bols du haricot, le bidon d’huile et des tas de condiments en vue de bien vendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de subvenir aux charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a widow residing in Adidogomé with two children in her care. She is 43 years old and a retailer of charcoal. She also sells rice mixed with beans. Her supplies are gotten twice a month from the market. She resells in front of her home. To finance her purchase, Afi needs this loan to order sacks of charcoal and rice; bowls of beans; a container of oil; and loads of condiments, with the aim of doing well in her sales and making more profit, so as to cover her family's expenses. This would enable her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 13 sacks of charcoal, 6 sacks of rice, a container of oil, 8 bowls of beans, and 3 loads of condiments

loans.name: Woboube

texts.fr: Woboube est une femme âgée de 29 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Woboube est une marchande de produits alimentaires et des plateaux d’œufs qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Woboube désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sacs de détergents et des plateaux d’œufs en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Woboube is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. The married mother of two, she sells grocery items and eggs. Her supplies are gotten five times a month at the market, and she resells in front of her home and by circulating through nearby neighborhoods. Woboube would like this loan to finance her purchase of bags of detergents and trays of eggs with the aim of making a profit and earning more income, so as to do more to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 15 trays of eggs and 5 bags of detergents

loans.name: Akofa  Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Akofa est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Akofa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille énormément pour gagner ses revenus. Akofa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akofa demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois; ce qui lui permettra de mieux revendre et d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Akofa is 31 and the mother of three children.  She lives in Adidogomé and resells charcoal.  She works very hard to make a living.  Akofa stocks up four times per month at the market and resells her merchandise in front of her home.  Akofa is requesting this loan to buy a few bags of charcoal.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her sales and earnings, which will in turn allow her and to cover some her family's expenses and help her husband to pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 17 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 54-year-old woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married and has fourteen children, seven adult and seven school-aged children.

Lucia operates various businesses, such as running a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells a variety of goods. She also has a fishpond and a farm as well. Sonia describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a larger amount of loans.

She will buy grocery items: sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, and candies. She will also buy sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for their farm in order to have a good harvest. Lastly, she will buy fish meal for their fish.

Lucia’s goal in her life is to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies; also fertilizer and pesticides, and fish meal.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a farmer from Merida, Leyte. She is 33 years old. The place itself is a fifth-class municipality, which means that the place does not offer many options for a livelihood

Helen has been farming for ten years now. She grows vegetables and peanuts. She is asking for a loan to buy carabao (water buffalo) to help in land cultivation. When there is a water buffalo, Helen will not have to pay for other people's animal to do the plowing on the field. This way she can save money for other expenses.

Helen dreamed of a better life for her family, especially the education of her four children ages 3-15.

loans.use: to buy carabao (water buffalo)

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and married and she has one child to provide for. To earn a living, she has been engaged in a sari sari store business for the past 5 years. It has been a successful business for the family because it helps them to meet their daily needs. Elena wants to increase her income so that she can give her children a good life. She decided to take a loan to increase her store inventory and generate more income.

Elena plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor is thanking Kiva and its supporters and CCT, for their tireless support for small businessmen like him. The loans which were granted to him were a great help to grow and sustain his ornamental plants business.

Once again he would like to request a loan, in the amount of PHP 19,000. He will use it to buy fertilizer, garden soil, pots, nets, and seedlings, to grow a variety of ornamental plants. Pastor puts his whole heart into growing healthy plants, as this is his source of income to feed his family and send his College child to school. He trusts in your continuous support for his livelihood.

Pastor aims to expand his farm and aspires to a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week, to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as fertilizer, garden soil, pots, nets, and seedlings.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children.

Riffat's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has run his auto rickshaw business for the last six years. For the past several days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of frequent use and he believes that most of its parts are in disrepair. Because of this, he has been unable to generate income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but due to a lack of money, he is unable to cover the cost.

Therefore, Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Riffat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene un almacén en el que vende ropa. Inicio el negocio hace 1 año y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser más próspero. 
El dinero será invertido en la compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niño

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
David has everything he needs to face the world and lead a full life thanks to all his efforts. He has a store from which he sells clothes. He started his business a year ago and despite its short operation it has been well received in the industry.
 
David wants to expand his product supply and increase his sales by injecting capital into the company, and it is for this reason he is requesting a loan to be given the opportunity to be more successful. The money will be invested in the purchase of women’s, men’s and children’s clothing.

With high hopes for his business, David believes that his future can improve significantly thanks to the support of organisations such as Interactuar who make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing

loans.name: Yulieth Andrea

texts.es:
Yulieth desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Yulieth empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene una hija de 1 año (Ver Foto) que es su más grande adoración.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 6 horas.

Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas; además desea realizar la compra de una maquina recubridora.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yulieth learned the profession of making clothing at a very young age thanks to her mother who was a clothing maker her whole life. That is how, little by little, Yulieth began to understand and apply this knowledge.

She has a one-year-old daughter (see photo) who is her greatest adoration.

She is an enterprising woman, loving, and always ready to tend to her customers in the best way.

She is very grateful for everything she has been able to build to this day with the help of Corporación Interactuar.

She gets up every day to work on her business for 6 hours.

She requests economic support to buy supplies to make clothing such as fabric, thread, and needles. She would also like to buy a cover stitch machine.

She has many hopes for her business and she maintains the dream of having a much bigger shop in which she can offer employment and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make clothing such as fabric, thread, and needles, and to buy a cover stitch machine.

loans.name: Thearun

texts.en: Thearun is a 19-year-old single freshman from Tboung Khmum Province in Cambodia. Her parents are rice farmers. Thearun is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in agriculture at a university in the city. Currently, she is lacking the finances to cover her university fees from the first through fourth years, so she would like to request a loan. With the loan, she will be able to finish the first through fourth years successfully. For her future dreams, she wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary so she will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first through fourth years.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel con 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 3 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 1 mes, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Samuel espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
21 year old Samuel lives with his partner and is the father of 3 children. During he work life, he has had a number of independent businesses with which he has generated the income to raise his family.
1 month ago, he began selling pigs. He buys them, raises them, and later sells them when they have gained weight. This brings him the resources to keep caring for and sustaining his children.
Samuel is a hardworking, forceful man. He strives every day to get ahead, motivated by his family. This has impelled him to request a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy pigs and piglets so that he will have enough livestock available to meet his customers' orders and increase his profit margin.
In this way, Samuel hopes to take another step towards completing his greatest dream, which is to improve his home.
Improve the life of this Colombian with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs and piglets so that he will have enough livestock available to meet his customers'  orders.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 19-year-old single freshman who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Her parents earn their main income farming rice.

Due to the fact that Yen is short of the money to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to secure a loan. With this loan, she will be able to graduate.

After graduation, Yen wants to have a good job in a bank with a reasonable salary. She also wants to renovate a bigger house, and if she has children, she wants them to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Dúo Ángel De Santo Tomas Group
