texts.es: Dúo Ángel de Santo Tomas Este dúo está formado por doña Daila, ella tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica a la  venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, venta de consumo diario como pastas, frijol, arroz, papel higiénico, golosinas, detergente en polco y bola, leche en polvo, cereal, sopas instantáneas, desde ya hace varios años en el área de Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de abarrotes(productos comestibles para vender), y zapatos para surtir su tienda y atender las necesidades básicas de sus clientes así como  ser la tienda reconocida con los mejores productos y precios,
texts.en: The Ángel de Santo Tomas Este duo is comprised of two women. One of them,  Daila, is 40 years old and works selling shoes, clothes, and daily groceries such as pasta, beans, rice, toilet paper, candy, powdered and ball detergents, powdered milk, cereals, and instant soups. She has been doing this for some years in the Santo Tomas Milpas Altas area. She is requesting the loan to buy groceries (edible goods) and shoes to supply her store and meet her customers' needs. In this way, her store will become known for having the best products and prices.

loans.use: to buy edible goods to sell.

loans.name: Arsih

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Arsih, who is a 58-year-old married woman with one son. She and her husband are employees.

Arsih has requested a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Arsih will be able to repay the loan received.

Arsih and her family want to live healthy lives with good sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Robinson Maury

texts.es: Robinson de 20 años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene un hijo Dylan de  2 años de edad que permanece junto a sus madre, desde los 10 años siembra papas, alverja, habas, le gusta mucho el campo a pesar de que su vivienda no tiene luz eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado tampoco transporte para salir a la ciudad se tarda tres horas caminado. Robinson requiere  el dinero para comprar una bomba manual de fumigar, calcio para las plantas, incrementaría  la producción obtendría  ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar.
texts.en: Robinson, 20 years old, lives in a common law marriage. He has a son, Dylan, who is two years old and remains together with his mother. From the age of 10, he has planted potatoes, peas, and beans. He likes the country very much, despite his home not having electricity, potable water, or a sewage system, as well as transportation to go to the city, which is three hours walking. Robinson needs the money to buy a pesticide sprayer and calcium for his plants. With this, he would increase production and earnings in order to cover the basic expenses of his home.

loans.use: to buy a pesticide sprayer and calcium for his plants.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda, who was born in 1963, is a married mother of four. A very responsible woman, she always works hard for the well-being of her children.

With a store in a local market, Mavjuda has been busy selling a variety of women's seasonal clothes for more than 22 years. She wants to increase her assortment of goods and so is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy women's clothes for the new season. Mavjuda awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is motorcycle taxi. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 14,000 Kenya shillings.

This is Rose's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to open a retail shop to diversify her source of income.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children and reinvest the rest in the shop business to boost it. Her hopes and dreams are to have a fleet of vehicles.

loans.use: to open a retail shop to diversify her source of income.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is determined and perseveres in running her variety store business as she dreams of having a one-stop-shop someday. Indeed, a revolving fund is necessary for a business. But when her previous loan was granted, the amount made a vast impact. She was able to buy sacks of rice and other grocery items to add to her business. She wants to thank lenders since the amount they’ve provided became a way for her to increase revenue. Her total income is approximately Php 15,000 every month.

Myrna wants to thank as well the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan. She is blessed by God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT and all of the lenders with compassionate hearts. She’s also grateful as CCT conducts seminars for entrepreneurs. She prays that God will continually bless the business and be able to continually support her children’s educational expenses. 

This year, she’s requesting another loan of Php 50,000. She’ll utilize the amount, if granted, to buy sacks of rice and grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, and processed foods. 

On a weekly basis, Myrna regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, her experiences in business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, and processed foods.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is 39 years old and separated, with two children, residing in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. 

She owns and operates for rent a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for a couple of years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying goods in her small retail store. She is now taking a new loan to repaint and to buy a new brake pad for her motorcycle for safer travel with customers. 

Jessel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase motor accessories for maintenance.

loans.name: Suherni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Suherni, a 34-year-old married mother of one daughhter. She has a small shop, and her husband has been a driver for ten years.

Suherni has requested a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but she will be able to repay the loan received.

Suherni and her family want to live healthy lives with good sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar es un campesino pujante y luchador, nacido en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en el campo una alternativa de vida y de la cual aprendió a realizar todas las actividades agropecuarias que hoy en día son su principal fuente de ingresos. 

A sus 49 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de pollos y cerdos, además tiene gallinas ponedoras cuyos huevos son vendidos en el mercado del municipio donde reside; así genera recursos suficientes llevar la carga económica del hogar y con el sostenimiento de sus 2 hijo. 

El crédito será invertido en la compra de gallinas ponedoras y cerdos, así aumentará la producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus productos, mejorando las ventas y el margen de rentabilidad del negocio. 

Así podrá avanzar para cumplir su mayor anhelo que es ampliar su galpón y tener una producción de huevos con muchas gallinas.
texts.en:
Omar is a thriving and determined farmer, born into a humble family that found an alternative life in the land and from whom he learned to carry out all the farming tasks that are now his main source of income. 

Omar, 49, makes a living breeding and selling chickens and pigs. He also has laying hens whose eggs he sells at the local market near his home; this way he generates enough to carry the financial burden of the home and support his two children. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of laying hens and pigs, that way production will increase and he will meet the demand for his products, improving sales and the business profitability margin. Omar will then be able to move forward and fulfil his greatest dream which is to expand his warehouse and egg production with many hens.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, a 40-year-old member of *CCT General Trias branch. She is married to Arnulfo, a driver, and has two children. She has worked as a jeepney operator for three years and her earnings help fund her family's daily sustenance. She felt encouraged when she learned about Kiva and its lenders supporting the livelihoods of people in developing countries.

In the Philippines, jeepneys were originally used by the American military during World War II. Jeepneys are often converted into transportation vehicles; a jeepney is made two meters longer and two long, upholstered seats are installed in its bed. Jeepneys have become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation. Ana's vehicle needs regular and proper maintenance to ensure efficient performance and a steady income.

For this reason, Ana is humbly requesting a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for the regular maintenance of her jeepney to avoid breakdown. She hopes for a positive response to her request. This will ensure she can maintain her regular earnings and support her family's personal and household needs.

Ana hopes to acquire a new jeepney and look for additional ways to earn income. She prays for abundance in their lives. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her tricycle for public transportation, including oil changes, tune-ups, tires, fuel, and brakes.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Loem is the mother of 4 children and she owns a small grocery shop. She needs to be present in the shop all day. It takes a lot of energy to run her business till nighttime; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out without notice. She has no choice but to stay in pitch black until the morning, which disturbs not only her life, but also her business. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar-energy system to sustain her business’s energy usage and also her family usage. With a home solar-energy system, she won't have to worry about sudden power outages anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar-energy system.

location.town: Dong Tong Village, Sambo Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Sokki

texts.en: Sokki has 3 children and lives in Sampin village.  She cares for the children and helps her husband with the farming. She is concerned about her family's safety when she is not at home; her family uses a car battery as the power source. She charges the car battery daily. It is a time and money consuming activity. She will used the loan to buy a home-based solar system. She would be relieved because she would no longer worry about her children's safety. Her children operate the light by themselves without help from adults. Her family therefore  live with bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a home-based solar system.

location.town: Sampin Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distri

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is an active borrower with Brac. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and runs a food stall to sell samosa, pakoras, and tea. She is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold.

Jamila's needs to purchase different types of food and other items for her business. She wants to increase the size of her business, improve her sales growth, and earn maximum profit.

Jamila has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her food stall business

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 37-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She has 2 children and her husband is responsible for meeting the family's needs. Shumaila has had s boutique business for 6 years and contributes her income to manage the house hold.

Shumaila needs to buy different types of fabrics and a piko machine for business purposes but she is not in the position to buy these items. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase the fabrics and piko machine. She wants to earn additional income to support her family and business.

Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy fabric and piko machine her for boutique business

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Susi, who is a 43-year-old married woman with one daughter. Susi is a housewife and her husband is an employee for five years. 

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Susi will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: Doña Sindy junto a su familia con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda, sin embargo, desea ampliar la misma, esto con el fin de tener mayor espacio y mejorar la comodidad de la misma. Para llevar a cabo este proyecto necesita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), para la compra de materiales de construcción, entre estos, laminas de zinc, arena, tubos de metal necesarios para dicha actividad.
texts.en: Sindy, together with her family and with much effort, has succeeded in building her house.  However, she wishes to expand it with the goal of having more space and improved comfort.  To carry out this project she needs a loan of $250 to buy construction materials including sand, zinc metal sheeting and metal pipe.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand her house

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto con 25 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive en casa familiar,junto a su madre y abuela, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Luis Alberto se dedica a prestar servicio como jornalero agrícola, por zona de residencia y alrededores, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 02 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales menores para dedicarse a la crianza y venta. El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará obtener ingresos adicionales.

Luis Alberto no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 25, is single and lives at home with his mother and grandmother in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque department of Peru. Most people from his town work in agriculture, trade and livestock. 

Luis Alberto makes a living as an agricultural labourer in his town and the surrounding areas. He has 2 years of experience working in this industry. He is requesting a loan to buy young animals to breed and sell. The loan will provide him with the opportunity to make additional income.

Luis Alberto has no credit history and is a new partner for Edpyme Alternativa

loans.use: to buy young animals to breed and sell

loans.name: Farha

texts.en:
Farha is an active borrower of Brac who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 2 daughters and has run a crockery shop for 2 years. Her husband is responsible for meeting the needs of his entire family and managing the house hold.

Farha's wants to purchase jugs, glasses, and dinner sets to meet the demands of her customers, but due to financial constraints, she is not in the position to buy these items.

Farha has applied for a Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy these items. She will increase her daily sales and earn more income.

Farha is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crocks.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El cliente Marco pertenece al banco "SUMAC SONCCO" y se sigue dedicando al negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonido. Esta actividad lo realiza en fiestas y compromisos, sus herramientas de trabajo necesitan mantenimiento y repuestos para brindar un mejor servicio, es por ello que el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cables y amplificadores.
Marco está muy agradecido con los inversionista de KIVA por eso se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marco belongs to the "Sumac Soncco" communal bank, and he continues to work in the business of renting out sound equipment. He performs this job at parties and events. His work tools need maintenance and parts in order to provide a better service. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy cables and amplifiers.

Marco is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, and he promises to be timely in his payments.

loans.use: to buy cables and amplifiers.

loans.name: Dúo Santiaga De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Santiaga de San Pedro La señora Santiaga de 38 años de edad, dueña de una tortillería desde hace 1 año, casada, madre de 5 hijos, está muy agradecida con Dios por el negocio que tiene.  Su sueño es tener un comal industrial ya que el actual es un comal de barro y tortea con leña.  Ella ha recibido una buena oferta de maíz si es comprada  por quintal valorada a Q. 100.00 c/u y no desea desaprovecharla, por ese motivo desea un préstamo, pa la compra de maiz ya que el dinero que ha ahorrado no le alcanza.  Ella  agradece mucho  la oportunidad que se le dará a pesar de la distancia.
texts.en: The communal bank "Santiaga de San Pedro" includes Santiaga, who is 38 years old.  She has owned a tortilla business for a year.  She is the mother of 5 children, and she is very grateful to God for her business.  Her dream is to have an industrial griddle, because now she has a griddle made of clay that she heats with firewood.  She has recieved a good opportunity to buy corn at at rate of 100 Honduran quetzales per 100-lb. sack, and she doesn't want to miss out on this deal.  This is why she wants a loan to buy corn, as she doesn't have enough savings to make the purchase.  She is very grateful for this opportunity that is being given to her in spite of the distance.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Chhoeurn and his wife (both pictured, in front of their house) are farmers living with 4 children in Chor village, which is far from the power grid. Besides farming, Chhoeurn owns a small feeding farm. He feeds pigs and chickens. As a farmer and also businessman, he wants to expand his business with 6 hectares of land, which will allow his family to live in comfortable conditions. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because he is so busy, he doesn’t have time to charge the battery, and the whole family is in pitch black for the whole day. He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high-quality home solar-energy system. After using solar home energy, he believes his family's living condition will be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar-energy system.

location.town: Chor Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear Dist

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su moto a través de las veredas del municipio de San Pedro posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, sostiene a su familia a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar una nueva motocicleta y así poder tener la capacidad de emplear a alguien más.

Con este crédito podrá trabajar y tener mejores ingresos.

Apoya a Heriberto con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Heriberto is a very hardworking and organized man. He earns a living providing a transport service for people by motorcycle through the streets of San Pedro, enabling movement of the community to different areas of the city.

He is a friendly man, helpful and very enterprising. He supports his family, for whom he has always sought to provide the best possible life.

He is seeking a loan to buy a new motorcycle and thereby be able to have the capacity to employ another person.

With this loan, he will be able to work and have a better income.

Support Heriberto with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and thereby be able to have the capacity to employ another person.

loans.name: Hajarisoa Faramalala Eva

texts.fr:
Eva a 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Deux des ces derniers sont actuellement scolarisés dans une école primaire privée. Son mari est ingénieur retraité(environnement).
Elle a déjà eu 2 prêt avec CEFOR dont le premier était destiné à financer son activité de production et vente yaourts, activité exercée depuis 2007 et le 2ème était pour redémarrer l'élevage de porc. Son objectif est de développer et étendre l'élevage, augmenter le nombre des cheptels. Ce 3ème prêt va être utilisé pour acheter 4 têtes de porcs et des provendes. 
Elle rêve une meilleure et confortable vie pour sa famille et une meilleure éducation pour ses adorables enfants.
texts.en:
Eva is forty-two years old. She is married and a mother of three. Two of them currently attend a private primary school. He husband is a retired environmental engineer.

She already has benefited from two CEFOR loans. The first was to help her finance her business producing and selling yogurt, which she has been managed since 2007. The second was to restart breeding pigs. Her objective is to develop and expand her breeding business by increasing the number of animals. This third loan will be used to buy four pigs and feed for them.

She dreams of a better, more comfortable life for her family, and better education for her adorable children.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and some feed.

loans.name: Ayité Adjoa

texts.fr: Agée de 62 ans, Ayitevi est une veuve femme qui vit à Baguida avec trois enfants à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Ayitevi vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Ayitevi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de sardines, de lait peak et des paquets de bonbons, Ayitevi sollicite ce crédit pour financer son achat et pouvoir bien revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir au mieux les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayitevi is a sixty-two year-old woman living in Baguida with three dependent children.

To support her well-being, Ayitevi retails groceries and generates revenues through this business. She procures her merchandise three times a month at the market.

Ayitevi is requesting this loan to order boxes of sardines, Peak milk, and bags of candy. The loan will help her finance her purchase and sell well, to have a good profit margin and provide for her children to the best of her abilities.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of sardines, three boxes of Peak milk, and six bags of candy.

loans.name: Ancelmo Leonardo

texts.es: Anselmo tiene 32 años está casado su  esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijas Tania de 13, Karen de 12, Angie de 10 años estudian en escuelas públicas del sector, carecen de algunos servicios básicos, hace 15 años  se dedica a la crianza de terneros los compra pequeños los alimenta hasta que crecen y los vende. Anselmo necesita el dinero para comprar dos terneros, balanceado, sal luego de un tiempo desea venderlos obtener ingresos para pagar la alimentación y educación de sus pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
Anselmo is 32 years old, he is married and his wife is a housewife. They have 3 daughters who attend public schools in the area: Tania is 13, Karen is 12 and Angie is 10 years old. They lack some basic amenities.

Anselmo makes a living breeding calves which he buys when young and feeds them until they grow and sells them. He needs money to buy two calves. After a while he hopes to sell them to make an income to pay for food and education for his young daughters.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Angela tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser comerciante independiente, inicialmente tenía un negocio de venta de frutas y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta lograr tener una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaja actualmente. 

Este negocio inició en un local arrendado, pero con los buenos resultados que ha dado, ella pudo ahorrar y convertirse en propietaria del local. 

La cliente se caracteriza por su entusiasmo y pujanza, su espíritu luchador la ha llevado a lograr sus objetivos y con el apoyo de algunos créditos anteriores ha hecho crecer su negocio. 

Por esta razón solicita un crédito, con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor como café, granos, productos de aseo, mecato, confitería, lácteos, entre otros, de esta forma tendrá un inventario más variado y podrá satisfacer todas las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, lo que incrementará su margen de utilidades por ventas. 

Angela es una mujer soñadora y para lograr sus objetivos seguirá trabajando incansablemente para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer aún más su negocio, lo que le dará más rentabilidad y podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida con las personas que ama.
texts.en:
Angela is 38 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  During her productive life, she works as an independent seller.  Initially, she had a business selling fruit; and little by little, it grew until it turned into a grocery store where she currently works.  This business began in a rented premises; but with the good results that she got, she was able to save and to become the owner of the premises.

Angela is characterized by enthusiasm and strength.  Her fighting spirit has allowed her to reach her objectives; and with the support of some previous loans, she has created her business.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan with the desire to buy stock wholesale such as coffee, grains, toiletries, snacks, pastries, dairy products, among other things, so that she will have a more varied inventory and will be able to meet all of the needs and wants of her customers, which will increase her profit margin on sales.

Angela is a woman who dreams; and in order to achieve her goals, she will continue working untiringly so that in the future she can fulfill her dream to grow her business even more.  This will give her more profits, and she can give her children a better education and enjoy better living conditions with the people that she loves.

loans.use: To buy stock wholesale such as coffee, grains, toiletries, snacks, pastries, diary products, among other, so that she will have a more varied inventory.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Akouvi est âgée de 31 ans et habite à Baguida où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan ». Alouvi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché du nécessaire servant à la préparation et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs, de sucre le tas de tomates et piment en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a married woman with four dependent children. She is thirty-one years old and lives in Baguida where she prepares and sells "pâte bandée," a dish made from corn and named "Akpan."

Akouvi procures merchandise four times monthly at the market. She buys the ingredients necessary for her preparation and sells from home and in nearby neighborhoods.

Akouvi is requesting this loan to order bowls of corn, sugar, bunches of tomatoes and hot peppers. She wants to sell well and increase profits to provide for her needs and improve her children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thirty-one bowls of corn, ten bowls of sugar, and one heap of tomatoes and hot peppers.

loans.name: Dúo Abejitas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Dúo Abejitas de Santo Tomas Este dúo  está formado por doña Ana Lucrecia, ella tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de calzado para dama, caballero y niños, venta de ropa para  dama, caballero, niño y niña en el area  de cabañas, y en el  área e Santo Tomas Milpas Altas y Santa Lucia,  ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa, zapatos para dama caballeros y niños porque su deseo es tener bien surtido su negocio para la feria de Cabañas  y su mayor deseo es tener buena venta y buena ganancia y su mayor deseo es mejoras la calidad de vida de sus hijos,
texts.en:
Abejitas de Santo Tomas Duo
Ana Lucrecia is a member of this duo. She is 40 years old and sells shoes for women, men, and children and clothing for women, men, boys, and girls in the Cabañas, Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, and Santa Lucia areas. She is asking for the loan to buy clothing and shoes for women, men, and children because her desire is to have her business well-stocked for the Cabañas fair and her greatest desire is to have good sales and good income and to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme divorcée de 38 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de deux enfants, Afi est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames et des céréales. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames et des bols de maïs, Afi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien vendre et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en payant les frais scolaire dès ce début de la rentrée.
texts.en:
Afi is a thirty-eight year-old divorced woman who lives in Baguida. She is a mother of two.

Afi retails yam tubers and cereals. She procures her merchandise twice monthly at the market and retails from under a shed in front of her house to reach her objectives.

Afi needs this funding to finance her order of yam boxes and bowls of corn. Her goal is to sell well and make a good profit margin so that she can provide for her children's needs by paying school expenses starting in this new school year.

loans.use: to buy three containers of yams and fifty bowls of corn.

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en: Bunly and his wife (both pictured, in front of their house) have 2 children. They run a business in Chor village selling wood for building houses. Besides the wood business, Bunly has a farm for feeding pigs. Bunly needs to make sure his home business has reliable energy. Currently, Bunly and his wife use a car battery to sustain their energy needs; however, the car battery is not reliable. It has a short lifespan and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out during the night. After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses a solar-energy system, Bunly decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy one for himself. He believes this decision will improve his energy supply, which will help him run his business and also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar-energy system.

location.town: Chor Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear Dist

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives with her family in Canibungan Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She helps her husband work on the farm. When her husband has free time as he waits for crops to grow, he runs a transportation business in the village to meet their daily needs. Elizabeth borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to cover the costs of farm fertilization and weeding maintenance. In the future, she wants to buy additional farmland to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis tiene 63 años de edad está casado su esposa realiza  quehaceres domésticos del hogar  viven en el campo en un lugar muy alejado no existe transporte, carecen de servicios básicos, hace cincuenta años se dedica a sembrar papas este pequeño negocio le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su mesa. Luis necesita el dinero para comprar abono y calcio  mejorar sus cultivos obtener mayores ingresos para poder satisfacer sus necesidades básicas de él y su esposa.
texts.en: Luis is 63 years old. He is married. His wife does the household domestic chores. They live in the country in a very remote place. There is no transportation and they lack basic services. For fifty years he has grown potatoes. This small business has allowed him to put food on his table. Luis needs the money to buy manure and calcium to improve his crops and obtain a better income in order to be able to meet his and his spouse's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and calcium to improve his crops

loans.name: Een

texts.en: Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Een, who is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. Een sells chips to earn a living and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of 7,200,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Een's family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but the loan will make these things possible. Een and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve clean water and sanitation access for her family.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria, a sus 45 años se dedica a cuidar de su familia, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer juiciosa, entregada  a su familia con la que han pasado situaciones muy difíciles en el transcurso de su vida.  

“Me gusta capacitarme en diversos temas, porque quiero tener diversas  opciones para montar mi propio negocio más adelante y poder apoyar la carga económica en mi hogar”, con estas palabras, Maria manifiesta su motivación para solicitar el crédito, con el que pagará un curso de capacitación en repostería, porque quiere aprender a elaborar diferentes tipos de comestible, ya que ve en esto una oportunidad de negocio que puede ser rentable a mediano plazo. 

Su principal sueño es montar su propio negocio, con el que pueda obtener ingresos para continuar con el sostenimiento de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, at 45 years old, takes care of her family; she is a housewife. She lives with her husband and has two children. She is a prudent woman, devoted to her family with whom she has been through very difficult situations in the course of her life.

"I like to be trained in various subjects because I want to have different options to start my own business later on and be able to help with the financial burden in my home." With these words, María manifests her motivation to request the loan with which she'll pay a training course in baking because she wants to learn how to make different types of food since she sees in this a business opportunity that can be profitable in the medium term.

Her main dream is to start her own business with which she could obtain the income to continue supporting her family and improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a training course in baking to learn how to make different types of food.

loans.name: Norma  Maria

texts.es:
Norma continua dedicándose a su tienda de abarrotes, ella pertenece al banco "SUMAC SONCCO" .como toda emprendedora busca ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.
La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar galletas, fideos, arroz, aceite y gaseosas.
Norma se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas , y está muy agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA.
texts.en:
Norma continues to make a living from her grocery store, she is a member of the
"SUMAC SONCCO" community bank. Like every businesswoman she is looking for ways to expand her business and get ahead.

The borrower needs the loan to buy biscuits, noodles, rice, oil and sodas.

Norma promises to make her repayments on time and is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, rice, oil and sodas.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 15 años e inicio con capital propio su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de u hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pescado por mayor, una bascula, una hielra y un frizzer para mantener su producto fresco y asi tener mejores ingresos eonomicos.
texts.en: Gloria is 46 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been selling fish for a living for fifteen years, and started with her own funds. Her business is located in the municipal market, and she already has many clients. With the earnings she receives from her sales, she is able to pay some of her home expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish at wholesale price, as well as a scale, refrigerator, and a freezer to keep her product fresh and, thusly, to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fish in bulk, a scale, refrigerator, and freezer.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith has been a fish vendor for eight years now, selling a variety of fish to the locals in her community. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are 12 and 13 years old. Her husband earns a living by working as a waiter in one of the private restaurants in her town.

Judith is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish and water for sanitation in order to attract more customers. She will then use the additional resulting capital to invest in other sources of income.

In the future, Judith hopes to establish a sari-sari (variety) store to have a more stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and water for sanitation.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
With the help of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and Kiva lenders, Theresa was able to buy boxes of biscuits to sell using her previous loan money. Theresa is a new entrepreneur and she is thankful to everyone who helped fund her previous loan.

It’s difficult for Theresa to run her business during the rainy season since she sells products from her bicycle. She wants to expand her business and invest in her own stall. Christmas is fast-approaching and Theresa wants to purchase boxes of biscuits and have an extra capital to support her business. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP and she’s hoping that her request will be considered once again.

Theresa regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and business experiences, draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of biscuits for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim and her husband are farmers who live in the village of Prey Sampov with their three children, two of whom have already started working in a factory nearby. Every day, Rim gets up early to feed her pigs and prepare the farming equipment. She is not happy with her car battery, which she uses to provide energy. She has to spend time and money going to charge the battery every 2 or 3 days. Moreover, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes during pig-feeding in the early morning, the power suddenly shuts off, which affects not only her business, but also her family life. As a result, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a home solar-energy system. She believes the system will provide enough energy for her family's needs and also improve her working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar-energy system.

location.town: Prey Sampov Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe E

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, con 22 años de edad es madre de 1 niño y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía, ofrece ropa, perfumes, entre otros y con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante los tres años que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, dedicada y comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor como calzado y ropa para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. 

De esta manera, Ana podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño hijo, brindándole una estabilidad económica favorable para darle la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Ana, 22 years of age, is the mother of a little boy and lives in a common law marriage with her husband.

At present, Ana sells merchandise, offering clothing and perfumes, among other items. With this activity, she has managed to obtain the resources necessary to sustain the family in her home during the three years she has been involved in this activity.

Ana is an enterprising woman with vision, very dedicated and committed to her family and her work. She is always looking for opportunities that will permit her to progress. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of added merchandise, such as shoes and clothing, at wholesale, to take advantage of available discounts. Also, she wishes to offer greater variety to satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers. This will enable Ana to improve her profit margin on sales..

In this manner, Ana will be able to advance towards the achievement of her primary objective, which is to expand her business and improve the quality of life of her little son, offering the family the economic stability that will enable her son to obtain the best possible education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, including shoes and clothing, at wholesale to take advantage of  available discounts.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel has learned to work hard as the mother of two children, ages 1 month and 5 years old. She always takes advantage of merchandise and food that she can sell to earn income. For the last three years, Maricel has been selling dried fish, t-shirts, blouses, and pants. She also cooks snacks such as turon (a Filipino snack made of thinly-sliced bananas dusted with brown sugar, rolled in a spring roll wrapper and fried), pancakes, and cold sweet drinks. She also plans to sell rice and feed. In addition, Maricel grows vegetables such as bottle gourds and bitter gourds.

Maricel is asking for a loan to buy stocks of t-shirts, blouses, pants, flour, milk, eggs, sugar, dried fish, bananas, rice, and feed. It is her dream to someday own a small grocery store and establish business locations in other places. Her income will go towards her family's needs, including food and her child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy stocks of t-shirts, blouses, pants, flour, milk, eggs, sugar, dried fish, bananas, rice, and feed.

loans.name: Ana Paola

texts.es:
Ana, radicada zona rural del municipio de Sincelejo, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos meses con su propia cría de carneros y cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.
De este negocio dependen sus hijos.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, from a rural area of the municipality of Sincelejo, has always worked in the agricultural sector by her family's side, where she learned this occupation.

For several months, she has been raising her own sheep and pigs to fatten for sale and distribution in several areas of her town.

She dreams of increasing the number of pigs to raise, and she asked the Interactuar Corporation for a loan, with which she will acquire several pigs and the supplies to feed and maintain them.

The earnings obtained from increasing the number of her animals will be much greater, which will allow her to have a better standard of living without so much economic difficulty.

Her children depend on this business.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have her own house and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, and she asked the Interactuar Corporation for a loan, with which she will acquire several pigs and the supplies for feeding and maintaining them.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
Gladys, con 38 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 6 hijos. 

Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes ubicada la frente de la casa donde reside, allí trabaja solo todos los días, gracias a la experiencia que tiene en el manejo de este tipo de establecimientos, ya que algunos de sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad; ofrece todo tipo de productos para la canasta familiar y, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Sus principales desafíos son la competencia que hay en el sector y lograr mantener a su familia con los ingresos que obtiene; sin embargo, la cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activa y trabajadora y, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato, entre otros), lo que le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos disponible para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, permitiéndole tener más ventas y mejorar los ingresos que recibe por su labor. 

Gladys sueña con formalizar su negocio, acreditarlo y, en un futuro poder comprar un local para no tener que seguir pagando arriendo, pues es muy costoso y afecta las finanzas familiares; haciendo esto podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y educación a sus hijos y tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecerles una estabilidad económica y calidad de vida favorable.
texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old and the single mother of 6 children.

During her working life she has worked in a grocery store located at the front of the house where she lives. She works there on her own every day thanks to the experience that she has in managing this type of establishment since some of her relatives work at this occupation. She offers all types of basic household products and in this way has generated the income necessary to cover the basic necessities of her home.

Her main challenges are the competition that there is in the area and managing to maintain her family on the income that she gets. However, Gladys is characterized by being vigorous, active and hard-working. She is always looking for new alternatives that will allow her to continue advancing. Thus, she is requesting the help of a loan with which she wants to buy an assortment of wholesale items (soft drinks, beer, pastries among others) which would allow her to have products available to satisfy the demand which will increase with the coming Christmas season. This will allow her to have more sales and improve the income that she receives for her work.

Gladys' dream is to formalize her business, accredit it and in the future be able to buy her own premises so she does not have to continue paying rent since this is very costly and affects the family finances. Doing this she would be able to provide better well-being and education for her children and she would have the opportunity to offer them economic stability and a more favorable quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a selection of wholesale goods such as soft drinks, beer, pastries etc.

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 4 años se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo deliciosos platillos de comida a base de arroz, carne, pollo, pescado y verduras, dicha actividad le ha permitido salir adelante  y mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia, además ella vende los fines de semana por las noches pupusas y bebidas frías y calientes como una manera de tener más ingresos económicos y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Sandra habita con sus 2 hijas de 10 y 5 años de edad y su grupo familiar,  en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años. Sandra desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que con el crédito anterior logro mejorar sus servicios,  por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gallina india, carne, pescado, maíz por mayor, chicharrón entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Sandra is an enterprising woman of 37 who for the last 4 years has made a living preparing and selling delicious food dishes based on rice, meat, chicken, fish and vegetables. This business has allowed her to move forward in life and maintain her family's financial stability. In addition, on weekend evenings she sells pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas), as well as cold and hot drinks, as a way of having more income and better serving her customers.

Sandra has been living with her family in their own home for many years. She has two daughters, ages 10 and 5. Sandra wishes to continue investing in her business, as with the previous loan she managed to improve her services. So she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI so that she can buy chicken, meat, fish, corn at wholesale, roast pork and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, fish, corn at wholesale, roast pork and other ingredients.

loans.name: Alex Alexander

texts.es: Alex de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado repasto y a la agricultura desde hace mas de 10 años gracias a su trabajo es como el puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado repasto y asi poder continuar con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Alex is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his family unit. He has worked raising beef cattle and farming for more than ten years. Thanks to his work he has been able to keep ahead of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more beef cattle and be able to continue to raise them to improve his economic income.

loans.use: to buy more beef cattle.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en: Kun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sharlene

texts.en:
Sharlene wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for her previous loan, which allowed her to stock ready-to-wear clothes for her buy-and-sell business. She's now able to accommodate bulk orders and she has seen a noticeable increase in her revenue. She believes that God will return the favor to those people with considerate hearts.

Sharlene is amazed by how God uses people to answer her prayers. She wants her business to succeed so she can provide for her family's necessities, maintain good health, and ensure a good future for her family.

There are certain expenses Sharlene faces in order to support her business. She hopes to buy new designs of clothes on a weekly basis with a revolving fund she will set up with her loan money. Sharlene is applying for a loan of 17,000 PHP and she’s hoping that lenders will once again consider her story.

Sharlene consistently attends weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners. Fellowship groups consist of 15 to 30 members. Each week, Sharlene and her fellow members gain spiritual strength from life-changing testimony, share their experiences of God’s love, pay micro finance loans, and hear God’s word.

loans.use: To buy new designs of clothes on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito 8 Group

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 35 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 10 y 16 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad del caserío san Miguelito.
Elena (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, hace 10 años decidió escoger una actividad que le permitiera obtener mejores ingresos y la actividad que dignamente escogió fue la producción de café, gracias a su esmero y dedicación esta actividad le ha permitido brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Elena junto a un grupo de señoras con las que tienen las mismas necesidades solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con este crédito ella espera poder cosechar una buena producción de café. Su esperanza de vida es mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elena is a 35 year old woman. She is married with a beautiful family with three children between the ages of 10 and 16. This family lives in a community in the village of San Miguelito.

10 years ago Elena (first from the right side of the photograph) decided to choose a job that would allow her to obtain a better income to satisfy her family's needs. The job that she chose was coffee production. Thanks to her care and dedication, this job has allowed her to provide her children with the necessities. Elena, along with a group of women who have the same needs, is requesting a loan to invest in buying fertilizer and to pay labor costs for maintaining her coffee crop. With this loan, she hopes to be able to produce good coffee yields. Her hope in life is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina learned the art of tanning when she worked for a local tanning salon. She began as a bed cleaner and within one year, she worked her way up to manager. From her experience as manager, she gained valuable knowledge and contacts in the beauty industry.

The business closed and Sabrina was left without a job. Sabrina decided that the timing was right for her to start her own business.

Sabrina began her business Brushed…by Sabrina, which offers a variety of beauty packages, including air brush tanning and hair salon services, in one location.

Sabrina will use her Kiva loan to purchase hair products and tanning supplies for her business and pay for advertising to gain more clientele.

Sabrina has a passion for her clients and her craft. She loves making people feel beautiful and seeing the smiles on her clients' faces when they feel good about themselves on the inside and on the outside.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and pay for advertising.

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en:
Khern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khern works as a factory laborer and does extra work as an officer to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Sombuk's Group

texts.en:
Sombuk’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sombuk makes a living cultivating rice and she does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Marcela Luisa

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo, su negocio es la venta de productos de uso personal.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. 

Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de Sincelejo; un área estratégica porque tiene un alto flujo comercial; es una vitrina de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, la zona es una muestra del panorama típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad. 

Actividad que realiza desde su casa, en diferentes horarios ya que es ama de casa.

Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un almacén, ella desea realizar la compra de lociones, desodorantes y cremas al por mayor con el préstamo solicitado, para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 26 year old woman. She lives in a common-law relationship and has one child. Her business is selling personal use products.

She is enterprising, independent, generous, sensible, responsible and hard-working.

Her business takes place in the municipality of Sincelejo which is a strategic area as it has high commercial activity. It is a showcase for the production of small and medium sized business. The area is a sample of the overall state of the city's commerce and industry.

She does her business from her house at various times as she is a housewife.

Her dream is to increase her economic income and open a store. She wants to buy lotions, deodorant and creams wholesale with the requested loan to offer greater variety to her clients and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants and creams wholesale to offer greater variety to her clients and increase sales.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sambath makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Enith Teresa

texts.es:
Enith, a sus 68 años de edad se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y carneros, de manera alterna su labor de ama de casa.

Las labores del campo las aprendió de sus familiares, pues ha sido una tradición que pasa de generación en generación.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de más lechones, carneros y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe por su labor.

Enith tiene como propósito darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, ampliando su capacidad instalada para poder tener más producción y generar una mayor rentabilidad, que le permita independizarse completamente y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enith, 68, earns a living by raising and selling pigs and rams. She alternates this occupation with her household chores.

She learned farming from her relatives as this type of work has been a family tradition, passing on from generation to generation.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase more piglets, rams, and feed concentrate for the animals. This purchase will allow her to increase her production, and improve her sales and her income.

Enith aims to continue with her occupation and expand her business so that she can increase her production and generate more profits. In this way, she will be able to become financially self-sufficient and provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets, rams, and feed concentrate for the animals—a purchase that will allow her to increase her production.

loans.name: Cesar Aristides

texts.es:
Cesar, es un hombre que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura, inicia a trabajar desde muy temprano hasta las 2 ó 3 de la tarde, el manifiesta que este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su padre que se lo enseño desde muy pequeño.
Él solicita un crédito para la compra de abono fortalecer el cultivo de maíz, también para hacerle unas mejoras a la carreta que utiliza con bueyes, Cesar busca obtener una buena cosecha de maíz y en cuanto a su carreta le ayudara a tener más ingresos, ya que en vista que la es una zona rural, esto le permite presta servicios de trasporte de artículos diferentes con su carreta.
Como todo hombre responsable Cesar quiere obtener los ingresos necesarios para poderle dar una mejor calidad de vida y un buen futuro a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a man who lives with his wife and his two children. He works in agriculture. He starts work very early and works until 2 or 3 in the afternoon. He states that he learned this trade thanks to his father who taught him when he was very young.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure to strengthen his corn crop and also to make improvements on his oxen cart. Cesar is looking for a better corn harvest and the cart helps him to have more income. It is a rural area and this allows him to offer transportation service for different products in his cart.

As any responsible man would Cesar wants to obtain the income necessary to provide a better quality of living and a good future for his wife and his children.

loans.use: to buy manure to strengthen his corn crop and also to make improvements on his oxen cart.

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en:
Khern’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khern works as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en:
Chrep’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chrep makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as a factory laborer construction worker and furniture maker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Reoun's Group

texts.en:
Reoun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Reoun makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane, 39, has a passion for painting. She is Lebanese and living with her husband and their two children in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon. She graduated from the Institute of Arts 15 years ago and has been painting and selling her art since. She even participates in local exhibitions in her hometown in which she showcases her paintings and sculptures.

Imane paints on foam board and gypsum board as well as other materials. Her clients see her as a very talented and professional artist.

For the first time, Imane is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to upgrade her painting tools. She believes that by investing in new tools and equipment, she will be able to finish her work in less time and in better conditions.

Imane's husband is an employee, and their two daughters still go to school. She is very ambitious and by improving her sales, she aims at supporting her husband in providing the family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy painting tools.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 78 years old. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She and her husband, who passed away, raised their 11 children with agriculture.

Juana continues to work with enthusiasm and dedication in her field of organic mangoes. She needs a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and increase her production. With the income, she will improve the education of her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and increase her organic mango production.

loans.name: Ma. Anabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Anabelle lives in Trinidad, Bohol. This town is three hours by bus from Tagbilaran City, which is the capital of Bohol. Ma. Anabelle has established a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years now in this place. From this business, she usually earn PHP 5,000 per month to support the needs of her four children aged 2 to 17.

She is asking for a loan to buy sachet items of Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits, and to pay for school fees and a sack of rice for consumption

Ma. Anabelle works hard in order to give support to her husband, who is a farmer.

In the future, she believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income. And she hopes that she can continually send her children to school so that they will be able to gain a higher level of learning for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy sachet items of Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food and biscuits, and pay for school fees and a sack of rice for consumption.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is from Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines. She is a hardworking woman who raise hogs for a living. This has been her business for 10 years now. Not only is she raising hogs, but also a sow with piglets. Manuela likes to take care of her animals, especially when they produce piglets; however, it also creates a challenge on her part for the expense of feed. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, pay for repair of her barn and buy one sack of rice for family consumption.

The loan will allow her to buy in bulk for feed and not on a per kilo basis, which is more expensive. Manuela has high hopes for the future and anticipates a better return on her investment. Her income will give her enough to buy herself and her husband healthy meals, and to save and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed, repair the barn and buy a sack of rice for family consumption.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 50-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Yasmeen has also been running a business of clothes selling for the past two years, and contributes her income to her husband's to manage the household.

Yasmeen needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in a position to buy these clothes for her business purpose, therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Dúo Patricia De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Patricia de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es doña Patricia, quien es casada y madre de dos niños, tiene 34 años de edad.  Vive en la calle principal de su pueblo y tiene una venta de regalos para toda ocasión, ropa de tela variada para dama, caballeros, niños desde hace 4 años, también vende ropa de bebe en varios colores y estilos.  Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que esta arrendando en el mercado del pueblo.  Las fechas de cierre escolar se aproximan y desea estar preparada con todo tipo de regalos de graduación  para sus clientes.  El dinero no le alcanza  y por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar todo tipo de regalos un poco de ropa y así no quedarles mal  a sus clientes en esas fechas de venta.
texts.en:
Patricia is in charge of the Patricia de San Pedro Duo. She is married and has two children. She is 34 years old. She lives on the main street of her town. She has a business where she sells gifts for all occasions, as well as clothing of various materials for women, men, and children aged 4 and up. She also sells baby clothing in various colors and styles. 

Her dream is to have her own store, because right now she is renting a space in her town market. The schools will be closing soon, and she wants to be prepared with all types of graduation gifts for her customers. She does not have enough money for this, and will need a loan to buy all kinds of gifts, and some clothing, so that she will keep her customers pleased during these high-sales times.

loans.use: to buy gifts and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is married to a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. They have three dependents, aged 12, 16 and 18. Nilda helps her husband by preparing his fishing equipment. She also buys and sells dried fish in her community. 

She is asking for a loan as an additional capital for more dried fish to buy and then sell, taking advantage of the high demand in their place. Nilda hopes that out of her loan, she can increase her stocks and not run out of dried fish for orders. Nilda makes it her priority to provide for her children's need in school.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mt. Elijah School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Samuel. He is the Head teacher of Mt. Elijah Junior School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Seeta in Mukono with 350 students. Mt. Elijah Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of it's budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mt. Elijah Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Samuel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance, by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañera, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace un año comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de venta de ropa en un local ubicado en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Manuel busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa y accesorios para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Manuel tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Manuel is in a relationship and has two children whose quality of life he ensures with his business. He aims to generate an income to contribute economically, together with his partner, so to improve the economic condition of the household and make sure they can have a full life.

A year ago, with a lot of hard work, he started a business selling clothes from premises in the town of Sincelejo.

As his customer base is increasing and requesting more and more products, Manuel is requesting a loan to buy a selection of clothing and accessories, to offer his customers a larger selection of products.

This loan will give Manuel's business a great boost, as it will improve his inventory and his sales.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothing and accessories, to offer his customers a larger selection of products.

loans.name: All Saints Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Steven. He is the head teacher of All Saints Junior School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mukono with 504 students. All Saints Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

All Saints Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Steven ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Me Ama Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios me Ama 
Este dúo está integrado por Levita ella es originaria de Itzapa y es casada y madre de familia, doña Levita tiene 9 hijos es costurera y tejedora además de que ella y su esposo se dedican a sembrar distintas verduras, necesitada de capital para poder comprar telas y elaborar delantales típicos que luego lo vende en tiendas de ropa típica, gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien y ya es reconocida en el pueblo por elaborar delantales muy bonitos,  agradece a kiva por la ayuda  que está segura le brindara es el primer crédito que solicita y se hace responsable de pagar puntualmente, ya que es una gran ayuda los créditos que kiva otorga, además le ayudara a que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean personas profesionales.
texts.en:
The Dios me Ama duo includes Levita. She is originally from Itzapa, is married and is a mother of 9 children. She is a seamstress and a weaver. In addition, she and her husband grow various vegetables.

She needs capital to be able to buy materials and create traditional Guatemalan aprons, that she then sells in traditional clothing stores. Thanks to God, this has gone very well for her, and she is now recognized in her town for making very beautiful aprons. She is thankful to Kiva for the help that she surely will receive. This is the first loan that she is requesting, and she will be responsible for paying on time because the Kiva loans are a great help. In addition, she will help her children to stay in school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to create traditional weavings to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean’s previous loan with Center for Community Transformation (CCT) really helped her rug-making business. On a daily basis, she is now able to buy a large quantity of used clothes for making rugs.
