Though profit is not that drastic compared to other businesses, still, hard work and patience are her strengths in keeping the business. She also works alone, since she doesn’t have any assistants in making rugs.

Profit on this business’ line is just sufficient for her to support their day-to-day living. Since the business is growing, she is now planning to hire employees to produce a greater number of outputs. She applied for a PHP 15,000 loan that she will use as a revolving fund for the salary of employees.

Mary Jean aims to nurture her current source of living and dreams to invest in her own house someday.

On a weekly basis, Mary Jean regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her experience with the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to establish a revolving fund for the salary of employees whom she will hire.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena, 39 years old, is a mother of two schooling children. She has been running a food business, commonly known as a mamalishe, for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and is able to make a good profit each month.

Through hard work, she has managed to earn enough to pay for household expenses, loan repayments, and school fees. In the coming years, she would like to build a house for her family. 

Zuwena will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business. This is her second loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she repaid successfully, to buy food items, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and charcoal.
She dreams of building her own house.

Zuwena will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her café business.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio is 57 years old, and a long-time member of CCT, Silang, Cavite. He is married to Josefina, and they have three children. One is in high school, one is in elementary and the other one is already working. Eligio has been driving a jeepney for eight years already to provide for his family.

In the Philippines, jeepneys which are originally from American military service during World War II, have been converted into transportation vehicles by making them two meters longer and putting two long upholstered seats in them. Since then jeepneys have become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation.

Regular and proper maintenance of his vehicle is necessary to ensure efficient performance and steady income. In view of this, Eligio is humbly requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to pay for the renewal of registration and maintenance of his jeepney for public transportation. He will be grateful for a positive response, as his jeepney is his only source of income to feed his family and send his children to school.

Eligio hopes to acquire a new jeepney to augment his income so he can continue to send his children to a higher level of education. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for renewal of registration and maintenance of his jeepney for public transportation.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andrés is 55 years old and lives in Tambogrande, Piura. He works with his wife and six children in organic agriculture. They have a plot of organic mangoes.

Andrés needs a loan of $350 for fertilizing their fields and increasing their organic mango production. The additional incomes will be used to improve the education of their children.

loans.use: to fertilize the fields and increase the organic mango production.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio is 48 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes.

Porfirio needs USD 500 as a loan for fertilizing his fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income, he will improve his family’s house.

loans.use: to fertilize the fields and increase the organic mango production.

loans.name: Jonanette

texts.en:
Jonanette is 52 years old, widowed, and a member of CCT's Gen. Trias Branch. Ever since her husband died she has dedicated herself to raising her five children, who are all now working. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life but with her faith and perseverance she came out of it victorious.

Her direct selling of underwear, bags, watches, and t-shirts has earned her not only friends but money for her personal needs and household needs. To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to meet the increasing orders of personal products, especially now that it is school time once again. Your assistance will be highly appreciated.

Jonanette dreams that God will bless her efforts with success so she can own a house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for underwear, bags, watches, and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Samantha

texts.es: Samantha, una mujer trabajadora, tiene 35 años de edad,  ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive con su marido y dos hijos  actualmente, ella  quiere comprar zapatos para venderlos, a vecinos, amigos, familiares y conocidos, de esta manera ella va a obtener ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pagar los materiales de estudio y ayudarle al marido en los gastos de la casa,  este es el  primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Samantha, a hardworking woman, is 35, married and has three children. She currently lives with her spouse and two of her children.

She currently wishes to buy shoes to sell to her neighbors, friends, relatives and acquaintances. This way she gains earnings to improve her family's quality of live, pay for study materials and help her spouse with household costs.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has no other loans through public banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with more facilities, and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

location.town: El peje, Volcán, Buenos Aires, Puntarenas

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and variety of canned goods. He is a 49-year-old married man with no dependents.

For the past 10 years, he has been serving neighbors and local settlers in his place. Nowadays, the demands for basic commodities are on the rise. To cater to his customers' demands, he decided to join CEVI to access a loan.

Loreto has requested a loan to buy assorted stocks like beverages, canned goods and toiletries. These are essential tools that could serve as fuel to his daily operation. He could serve and provide his customers' orders accurately, thus enabling him to improve his earnings and settle his obligation.

Loreto is determined that he could make his future be more productive to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks like beverages, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma. Guadalupe has been a farmer for 10 years now. She toils on the land and grows rice. This serves as the family's main source of income. She is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband has an income that can support the needs of the entire family.

Ma. Guadalupe is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a good harvest and improve her income. In that way, she could be able to provide her family with proper diets and continue to support her children's education.

She is determined that she could be able to seek ways to become more efficient and productive.

loans.use: to  purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Tank Bovu Group

texts.en:
Julius, who is in his late 20s, is single and has no kid. He has been running a retail shop for seven years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Julius's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling water and sodas and restock out-of-stock items in the shop. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to repay the loan, take care of himself, buy a plot of land, and cover household expense. He will use this loan to buy the missing items in his retail shop. He dreams of owning a house and a car and opening a electrical company. 

Julius will share this loan with his loan group, Tanki Bovu, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the missing items in his retail shop.

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja Ana Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer soltera de 23 años de edad, con una linda familia de un hijo de una año, ella y su hijo vive en una comunidad del caserío Yoxaja.
Ana (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia lo necesario, trabaja cultivando café, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 5 años. Ana para obtener mejores ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, esto para obtener al final una buena cosecha de café. Su gran sueño es seguir mejorando los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en: Ana is a 23 year old single woman with a beautiful family.  She and her one year old son live in a community in the village of Yoxaja.  With the desire to improve her income and provide her family with that they need, Ana (the first from the left in the photograph) grows coffee, and she has been engaged in this activity for five years.  With the goals of obtaining a good coffee harvest, and thus better income, Ana has decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer, and pay for labor costs.  Her greatest dream is to continue improving her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Rodiah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rodiah, who is a 50-year-old widow. Rodiah is a housewife and her husband has been a pedicab driver for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rodiah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 21-year-old single lady who works as a cashier in a patisserie for two years. 
Nisrine's income is limited to her monthly salary, thus she can't do most of what she plans for in order to develop her living and social situation.
She is a kind person with an excellent reputation in her region. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the travel expenses of a longed for dream to visit certain Holy Religious places she is looking forward to.
She hopes to improve in her work and get promoted in the future.

loans.use: to pay for visiting Holy Religious places travel expenses.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a 25-year-old single lady who has been working as a sales person in a roastery to make her living and pay for her education tuition expenses for two years.
She works with a limited monthly salary which is not enough for a devoted ambitious person who seeks perfection in everything he does.
To improve and develop her situation, Vanessa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to  buy a special printing machine to start her our graphic designs business.
She hopes to succeed in her domain and establish her well known graphic design company.

loans.use: to buy a special printing machine to start her our graphic designs business.

loans.name: Gonzalez Comercio Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca se ubican comunidades rurales en donde sólo se puede transportar en vehículos particulares o bien, como la mayoría lo hace, en animales de carga como burros o caballos. Estas zonas están generalmente rodeadas de cerros y sembradíos de maíz o caña de azúcar ya que la actividad económica principal es la agricultura.
   En dicha comunidad se integró el grupo llamado González Comercio cuyos integrantes, como refiere el nombre, son comerciantes. Ellos son: Ma. Del Socorro quien vende abarrotes; Lucila, comida; Guadalupe, cosméticos y Adrián quien maneja un taxi. Cabe mencionar que dicha comunidad cuenta con patrocinios de World Vision para que los niños tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
    Don Adrián es actualmente el único varón que integra el grupo y se siente muy contento de tener a su lado compañeras trabajadoras y alegres. Durante 10 años brindó servicio de chofer de un autobús con lo que gano mucha experiencia al volante; después de cinco años cambió de unidad y ahora maneja un taxi. En gran medida su decisión tuvo que ver con el hecho de que anteriormente no tenía tiempo libre para estar con su familia integrada por su esposa Teresa y sus hijas.
   Hoy en día es considerado uno de los mejores taxistas de la zona pues trata amablemente y con mucho respeto a cada uno de sus clientes. “He dedicado varios años de mi vidas tras un volante; estoy satisfecho por tener mi propia unidad y por estar con mi familia” expresó alegremente. Una de las actividades que más le agradan es que se encarga de transportar los maestros que brindan educación a los niños de la comunidad, por ello inicia desde muy temprano con el objetivo de cubrir las necesidades de los pasajeros.
   En esta ocasión invertirá el apoyo de VFMéxico en la compra de bujías, aceite, anticongelante, un gato hidráulico y 4 llantas nuevas para que su unidad esté en óptimas condiciones. El objetivo que tiene en mente es el de adquirir otro taxi el cual pueda rentar con algún trabajador.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de Doña Socorro, Adrián es el único varón en la fotografía.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca, there are rural areas in which a person can only get around in a private car, or as most people do, on pack animals such as donkeys or horses. These areas are usually surrounded by hills and fields of corn or sugar cane, because the primary economic activity is agriculture.

In this community is the group called González Comercio, whose members, as the name implies, work in commerce. They are Socorro who sells groceries; Lucila who sells food; Guadalupe who sells cosmetics; and Adrián who is a taxi driver. It is worth mentioning that this community has sponsorships with World Vision, for the children to have a better quality of life. Adrián is currently the only man in the group, and he is very happy to have hard-working and cheerful partners at his side.

For 10 years, he was a bus driver, which gave him a log of experience behind the wheel. Five years ago, he changed his vehicle and now drives a taxi. The primary reason he made this decision was because previously he did not have free time to spend with his family - his wife Teresa and daughters. Today, he is considered one of the best taxi drivers in the area. He is kind and very respectful to all of his customers.

"I have dedicated several years of my life as a driver. I am satisfied to have my own vehicle and to be with my family", he said happily. One of the activities that he enjoys the most is that he is responsible for transporting the teachers who provide education to the children in the community. For this, he begins work very early to meet his passenger's needs.

Now, he will invest Kiva Field Partner VFMéxico's help to buy spark plugs, oil, antifreeze, a hydraulic jack and 4 new tires to keep his vehicle in optimal condition. The goal that he has in mind is to acquire another taxi, which can be rented by a worker.

* The photograph was taken in Socorro's grocery store. Adrián is the only man in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, oil, antifreeze, a jack and 4 tires.

location.town: La Coraza, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 42-year-old married woman who does domestic work for a living. She engages in a business buying and selling. She sold assorted seashells and crabs to locals in her place.

Jennifer has five children. Her oldest child is 19 while the youngest is 2. Her husband's way of earning an income is fishing.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of clams and crab, and buy a pump boat. These will improve her stocks and attract more buyers to purchase. In that way, it would also help her husband improve the way he transports his daily catch.

Jennifer was successfully paid back her previous loan in full, and now she continues to expand her livelihood with her new loan request.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clams and crab, and buy a pump boat.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. To make a living, she sells food and snacks in her village and she also accepts orders for any kind of occasion. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying ingredients. To meet current demands, she took out a new loan to buy more raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She is happy to say that with this loan she will be able to earn her desired income and to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 42 years old. He is married and blessed with 2 children. He has a retail shop which he has been running for 3 years. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to use the loan to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, salt, tomatoes and detergents for sell and hopes this will enable him to get more income to provide for the needs of his family. 

He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and expand his business. His future hopes and dreams are to open an electrical goods shop and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, salt, tomatoes and detergents for sale and hopes this will enable him to get more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure for his organic mango production.

loans.name: Olrongai Mwangaza S H G Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Naomi, a member of Mwangaza Olrongai S H G in Nakuru County. She is 63 years old, married and blessed with three children. Naomi joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

She does maize and bean farming and also rears goats. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her manage her enterprise well, and hence earn more income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds, fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields, and thus maximize profit. Income from this enterprise will help her meet family basic needs, school fees and medical care. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields, and thus maximize profit.

loans.name: Hugo Enrique

texts.es: Hugo es habitante de Malambo un municipio del departamento del Atlántico y reside en un barrio de esta localidad en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos.  Al quedar cesante, su madre quien toda la vida se ha dedicado al comercio, lo motivó a iniciar una cacharrería y alquiler de mesas y sillas para eventos,  fue el mejor consejo que pudo seguir para lograr tener una estabilidad, garantizar un ingreso seguro y bienestar para su familia.   Hoy en día cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y ha logrado darse a conocer y posicionarse en el sector, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en sillas y mesas necesarias para ampliar su capacidad de servicios. Hugo desea a largo plazo mejorar la imagen de su negocio para dar mucha más credibilidad y captar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Hugo lives in Malambo, a town in the Atlántico district. He lives in a neighborhood here with his spouse and children.

Upon being made unemployed, his mother, who has worked in commerce her whole life, encouraged him to set up a store hiring out tables and chairs for events. It was the best advice he could have followed to gain stability, and to ensure an income and his family's well being. He has now been up and running for a year, and has managed to become well known in the sector.

This is why he is requesting a loan, his first loan from Kiva, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy chairs and tables to expand the service he can provide. In the long term, Hugo wishes to improve the look of his store, to give it more credibility and to attract new customers.

loans.use: to invest in the tables and chairs he needs to expand the service he can provide.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 39 years old and has four children. Jasmin is married and has four children who are in school.

Jasmin is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jasmin has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tarik

texts.en:
Tarik is a young man living in Khan Younis Gaza strip who works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to a open a new business. His idea is to transport the goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw.

A few years ago Tarik Bought a new rickshaw and become well known and also has a loyal customer base. Tarik took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Tarik can work more efficiently and increase his sales also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to make some maintenance for his rickshaw,

loans.name: Las Risueñas Group

texts.es:
En una de las colonias de “La novia del sol” en el estado de Veracruz se ha formado un grupo llamado Las Risueñas ya que sus integrantes siempre están dispuestas a regalar una sonrisa a cualquier persona.  Ellas son: Leonides quien vende zapatos y comida típica; Guillermina, Rosalba y Gloria, cosméticos; Paula, Anai y Rosa, ropa; Erika, Andrés y Reyna, zapatos; Guadalupe, abarrotes; Rafael, perfumes y Anahí, perfumes.
   Anai es madre de dos adolescentes quienes estudian en una escuela de la comunidad por lo que trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos cumplan sus objetivos.  Ellos son su motor principal para continuar adelante y dar siempre lo mejor de sí.  Desde hace 9 años decidió invertir su tiempo en una actividad con la que generara necesarios para solventar todos sus gastos;  así, comenzó con la venta de artículos de plata. Su éxito fue tal que tiempo después integro la veta de productos para el hogar y, finalmente, ropa casual para dama. Algunos de sus clientes esperan hasta que visita sus domicilios, no obstante otros prefieren ser los primeros y en cuanto saben que tiene mercancía nueva acuden a su domicilio.
   Para Anai los préstamos han sido un factor fundamental en su desarrollo junto con el trato especial que brinda al cliente, los precios accesibles, las facilidades de pago y el extenso surtido que ofrece. En esta ocasión planea comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, short, vestidos, aretes, pulseras, cadenas y dijes ya que es lo que más le solicita su clientela. Los objetivos que tiene en mente son el poder ampliar su mercado y continuar solventando la educación de sus hijos. “Pese a cualquier inconveniente, siempre es saludable regalar una sonrisa, la cual puede ser el mejor regalo” expresa con una sonrisa. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Anai quien viste blusa blanca; algunos integrantes se encuentran al pie de la alberca donde suelen refrescarse en los días más calurosos.
texts.en:
In one of the communities of 'La Novia del Sol', in the state of Veracruz, a group was set up called Las Risueñas [the smiling ones], as the members are always ready to give a smile to anyone.

They are: Leonides, who sells shoes and traditional food; Guillermina, Rosalba and Gloria, who sell cosmetics; Paula, Anai and Rosa, who sell clothing; Erika, Andrés and Reyna, who sell shoes; Guadalupe, who sells groceries; and Rafael and Anahí, who sell perfumes.

Anai is a mother to two adolescents who are studying in a school in the community. She works hard to make sure her children can achieve their aims. They are her primary driving force to continue forwards and always give the best of herself.

Nine years ago she decided to invest her time which would earn her what she needed to pay her costs, so, she started selling silverware. She was so successful that she went on to sell products for the home, and finally, casual ladies' clothing. Some of her customers wait for her to visit their homes, however others prefer to be the first to know about her new products and come to her home.

For Anai, loans have been a fundamental factor in her development, together with extra special customer service, accessible prices, payment facilities and the extensive selection of products. On this occasion, she plans to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, earrings, bracelets, chains and pendants, as these are the things most requested by her customers. Her objectives are to expand her sales and to continue to pay for her children's education. "Despite any problems, it is always good to give a smile, which can be the best gift" she says with a smile.

The photo was taken in Anai's patio, who is wearing a blue blouse. Some of the members are standing around the pool where they like to cool off on the hottest days.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, earrings, bracelets, chains and pendants.

loans.name: Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Gloria, who is in her late 40s, is married with three children, two of them are grown up and the other one is still at school. She has been selling treated wood for nineteen years now. She works from 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Gloria's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans to increase the wood stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. She used the profit to pay college fees for her kid, repay the loan, buy a grinding machine, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase the treated wood stock and meet her customers' demands. She dreams of owning a big godown (warehouse) for storing her stocks of wood.

Gloria will share this loan with her loan group, Fahari Yetu, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the treated wood stock and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is thankful that there are people willing to help new entrepreneurs who need financial support. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP allowed her to buy grocery items for her variety store business and increase her daily sales. Paulina wants to thank every lender who participates in the Kiva program. Without their help, she doesn't know how her business would survive, as it’s essential to have a revolving fund to keep the business running and successful.

Paulina wants to establish a savings account for her family’s future and continually support the education of her children. The Lord helps to guide her financially and run her business the right way. Aside from her variety store business, she also operates a motorized tricycle and sells made-to-order foods such as noodles and rice cakes.

Despite being busy managing her businesses, Paulina prays that she will be consistent in attending church service and that God may touch the hearts of the people who read her story. She has applied for another loan of 18,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional grocery items for her variety store. She will use the remaining money as a revolving fund for her food business.

Paulina regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and business experiences, draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her variety store and to have a revolving fund for her food business.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio, un hombre trabajador, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus dos hijos actualmente, él tiene pensado comprar unos novillos para engordarlos y venderlos en la subasta ganadera aprovechando el buen precio que hay en este momento, con las ganancias el mejorara la situación económica y comprara más ganado,   por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito,  este es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja. 
Eugenio, un hombre trabajador, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus dos hijos actualmente, él tiene pensado comprar unos novillos para engordarlos y venderlos en la subasta ganadera aprovechando el buen precio que hay en este momento, con las ganancias el mejorara la situación económica y comprara más ganado,   por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito,  este es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Eugenio is a hardworking 35 year old man.  He is single, and currently lives with his two children.   He plans to buy some calves to fatten and sell at the livestock auction and take advantage of the good prices at this time.  He will use the profits to improve his financial situation, and buy more livestock, which is the reason he is applying for a loan.  This is his first loan with Fudecosur, and he has not applied for loans with state banks because Fudecosur has offered the loan with greater facility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

location.town: Valle del Guabo, Baru, Pérez Zeledón

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Ablavi est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Ablavi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des litres d’huile, des sacs de riz et de maïs en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 40-year old woman living in Baguida. She is married and has four children. Ablavi sells food products, stocking up at the market four times a month and reselling in front of her house as well as an itinerant vendor in nearby neighborhoods. 

Ablavi would like to obtain this loan to stock up on vegetable oil, rice and corn in order to make a profit and increase her revenues, which will allow her to better take care of the family needs.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, 25 liters [6.6 gallons] of oil and one bag of corn.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en: Savorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ry makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rum's Group

texts.en: Rum’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rum makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Dorcas. She is thirty nine years old, married and has three children. Her economic activity is farming maize, beans and potatoes farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enable her prepare for the next planting season. She anticipates a better season with high yields thus more income. This will ensure she goes a long way to cater for family needs.
Dorcas is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.
.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enable her prepare for the next planting season.

loans.name: Kihoto Solai Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Stanley, a member of Kihoto Solai Women group. He is 31 years old, married and blessed with four children. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has undergone thorough enterprise training. Stanley is applying for a loan from Kiva to enable him pay for ploughing that will ensure he prepares adequately for the upcoming planting season. He anticipates a good yield with the early preparations he plans to undertake. He hopes for more maize harvest, and thus an improved income level, making him be in a position to pay school fees for his children and provide food with ease.

Stanley is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for ploughing that will ensure he prepares adequately for the upcoming planting season.

loans.name: Shohzoda

texts.en:
Shohzoda is 19-year-old freshman in the Business Administration program at AUCA. To earn her Bachelor's degree, Shohzoda came from Tajikistan to study in Bishkek. Tajikistan is one of the Central Asian countries which has a weak and unstable economic and political situation. So Shohzoda decided to study at American University as she believes in the effectiveness and modern standards of this system.

Shohzoda became familiar with the American system of education last year, when she spent the 2014-15 academic year in the USA as an exchange student. America so impressed Shohzoda with its way of life, culture and people. It gave Shohzoda new ideas for her future and the belief that she can achieve all her goals by herself by having a good education and trying hard.

According to her words, her family doesn’t have income. Her parents are farmers and have a harvest, which they sell and eat themselves. During the last year in America, Shohzoda was able to save some money from her daily expenses, so now she wants to use it to pay for her tuition fee. She is applying for a Kiva loan to cover the rest of her tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nehmat

texts.en:
Nehmat is a 31-year-old married mother of three, she got employed a year ago as an accountant to support her husband to cover their beloved family's living expenses.
Nehmat's monthly income combined with her husband's are barely enough to cover their family's living needs. Thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for her children school tuition fees.
She hopes to continue developing her family members social and financial situations, in parallel with her job development.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Francisca Delmy

texts.es: Francisca de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 7 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca, 48 years old, lives in her own home with her family. She has worked making and selling tortillas for 7 years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers. She can cover some of the household costs with the earnings that she obtains from her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy lime and corn by the hundredweight in order to continue making tortillas and thus have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lime and corn by the hundredweight.

loans.name: Nyatanga Group

texts.en:
Karim is in his early 30s is married with two children. One is still small and the other ones is in school. He has been running a genge business since 2003. He works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be KARIM's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the genge stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, a cell phone, dag a water well, bought a subwoofer radio and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the genge store. He dreams of owning a motor car.

Karim will share this loan with his loan group Nyatanga which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is a native from the rural town of Talibon, Bohol.  She is married and has four children. Of whom two of her children are still attending school. 
Her main source of income is by raising  hogs. She sold it to local dwellers in her place.
Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

Jelita  wants to continue improve her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to buy piglets and feeds.  These will boost its livelihood  and slowly improve her earnings. She could now able to settle her obligation and handle her finances wisely. She could now continue finance the schooling of her children and provide proper nutrition.

She  used the previous loan to  improve her hog raising business  and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is wise woman who always think for alternative business that she may get greater income. She is 42 years old, married and has two grown children. Through her retailing business, Marivic successfully sends her children in school, and they are working now. Marivic wanted to have savings for their future. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy rice grain, groceries, frozen foods, and meat to sell. Having a faith that selling more goods or products will also increase your income as well.

loans.use: to buy rice, groceries, frozen foods, and meat to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 45-year-old man and a resident of Catigbian, Bohol, in which he earns a living by driving a habal-habal (is motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers in a row, so called because of the way they sit).

Aside from this, he also raises pigs. With this, Nelson works hard through these businesses to provide the needs of his family and to sustain each day. He is asking a loan for motorcycle maintenance and to buy feed for his pigs. In the future, Nelson plans to improve their livelihood for his family. He is a married man and has three children; two adult and one-school-aged child.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance and to buy feed

loans.name: Adarlina

texts.en: Adarlina is engage in horticulture business. She has been in this business for five years. While doing propagating of flowering plants, Adarlina also engage in direct selling business. Adarlina wants to grow more flowering plants so that her costumers will have more choices too. With this, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, and plants to grow and sell. She hopes to gain more customers to buy her plants and earn more as well. She will be use her income to sustain her family daily basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, and plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children. She has a retail shop which she has been running for 8 years. 

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loan amount. She will use the loan to sugar, maize flour, rice, detergents and bread for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family

She will use the generated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her retail shop and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, rice, detergents and bread for sale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is the responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Yasmeen's husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make the taxi maintenance. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. With the profit from her husband's income, Yasmeen also plans to make savings to meet her family's needs in the future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 4 years. Mary Ann earns more income from food vending.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en: Sreyneang’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreyneang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and by selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en: Sovann’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sovann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela works hard to support her family. Marcela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marcela requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marcela has been in this business for 3 years now.

Marcela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like, meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Vilma has been in this business for 3 years. Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like, meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer, seller, and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pureza

texts.en:
Pureza and her husband have two children, and both of them are currently studying in school. She lives Duero, Bohol.

Pureza is 53 years old and runs a small business raising hogs. She also serves as a copra dealer, which gives her a supplemental income.

Pureza has requested a loan from CEVI to buy feed for her hogs and more copra to buy and sell.

Her profit will be utilized for school fees and daily family consumption.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and copra.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 57-year-old widowed woman. She lives in the rural area of Tolosa, Leyte. She has one grown child. She earns a living by operating a tricycle (rickshaw) transportation service, in which the rent of the vehicle is the responsible for the economy of the household. She would like to boost its income.

She is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to buy tools for the tricycle (rickshaw), a tire and pay for repair. In this way she would enhance safety and comfort as it continues to transport passengers. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill future needs as well.

Luzviminda is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy tools for the tricycle (rickshaw), a tire, and pay for repair.

loans.name: El Mañana Group

texts.es:
Visitar cierta comunidad veracruzana es un gran placer ya que se encuentra alejada del ruido de  la ciudad. Los cerros, cañales, árboles de mango y limón, los sembradíos de maíz, papaya y frijol, son sólo algunos de los ejemplos de la riqueza natural que ofrece la región. Los habitantes guardan un profundo amor y respeto por la tierra que los vio nacer y les brinda empleo y alimento.
   Allí se integró un grupo para solicitar el apoyo de VFMéxico para invertir en sus actividades. Lleva el nombre de El Mañana ya que para sus miembros sólo en el futuro se verá reflejado el fruto de su esfuerzo. Ellos son: Verónica, Minerva y María quienes venden comida típica; Emma, refrescos, tamales y tacos; Cándida, agua purificada; Elvira, abarrotes y artículos de papelería; Basilia, comida y refrescos; María M., cerdos, aves de corral y maíz; Flora, pollo y Rosa, maíz.
   Elvira es una mujer sumamente trabajadora quien está casada con Julio, ellos son padres de dos niños quienes, al igual que otros pequeños de la comunidad, cuentan con el patrocinio de World Vision. 
   Elvira se hace cargo de una papelería que abrió junto con su hermano desde hace más de ocho años. La motivación surgió del hecho de que para comprar un lápiz, hojas blancas o cualquier material básico, las personas debían acudir hasta el centro de la ciudad para adquirirlo.  Por lo tanto, adecuó un cuarto dentro de su casa donde exhibe los productos sobre anaqueles que consiguió gracias a sus ganancias; posteriormente decidió incorporar la venta de abarrotes ya que sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan al mejor precio y con el mejor trato.
   Actualmente apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, reinvierte en ambos negocios y, sobre todo, sostiene la educación de sus hijos.  El préstamo que le ha sido otorgado lo invertirá en la compra de  arroz, frijol, azúcar, sopa, café, atún, galletas, botanas, refresco, libretas, colores, lápices, lapiceros, etc. continuando así con un extenso surtido. Ahora tiene como objetivo ampliar su local para aumentar su mercancía. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Elvira quien viste una blusa de tirantes; los tres niños que se observan reciben el patrocinio de World Vision.
texts.en:
Visiting this community in Veracruz is a great pleasure as it is far from the noise of the city. The hills, waterways, mango and lemon trees, and fields of corn, papaya and beans are just some of the examples of the natural richness that the region has to offer. The inhabitants hold a deep love and respect for the earth that gives them life, work and food.

A group was set up her to request help from VFMéxico to invest in their work. Their name is El Mañana [the future], because, for its members, it is only in the future that the fruits of their labors will be seen. They are: Verónica, Minerva and María, who sell traditional food; Emma, who sells soft drinks, tamales and tacos; Cándida, who sells purified water; Elvira, who sells groceries and stationary goods; Basilia, who sells food and drinks; María M., who sells pigs, farmyard birds and corn; Flora, who sells chicken, and Rosa, who sells corn.

Elvira is a hardworking woman who is married to Julio. They are parents to two children who, along with the other youngsters in the community, rely on support from World Vision.

Elvira has a stationary store which she opened together with her sister over eight years ago. The motivation came from the fact that to buy a pencil, plain paper or any other basic materials, people had to go all the way to the center of the city. So, she adapted a room in her house to display the products on shelves that she obtained thanks to her earnings. She subsequently added grocery sales as her customers were able to find what they needed for the best price and with the best service.

She currently supports her husband with the household costs, reinvests in both her businesses, and, most importantly, sustains her children's education. This loan will be to buy rice, beans, sugar, soup, coffee, tuna, cookies, snacks, notebooks, colors, pencils, pencil cases etc. so she can maintain her extensive range. She now wishes to expand her premises to increase her stock.

The photo was taken at Elvira's business. She is wearing a fitted blouse.
The three children in the photo receive support from World Vision.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, soup, coffee, tuna, cookies, snacks, notebooks, colors, pencils, and pencil cases.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 6 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be floods. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a well educated family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 49 years old and sells fruits and vegetables. She is single and blessed with 6 children. She has been in the business for 7 years and it has been profitable. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan buy oranges, bananas and vegetables for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income pay school fees for her children. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and provide for her family's needs. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and vegetables for sale and hopes this will enable her to make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Januaris

texts.en:
Januaris is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. His business is photography, farming and livestock keeping. He has been in the business for five years.

He earns a monthly income of twenty two thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

He will use the profits from expanded business to increase his savings as well as educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosario has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ferrous

texts.en:
Ferrous is a married man with three children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks such as Coca Cola, Sprite, 7up, Pepsi cola and other drinks. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals.

He is in need of a loan sum of 1500 GHS to buy more drinks to satisfy his customers. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his four loan with ID-Ghana. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to satisfy his customers demand.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 28 years old. She is divorced and and lives in Gori district alone. She works at a local shop as a saleslady and has a small monthly income. Mariam decided to open a shoe shop in Gori district. She already has a commercial space and needs money to purchase shoes.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 5,000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase women's and men's shoes and will open a shoe shop. Mariam is experienced in this business; she has worked at the shop for years and hopes that her new business will be profitable for her. Mariam awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter in Arjut village of Lori region. Melany has higher pedagogical education and already 27 years she works at that sphere. She is at the school as a teacher of physics. She also gives paid private courses of her subject for the pupils who are going to have entrance exams. She mentions that with each pupil’s achievements she becomes very happy and pleased that she managed to help each of them to learn such an interesting but rather hard subject, which is one of the most useful subjects, since with the rules of it we face each moment and during the whole our life.

Melanya’s husband is a farmer, her daughter is also a teacher like her mother and her son is married and lives with his family. Melanya asks this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams as she greatly wants to buy a computer and also some professional literature for her self-development activities that each pedagogue needs so much.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some professional literature for her self-development activities that each pedagogue needs so much

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat, age 42, is a married woman shown in the photo with her husband who is involved in the business of movie making and photography. He has been doing this for many years.

He has become popular in his community for capturing events like wedding and parties. Through his income he is able to provide his family with the basic necessities of life.

Now for serving more customers, he needs to purchase another camera of better quality and a reflection umbrella. That is why Musarat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase another camera of better quality as well as a reflection umbrella to serve more customers.

loans.name: Merri

texts.en:
Merri is an active borrower of BRAC, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Merri has been running her own beauty salon for the past 12 years. She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore Merri has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Merri is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 43 years old. She is a responsible mother of seven children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of eight persons. She is well-trained with computer and printer skills. She is a very hardworking woman. She needs to buy a computer and a printing machine. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Asia is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer for herself.

loans.name: Sreymech's Group

texts.en: Sreymech’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymech makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a higher-educated person. She is married and has three children. Jamila’s husband is Umed. He is a master of repairing houses. Jamila works in a local school as a teacher of Tajik language and literature. She is a clever woman and likes her job. Jamila always tries to have her lessons be interesting and useful. She is asking for a loan because her daughter is ill now. Jamila must go to the doctor with her daughter as soon as possible. Jamila and her daughter await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam,39, is married and a mother to five children, and they are still in the school. One of her children is appearing in the photo instead her because she is conservative woman. Her husband is retired ‎with low pension thus making her the family's breadwinner. She has worked hard to build her own business ‎which is a grocery to provide living for her family.‎
‎
She is requesting for a loan to buy groceries for her shop such as soft drinks, chips, and chocolate etc. ‎More stock for her shop will mean more variety hence increase sales.
‎
Her ambition is to grow her business and leave her children with better opportunities.‎

loans.use: to buy groceries for her shop such as soft drinks, chips, and chocolate … etc

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia , a 50-year-old woman from the town of Garcia, Bohol, is into selling snacks and charcoal. She is married with two dependents, ages eight and fifteen. Her husband is a laborer.

Claudia spends her time selling tempura, cooked vegetable soup, hot dogs, and pancakes. In addition to this, she would like to start a hog raising business.

She is asking for a loan to buy food containers, two piglets and feed for them. With additional capital, she will have a chance to expand her business and thus anticipate a better income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy food containers, two piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures but not having the ability to meet them compelled Haleema to initiate her own business selling animals. She is a 38-year-old married woman who has been doing a business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of seven children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita is a married woman and has five children, ages 2 to 19 years old respectively. She runs a general store selling commodities like rice, coffee, cooking oil, shampoo, sugar, powdered milk, noodles, assorted canned goods and soft drinks. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her husband also has an income that can help support the family's daily expenses.

She has been running a store for more than 10 years now. She wanted to boost the stock in her store and improve her earnings.

Genelita decided to join CEVI to access loans to buy additional stock like beverages, condiments, rice, soft drinks and edible oil. Thus, she would be able to serve her respective customers well. In that way, she would be able to gain profits and continue to provide her entire family with proper diets.

In the future, Genelita is looking forward to managing her business properly to continue to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like beverages, condiments, rice, soft drinks and edible oil.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two. He operates a general store in his village and his wife oversees the retail store while Paul works in a private company. Paul needs to add inventory capital to increase his sales because his business is one of the sources of income that absolutely supports his children's needs. Paul joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. He hopes that in the future, his business will be prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in a retail store.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 24-year-old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family.

Riffat earns income by providing sewing services. She contributes this to her husband's income to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods for her business purposes such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. However, due to insufficient financial means, Riffat is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, Riffat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items for her tailoring business such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Mawuko

texts.fr: Mère  de deux enfants, Mawuko est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida. Agée de 32 ans, Mawuko produit des gâteaux faite à base de la farine de blé généralement appelé « Africa Tenis ».  Mawuko s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Mawuko sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine de blé en vue de bien satisfaire les attentes des clients puis soutenir son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mawuko is a married woman with two children who lives in Baguida. She is 32 years old and works making wheat flour  cookies popularly known as "African Tennis" cookies/biscuits. She stocks up once a month at the market and sells her  products as an itinerant vendor. 

Mawuko is seeking this loan to stock up bowls of wheat flour in order to meet customer demand and help her husband provide for their children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of wheat flour.

loans.name: Rufaro Group

texts.en:
In 2008, during the economic crisis, Grace’s husband became a pensioner since he had reached his retirement age. Considering the situation, Grace had to find the means to take care of the family.

She got some money from her husband’s redundancy package and she decided to venture into poultry and then bought a batch of 100-day-old chicks. She managed to sail though all hardships in that era and approached Thrive in September 2013 for a loan as a group, named Rufaro, translated to English as ‘Happiness’.

The group attended training and Grace was elected by the group to be the Chairperson, taking into account her leadership qualities. Since she was 61 by then, she was taking an advisory and leadership role in the group.

Grace managed to improve her broiler business in terms of capacity. At that time she had 200 birds and then ventured into layers. She collects two crates of eggs since the layers are at their early stages of laying.

Age is a barrier to Grace but she remains very hardworking. Her business is growing at an increasing rate and she plans to employ one or two people for assistance in feeding and in the cleaning of the fowl runs.

Her family has managed to survive on this business, and from the profits she has extended her fowl runs and repainted her house. Now she needs to remodel the old fowl runs so that they can properly house the layers and broilers, and so she needs extra capital.

As a group they are applying for a combined loan of $3,000 and Grace will use her portion for the renovations. She will also buy more layers, because eggs are now in demand as the festive season approaches and people feel the need to indulge in luxuries they could not usually afford.

loans.use: to improve her fowl run and buy more layers for egg production.

loans.name: Banita Vitendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Nicholas, a member of Banita Vitendo Self Help Group. He is 47 years old, married and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Nicholas is a farmer who farms maize and beans. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he was not able to keep his farming records. However, after undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management he developed proper recordkeeping skills and knowledge on market analysis. He also diversified from tailoring to operating a retail shop and mixed farming, and now grows maize, beans and vegetable and rears chickens.

He is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer and seeds to increase his farm produce. Consequently this will increase his income from the sale of maize and beans to his customers. He hopes this extra income will enable him to cater for his family needs such as food, shelter and school fees for his children. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to increase his farm produce, which will consequently increase income from the sale of maize and beans to his customers.

loans.name: Pipeline Stable Group

texts.en:
The Lady in the photo is Mary. She is twenty-five years old and married with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does a farming business of maize and beans. She gained knowledge through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise start up and development. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds that will help boost farming. This will improve her income and hence she will be in a position to pay school fees for her children and continue supporting her family needs, thus improving their standard of living.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Dúo San Andrés Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Andrés
Este dúo está integrado por Hermelinda ella es originaria de San Andrés 
Itzapa es casada y madres de familia Hermelinda tiene 5 hijos la más pequeña tiene 5 años y también está estudiando, Hermelinda y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura además que su esposo es albañil, ella necesita de capital para poder abonar la milpa y el frijol que ha sembrado además del güicoy que esta por empezar, este año afecto la sequía por lo que no lograron sacar lo cosecha que les ayudaría a comprar abono para el cultivo que quedaba, por lo que acuden a kiva para que les brinde la ayuda, es el primer crédito que solicitan y se comprometen a ser responsables
texts.en:
Dúo San Andrés

One of the members of this duo is Hermelinda. She is from San Andrés Iztapa, is married, and has five children. Her youngest child is five years old and is in school.

Hermelinda and her husband earn a living by working in agriculture. Her husband also works as a builder.

She needs capital to invest in fertilizers for the corn and bean crops that she has already sown and for the zucchini that she is about to plant. This year, the area was affected by the drought, and they weren't able to save the harvest that would help them buy fertilizers for their remaining crops. For this reason they are turning to Kiva for help.

This is their first loan, and they are committed to be responsible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Las Campanitas Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad veracruzana es célebre por sus tradiciones y costumbres; además, la calidez de sus habitantes sólo es comparable con la del clima que se presenta durante todo el año. Está ubicada muy cerca de uno de los ríos más importantes de la República Mexicana y de allí son originarias catorce mujeres trabajadoras que conforman un grupo llamado Las Campanitas. 
   Las integrantes de dicho grupo son: Laura y María R. quienes venden ropa; Guadalupe, cobijas y recipientes de plástico; Delia, plata y cosméticos; Tomasa, abarrotes; María, comida típica; Ana, verduras; Mariela, recipientes y artículos de plata; Elodia, abarrotes y comida; Karla y Sandra, productos de habitación; Benita, maíz; Amada, lencería y Carmela quien maneja un club nutricional. 
   Ana  es una joven que desde hace un año decidió formar una familia con Filio, su esposo, y desea pronto tener la dicha de ser madre. De igual modo, decidió emprender un negocio de venta de verduras con el firme propósito de aportar ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Así pues, desde hace más de cinco años se ha mantenido al frente del puesto que día con día le brinda nuevas satisfacciones. Asimismo, trabaja como niñera para complementar sus ganancias y, sobre todo, para no descuidar los estudios que actualmente cursa. 
   Hoy en día, gracias a sus ganancias, ahorros y préstamos otorgados por VFMéxico  ha podido enriquecer su negocio con la compra de una variedad significante de productos. Es admirable ver como exhibe toda su mercancía sobre los anaqueles que ella y su esposo construyeron. 
   En esta ocasión desea emplear el apoyo para comprar jitomate, cebolla, chiles y huevos por mayoreo, esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta principal es ampliar su puesto e integrar la venta de abarrotes y pollo para posicionarse como la mejor comerciante de la zona. Finalmente expresa, “gracias por una nueva oportunidad de desarrollarnos económicamente”.
*Ellas son las integrantes de Las Campanitas; la fotografía fue tomada en “La novia del sol”, Ana está sentada sobre un pozo y viste una blusa azul.
texts.en:
Veracruz is a community famous for its traditions and customs. In addition, the warmth of its people is matched only by the weather that occurs throughout the year. It is located very close to one of the most important rivers in Mexico, and from this area are fourteen native working women who form a group called “Las Campanitas” [The Bells].
The members of this group are Laura and Mary R. who sell clothes; Guadalupe, blankets and plastic containers; Delia, silver and cosmetics; Tomasa, groceries; Mary, typical food; Ana, vegetables; Mariela, containers and silverware; Elodia, groceries and food; Karla and Sandra room products; Benita, corn; Amada, lingerie and Carmela who runs a nutrition club.
A year ago, Ana, a young woman, decided to start a family with Filio, her husband, and she wishes that she will soon have the good fortune of being a mother. Similarly, she decided to start a business selling vegetables with the firm intention of providing revenue to cover her household expenses. So, for more than five years, she has remained in front of her sales stand because it brings new satisfaction every day. She also works as a nanny to supplement their income and, above all, not to neglect courses in which she is currently enrolled.
Today, thanks to earnings, savings and loans from VFMéxico, she has been able to enrich her business with the purchase of a significant variety of products. It is admirable to see how she displays all her merchandise on the shelves that she and her husband built.
At this time, she wants to use the support to buy wholesale tomatoes, onions, peppers, and eggs. This will allow her to meet customer demand. Her main goal is to expand her stand and integrate selling groceries and chicken to position herself as the best dealer in the area. Finally she says, "thanks for a new opportunity to develop financially."
* They are the members of “Las Campanitas” [The Bells]. The photograph was taken in “La Novia del Sol” [Bride of the Sun]. Ana is sitting on a well and wearing a blue blouse.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, peppers, and eggs.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 43 years old. She is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Silus

texts.en: Silus is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a retail business where he sells soda. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.
